loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.en:
The Oñondivepa Committee was formed thanks to the desire to better and overcome their low socio-economic status, since the woman of this committee are people of very limited resources.
   They receive an average of 400,000 Guaraníes and they use it to buy and then sell a wiD. range of things including: flour, eggs, oil, meats, condiments, milk, sugar, herbs, salt, vegetables, melons, watermelon, bananas, oranges, and a variety of fruits.  
Furthermore, they buy and sell second hand clothing, footwear, dairy products, etc. to try to increase their incomes and better their way of life.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, oil, meats, condiments, milk, sugar, herbs, salt, and others.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es: Felicita tiene 65 años, comparte su vida junto a sus 6 hijos, a quienes siempre trató de brindar lo necesario para su desarrollo, ya que al quedar viuda tuvo que asumir nuevas responsabilidades y roles dentro de su casa. Trabajar en diversas actividades le dio la posibilidad de adquirir y construir otras casas en su localidad, por lo que se inició en el alquiler de viviendas, pues es uno de los negocios más rentables en su localidad, debido a la gran demanda que hay en su distrito. Es así que desde hace 5 años se dedica a realizar las cobranzas mensuales a sus inquilinos, quienes son muy puntuales y por ello trata de brindarles las condiciones necesarias y cómodas. Para ello, desea instalar algunos servicios adicionales y mejorar la fachada de las habitaciones y construir algunos  cuartos adicionales para alquilarlos a personas solteras. Por tal motivo, Felicita trata de ampliar su casa, para que en el futuro implemente una casa de hospedaje, la cual le produzca mayores ingresos económicos que posibiliten la mantención de su tan numerosa familia. Este es su primer crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA y espera seguir formando parte de la gran cantidad de socias que hay en la institución, tratando de mostrar siempre responsabilidad y compromiso. Los 3000 soles que viene solicitando le permitirán invertir en la ambientación y construcción de nuevas habitaciones para alquilar.
texts.en:
Felicita is 65 years old. She has always given of herself for her 6 children and has tried to provide what is best for them. As a widow, she has learned to assume new responsibilities and roles within her home. Working in different businesses gave her the opportunity to acquire and construct other homes in her area. She began renting out apartments, which is one of the most profitable businesses in her area due to the high demand for housing in her district. For the past 5 years, she has handled the monthly billing to her tenants, who are very punctual. She seeks to provide them with the necessary conditions to make them comfortable.

Felicita would like to install additional bathrooms, improve the exterior façade, and build additional units that can be rented out to single tenants. Therefore, she wants to enlarge her building so that she can convert it into a lodging house in the future. This will not only provide her with great financial returns, but it will also help numerous families secure housing. Felicita is taking out her first loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA and hopes to remain part of a larger group of members involved with the Institution who demonstrate responsibility and commitment. Her loan of 3000 soles will be used to remodel existing rooms and construct new rooms for rent.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of new rental rooms & remodeling of existing ones

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: Patricia tiene 3 hijos menores de edad, con quienes vive junto a su esposo en su casa, la cual esta en plena construcción. Desde muy joven empezó a trabajar por las diversas necesidades que tenía dentro de su hogar, de esta forma logra independizarse y obtener experiencia en la actividad de la costura, la cual desempeña desde hace 15 años. Fruto de su trabajo son las máquinas de costura que pudo comprar, las cuales le facilitan el trabajo. Patricia trabaja en su casa durante todo el día, según la cantidad de pedidos que reciba de las fábricas y dentro de sus múltiples actividades también trata de elaborar prendas propias para venderlas a sus vecinos y parientes. Ahora Patricia se está proyectando para vender sus propios diseños en los mercados de su localidad, por tal motivo está tratando de mejorar su taller de costura para convertirlo en el futuro en una micro empresa familiar donde sus hijos tengan un apoyo económico - laboral. Este es su 12avo crédito con MFP, ella nos comenta que lo que más le gusta del trabajo con su banco comunal es que todas sus compañeras son puntuales en sus pagos, y esto fomenta el progreso del grupo. Los 1300 soles que solicita serán invertidos en la compra de materiales textiles que requiere para la entrega de sus últimos pedidos.
texts.en:
Patricia is married and has 3 young children. Her home is currently under construction. She began working from a young age in order to meet the various needs of her household, find a way to achieve her independence, and gain experience as a seamstress. Patricia started her business 15 years ago. As a result of her hard work, she was able to buy sewing machines to help make her job easier.

Patricia works from home all day, fulfilling the orders she receives from factories and also designing her own clothing that she sells to neighbors and relatives. She now plans to develop her own clothing line to market to stores in the area. In order to do this, she plans to expand her sewing workshop by converting it in the future into a family microbusiness that provides her children employment and financial support.

This will be Patricia’s 12th loan with MFP. She says she likes working with her Communal Bank because all of the members make their payments on time, which helps the group get ahead. Her loan of 1300 soles will be used to purchase textile materials needed to fulfill her latest orders.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase textile materials

loans.name: Arco Iris Group

texts.es:
This committee was formed by Mrs. Juana R. when she found out about the Fundación through a friend who was already a part of the Mujeres Emprendedoras committee.  

One of the ladies of the group is Mrs. Laura C.. She is 44-years-old, has 3 children, and is a single parent who has sacraficed a great deal for her family, having to play the role of both mother and father.  She sells fruit in the Mariscal Lopez and Gral Santos area of Asunción.  At 4am she goes to the market to get the fruit. For the last 10 years she has had the same stand.  She works from 7am to 11am.  Her oldest son helps her and cooks lunch for the family.  She says thanks to this program she is moving forward.  

All the others ladies work in diffrents tipes of activities like: food sale, clothes and shoes sale, grocery store, cosmetics and make up sales, etc.

loans.use: to invest in their activities

loans.name: Divino Niño Group

texts.es:
Divino Niño es un comité  lleva ya un año trabajando con créditos de la Fundacion Paraguaya. Cuenta con 20 integrantes de las cuales podemos hablar de dos integrantes del mismo.

La Sra Julia G. posee un pequeño kiosko que inicio hace seis meses con la ayuda de su marido. Ella vende golosinas jugos gaeosas,comidas frias etc ingreso en el comie con la idea de ampliar su pequeño negocito.
La Sra Margarita R. es una mujer muy sacrificada ella es vrendedora de hamburguesas empanadas y bebidas por las tardecitas hasta muy tarde de la noche y de dia tiene ventas de ropas por los alrededores de su casa.
Es un comité nuevo pero con ganas de superarse espremos lo logren. Las demas intengrantes se dedican a las siguientes actividades:


Julia Azucena G. 	Vta de comestibles
Margarita R.	Vta de merceria
Neide C.	costurera
Romina R.  	Peluquera
Pablina R. 	Vta de comestibles

Maura P.	Vta de articulos de limpieza 
 Carmen F.	Limpiadora
Mari C.	Decoradora
Juana C. 	Venta de ropas
Virginia V.	Modista
Elvira A.	Venta de ropas
Maria R.	cocinera
Selva Pintos	Vta de articulos de limpieza
Maria V. R.  	Peluquera
Deysi O.  	Vta de cosmeticos 
Petrona R.	Vta de Comestible
Antonia R.	Vta de lenceria
Maria Luisa R.	Vta de comestibles
Mercedes V.	Vta de ropas
Edy Graciela B.	Vta de art. de limpieza
texts.en:
The Divino Niño Committee has been working with loans from Fundación Paraguaya for one year. The group has 20 members and we were able to speak with 2 of them.

Sra. Julia G. has been operating a small kiosk from home for the past six months with the help of her husband. She sells candy, sodas, juices, frozen foods, etc. With her loan, she hopes to expand her small business.

Sra. Margarita R. is a self-sacrificing woman. She sells hamburgers, empanadas, and drinks in the early evenings until very late at night. She also sells clothing in the neighborhoods around her home.

This is a new committee that hopes to grow and succeed. The other members are engaged in the following activities:

Julia Azucena G. sells groceries Margarita R. sells sewing supplies and clothing Neide C. is a seamstress Romina R. is a hairdresser Pablina R. sells groceries Maura P. sells cleaning supplies Carmen F. offers cleaning services Mari C. is an interior designer Juana C. sells clothing Virginia V. makes dresses Elvira A. sells clothing Maria R. is a cook Selva Pintos sells cleaning supplies Maria V. R. is a hairdresser Deysi O. sells cosmetics Petrona R. sells groceries Antonia R. sells lingerie Maria Luisa R. sells groceries Mercedes V. sells clothing Edy Graciela B. sells cleaning supplies

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise & supplies

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel tiene 57 años de edad, es casado, y vive junto a su esposa y sus cuatro hijos en el distrito de Pucalá, un distrito agrícola dedicado al cultivo y procesamiento de caña de azúcar y que está ubicado a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El se dedica al oficio de sastrería desde 1970, y, desde 1981 tiene un pequeño puesto en el mercado del distrito en donde trabaja todos los días para ganar el sustento de su familia; el trabaja en base a contratos, y luego compra los materiales necesarios para realizar su trabajo, durante todos estos años ha logrado conseguir una clientela fija que gusta de su responsabilidad y de la eficacia de su trabajo.

Debido a que el número de contratos está creciendo y el no puede comprar el material necesario, ya que está invirtiendo en la educación de sus hijos, el está solicitando a nuestra Institución un crédito de 1300 nuevos soles para ampliar su negocio con la compra de material (telas, hilos, etc.)

Daniel desea ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales y también crear un taller mas grande con la compra de otras máquinas de coser para así cubrir su amplia demanda y a la vez ofrecer trabajo a personas necesitadas.

El ya ha trabajado con nosotros anteriormente en tres oportunidades y ha demostrado ser una persona responsable en sus pagos por lo que es considerado como un cliente excelente.
texts.en:
Daniel is 57 years old, married, and lives with his wife and four children in the district of Pucalá, an agricultural area dedicated to growing and processing sugar cane which is located 40 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo .

He has worked as a tailor since 1970, and since 1981, has maintained a small market stall in the district where he works every day to earn a living for his family. Daniel works on contract, and then purchases the necessary materials to fulfill his orders. All these years he has managed to build a regular customer base that likes the quality of his work and his demonstrated responsibility.

His contracts are increasing, but he is not able to buy the necessary materials because he needs to invest in his children’s education. He is requesting a loan from our Institution in the amount of 1300 soles to purchase materials (fabrics, threads, etc.).

Daniel wants to see his children become professionals. He also wants to expand his workshop by purchasing sewing machines to meet the increased demand and provide his services to those who need them.

He already has worked with us on three previous occasions and has proved to be a responsible person in making his payments, thereby making him an excellent client.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric & thread for making clothes

loans.name: La Paz Group

texts.en: The La Paz committee members are involved in activities such as: the buying and selling of flour, meat, olives, eggs, condiments, milk, sugar, herbs, salt, vegetables, sodas, beers, wines, etc. They will use their loans to invest in their businesses and diversify their activities. They have completed their second loan cycle and each woman has her own productive micro-business. They each receive an average of 400,000 guaraníes.

loans.use: To buy flour, meat, olives, eggs, condiments, milk, sugar, herbs, salt, vegetables, sodas, beers, wines, etc.

loans.name: Flor Maritza

texts.es:
Flor tiene 40 años D. edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja eventualmente r como obrero D. construcción civil, y sus cuatro hijos en el caserío Sime, ubicado en el distrito D. Pítipo, a 30 minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

DesD. hace ocho años ella tiene un negocio D. venta D. artículos D. primera necesidad (arroz, azúcar, aceite, etc.), abarrotes y verduras que funciona en su casa, esta bodega – tienda es muy frecuentada por sus vecinos y pobladores D. los caseríos adyacentes. Ella viaja todos los miércoles a la ciudad D. Chiclayo para comprar los productos que luego venderá a sus clientes.

Ella piensa en ampliar su negocio viajando mas a menudo a la ciudad D. Chiclayo para comprar más productos y surtir su tienda, por este motivo está solicitando a nuestra Institución un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles. Esta es la segunda vez que Flor trabaja con nosotros y ha demostrado ser una cliente responsable.

Flor desea brindarles a sus hijos la oportunidad D. seguir estudiando y superarse, ellos, como todos los niños D. la zona que aún estudian, tienen que viajar todos los dias al pueblo mas cercano por un camino accidentado para asistir a clases, por lo que invertir en su educación es una labor que requiere D. mucho esfuerzo.
texts.en:
Flor is 40 years old, married, and has 4 children. Her husband works on contract as a construction worker. They live in the village of Sime, which is located in the District of Pítipo, located 30 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

For eight years, she has been in the business of selling basic necessities (rice, sugar, oil, etc.), groceries, and vegetables from her home. Her grocery store is frequently visited by her neighbors and residents of the adjacent villages. Flor travels to the city of Chiclayo every Wednesday to buy the products she sells to her customers.

She believes in expanding her business, so she must travel more often to Chiclayo to buy more products to fill her store. Therefore, she is seeking a loan of 1000 soles from our Institution. This is the second time she has received a loan from us and has proven herself to be a responsible client.

Flor wants to give her children the opportunity to continue studying and improving themselves. Like all the other children in the area, they must travel every day to the nearest town along the emergency road in order to attend classes. Flor knows that investing in her children’s education is a job that requires much effort.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic necessities for resale

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela es una madre de familia de 38 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en el distrito de Santa Rosa, una zona netamente pesquera ubicada a 25 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ellos manejan un pequeño restaurante en donde atienden a los pescadores de la zona, el negocio les sirvió para comprarse un terreno en el que ahora están construyendo su casa, ellos ya están viviendo allí, pero los ingresos que perciben por el negocio no les han bastado para terminarla, su hogar aún necesita de techo, de puertas y de enlucido, y su ubicación cercana al mar hace urgente el término de su construcción ya que por las noches el frio puede afectar la salud de sus dos pequeños hijos de 9 y 5 años, debido a que el techo sólo esta cubierto por calaminas y su puerta esta conformada por dos delgadas láminas de madera.

Por este motivo ellos están solicitando a nuestra Institución un crédito de 3100 nuevos soles que les ayude a terminar su casa y seguir trabajando en su pequeño restaurante, ellos desean que sus hijos crezcan en una casa que les brinde realmente seguridad.

Ellos ya han trabajado con nosotros cinco veces y han cancelado puntualmente sus créditos por lo que son considerados como unos excelentes clientes.
texts.en:
Manuela, 38, lives with her husband and their two children in the Santa Rosa district. It is purely a fishing region, which is located 25 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. They run a small restaurant where they wait on the fishermen in the region. The business allowed them to buy a piece of land where they are now building their house. They are now living there. But, there has not been enough income from the business to finish the house. The house still needs a roof, doors, and plaster. The close location to the sea makes finishing the construction urgent. The cold nights could affect the health of their two children, who are 9 and 5, because the roof is covered by metal pieces and the door is made of plywood. That is why they are asking the Institution for a loan of 3,100 PEN to help finish their house and keep working in their small restaurant. They want their children to grow up in a house that gives them real security. They have worked with the Institution five times, and they have paid back their loans punctually. Therefore, they are considered to be excellent clients.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to make improvements on their house

loans.name: Macmod

texts.en:
Macmod T. runs a food stall selling a variety of vegetables in the local market and community. He is 45 years old, married and has four school-age children. He is from the village of Barangay 3, Talakag, Bukidnon. Macmod has been in his business for over five months and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Macmod joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Macmod is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be his first loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand his business and support the education of his children. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Gema

texts.en:
Gema P.'s main source of income comes from selling cosmetics and clothing products in her community. She is 27 years old, married and has three school-age children. They are from the village of Barangay 3, Talakag, Bukidnon. Gema has been in business for over one year and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Gema joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Gema is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement the income of her family and support the education of her children.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional cosmetics and clothing to sell

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Being a widow and trying to raise and provide for six children can be a gruelling challenge, but Mrs. Ofelia B., a 60-year-old from Central Leonor Propoer, Brgy. Jonob-jonob Escalante City, Negros Occidental, is determined to provide a better future for her children. She strives very hard to meet all her familial responsibilities.

Mrs. B. originally started a sari-sari, or general store, business 15 years ago, to supplement the income of her husband. It has continued to provide a steady income for the family. More recently, Mrs. B. saw the business potential of setting up a rice-trading business. She started selling rice to the hacienda (sugar plantation) workers on credit. The workers pay her at the end of every week when they receive their weekly pay. The two businesses earn 5,000 PHP per month for her family.

Concerned for the welfare of her neighbors and community, Mrs. B. ran for, and won, a seat in the Baranggay (Village) Council. At present, she has a loan of 19,000 PHP, which is her 13th loan cycle with NWTF-Project Dungganon. It is being used as additional capital for her business, and she also plans to make improvements on her house.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of – not just a few – but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to realities surpassing their dreams. They have learned to live a life which can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon!

loans.use: Additional capital for a sari-sari and rice-trading business and for house improvements

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily J. owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store selling a variety of different products and firewood in the local community. She is 37 years old, married and has seven school-age children. They are from the village of Barangay 3, Talakag, Bukidnon. Emily has been in business for over three months and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Emily joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Emily is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to support the education of her children and supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offerings of a sari-sari

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly P. runs a food stall selling snacks and delicacies in her community. She is 40 years old, married and has seven school-age children. They are from the village of Barangay 3, Talakag, Bukidnon. Merly has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Merly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Merly is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement the income of her family and support the education of her children.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional foods to sell

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Altantsetseg D. started her dairy business in 2004 with an investment of 80,000 tugrugs (approximately 55 USD). She is a 35-year-old businesswoman who lives with her husband and three children in Arkhangai province in central  Mongolia. Her husband works as a water kiosk operator, her oldest son and daughter both attend a local secondary school, and her youngest daughter is in kindergarten. 

Because of her hard work and good customer service, her business has been growing steadily and her working capital has reached 400,000 tugrugs (approx. 276 USD). In addition, improved business has enabled Altantsetseg and her husband to enroll their children in good schools and have a good quality of life. She says, "My dream is to have my own store." Altantsetseg is requesting a loan of 700,000 tugrugs (approx. 483 USD) to  increase her inventory by purchasing more dairy products.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy products

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn P. runs a sari-sari (variety) retail store selling a variety of different products in her community. She also buys and sells green bananas and sweet potatoes in the local market. She is 30 years old, married and has four very young children. They are from the village of Barangay 3, Talakag, Bukidnon. Jocelyn has been in business for over four years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jocelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Jocelyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to support the education of her children and supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To  purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Erdenejargal

texts.en:
Erdenejargal D. is a 38-year-old teacher from Arhangai province in central Mongolia. In 2008, Erdenejargal started an auto repair shop with her husband. They purchased land in a good location and built a well-equipped workshop. Since then, their business has been very stable and they have many regular customers from their community.

Erdenejargal is married and the mother of three children. The older children, Batbulgan and Battungalag, attend a local secondary school. The family is socially open-minded, and they have a positive outlook on life.

Their business capital has increased from 200,000 tugrugs (~ $138 US) when they started their business to a current amount exceeding 600,000 tugrugs (~ $414 US). The success of the business has greatly improved the family's quality of life. Erdenejargal says, “As the business begins to operates more steadily, I plan to hand over control to my husband, so I can work as a teacher.” She is requesting a loan of 1,300,000 tugrugs (~ $900 US) to buy supplies for her auto repair business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her auto repair business

loans.name: Duraliza

texts.en:
Duraliza C. is from the village of Barangay 3, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 30 years old. Duraliza is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Duraliza owns and operates a specialized retail business. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling eggs in the local community. Duraliza is just starting this business.

In 2009, Duraliza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Duraliza is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Duraliza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Bat-Erdene

texts.en:
Bat-Erdene B. is a 40-year-old businessman who lives with his wife and their four children in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. All of the children, three girls and a boy, attend the local secondary school. Bat-Erdene and his wife of 20 years began selling clothes at the local market in 2000. Because of their hard work and honesty, their business has grown rapidly and they have established a very positive reputation throughout the local community. 

Bat-Erdene has proven to be a savvy businessmen. He has expanded his business to selling solar energy panels and electric generators after noticing they were becoming popular among the local farmers. He keeps his bookkeeping very neat, helping him track the costs and sales of the business. 

The success of the business has enabled him and his wife to buy a van and a storage container at the local market, which will be used for the business. In the future, Bat-Erdene says, "I want to expand my business even more and have my own store." 

Bat-Erdene is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 tugrugs to purchase more clothes, solar energy panels and electric generators from Erlian, China.

loans.use: Purchasing solar energy panels and electric generators from Erlian, China

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn T. is from the village of Barangay 3, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 25 years old. Analyn is married and has 3 infant children. Analyn operates a business buying & selling of fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Analyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Analyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a strong woman and striving hard for her family.  She have six children and she is already separated from her husband.  Being the bread winner of her family, life becomes hard for her. But she never give up for the welfare of her children.  She even worked as a housemaid and sacrificed being away to her children just to earn money for a living.  

At present, Vilma is engaged in the vending business in the rural community of San Ignacio, Ilagan, Isabela. She was not able to send some of her children to school due to financial problems and at the moment, some of her eldest children are working as housemaids.  

With her desire to continue to send her children to college and provide them with their daily needs, Vilma is asking to borrow for a loan amount of PHP7, 000.00 that will be utilized as business capital. Aside from vending, she is also into the buy and sell business of recyclable materials of she have free time.  She believes that her family will have a more comfortable life someday.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Bat-Erdene

texts.en: Bat-Erdene B. is a 24-year-old auto repairman who lives in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia with his wife, a cashier and sorter at the local post office, and two-year-old son.  B. has been working as an auto repairman since 1994, when he began helping his father repair vehicles at his new auto repair business. In 2003, B. inherited the business from his father and began running it himself. Even though he is young, he has developed good auto repair skills due to his many years of experience in the business, and has developed a reputation as a good repairman throughout his community. Another advantage to his business is the good equipment, tools and other assets, which he inherited from his father. This gives him many advantages over his competition. Because of these factors, Bat-Erdene has been able to improve his business and increase his working capital to 2,000,000 tugrugs (approx. $1381 USD) from 300,000 tugrugs (approx. $207 USD) when he started. Bat-Erdene has used the profits from his business to build a two-story house for him and his family. For the future, Bat-Erdene says, "My dear wish is to expand my business by providing quality service". He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 tugrugs to purchase materials and parts needed for auto repair.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine B. is from the village of Barangay 3, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 45 years old. Josephine is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Josephine owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store selling a variety of different products including viands in the local community. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Josephine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Josephine from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income and support her children's education. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 50 years old and she is a simple resident of Binarzang Quirino, Isabela. She is married to Gilbert who is one of the respected councilors in their village. They are blessed with three children: Yolly Bert, their eldest, who is presently studying in college, Jacquelyn, 17 years old, who temporarily stopped her college education and J-R, a high school student.  

Yolanda maintains a motorcycle transport business. She gains income through a daily transport boundary basis of PHP200.00.  For additional income, she also ventured into meat vending.  She will first get orders from customers and then deliver them to their houses using a motorcycle. She gains a good income in this business and she is thankful that through the business she is able to help her husband support the education of their children. Wanting to improve her pork vending leads her to seek the support of Kiva lenders.  She hopes to borrow a loan amounting to PHP7,000 that she will use for the maintenance of their motorcycle that she uses to deliver fresh pork and for her transport business.

loans.use: To maintain their motorcycle

loans.name: Dolgorjav

texts.en:
Dolgorjav G. lives with her husband, son and daughter in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. She is 34 years old and has been working as a hairdresser since 2006. There are many hairdressers currently working in the capital of the province, making it a very competitive business. Due to her good customer service and hairdressing skills, Doljgorjav has been able to grow her business, and to finance the building of her own home which is almost complete now. Although she has been successful, she knows that in order to stay ahead of the competition she must always improve her skills and keep her customers happy.

Dolgorjav's husband works as a stoker at local company called Ilch, but he always helps his wife with her business in his free time. Their two children are students at a local secondary school. Dolgorjav's dream is for them to become educated and important people for Mongolia. She is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 tugrugs to purchase beauty materials and products.

loans.use: to purchase beauty materials and products.

loans.name: 012-Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Lương P. Thị is a 35-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá. Lương is the group leader for a four-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 012-Quảng Hưng.

Lương is married and has two school-aged children. To making a living, Lương is starting an art handicraft business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling general handicrafts to tourists and local community members. Lương has just started operating this business and earns approximately VND 1,500,000 per month from these activities.

In 2005, Lương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lương has successfully repaid a previous loan of VND 2,442,600 from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This loan was used to invest in expanding her business. She is now requesting a new loan of VND 6,000,000 which will be used to invest in renovating the business. The loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Lương from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Lương plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.
About the other borrowers in the group:

1. Đào (H. Thị) is a 25-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business making and selling food.

2. Hà (N. Thị) is a 27-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her service-based business.

3. Hằng (Vũ Thị) is a 24-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her service-based business.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
-------------------------------------------------


Lương P. Thị (57) là 35 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá. Lương là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 012-Quảng Hưng (18.01.012).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán hàng mỹ nghệ thông thường cho du khách và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương. Lương has just started operating this business. Từ các hoạt động này, Lương kiếm được khoảng 1500000 VND. Vào 2005, Lương đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Lương đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 2,442,600 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,000,000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 6th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1. Đào (H. Thị) là 25 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

2. Hà (N. Thị) là 27 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.

3. Hằng (Vũ Thị) là 24 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

If you would like to translate the Vietnamese text above, please visit the free online translator offered by Vdict.com

loans.use: business renovation

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma S. is from the village of Barangay 3, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 39 years old, married and has eleven school-aged children. To make a living, Emma owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) store. The primary source of income for this business comes from selling a variety of different products, including firewood, in the local community. Emma is just starting this business.

In 2009, Emma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services, and to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emma is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Emma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family and support the education of her children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Enebish

texts.en: Enebish D. runs her own tailoring business that she started in 2001. She lives with her two sons, ages 7 and 11, and mother in a ger (nomadic housing tent) district on  the plot of land she owns in Arhangai province in central Mongolia. In 2006, Enebish expanded her business by selling second-hand clothes at the local market. She purchases and imports used clothing from South Korea. She currently pays 10,000 tugrugs (aprx. 7 USD) per kilo of clothing she imports, then resells each item individually at marginally higher prices. Enebish says that, "Many poor and vulnerable people live in my province. A large portion of my customer base comes from this group of people. Since second-hand clothes are cheaper than new clothes, they sell quicker." She is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes for her inventory. In the near future she is planning to import and sell new clothes through her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for her inventory.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
“Time is gold” is a quotation that Vicenta applies in her life. She is 44 years old and married to Fernando, who is a farmer. Together, they have three children. Farming is the main source of income to their family. In order to provide for the growing needs of their family, Vicenta and her husband decided to start a hog raising business.

Vicenta would like to request a loan amounting to PHP 8,000.00. She will use the loan for the maintenance of her hogs and to buy enough feed for their growth. She is also planning to purchase new piglets for additional income. She is very patient in raising the hogs because she knows that raising them is a big help in meeting her family's needs in a sustainable manner. Vicenta believes that by utilizing her time wisely in her business, she will become successful in her business endeavor.

loans.use: additional capital to support hog raising

loans.name: Khuulai

texts.en: Khuulai S. is an experienced, hard-working and open-minded woman who has worked as a grocery trader since 1996. She is 34 years old and lives with her husband in their house in Arkhangai aimag, in central Mongolia. To make a better living, Khuulai started her business with an investment of 500,000 tugrugs and began selling groceries out of her brother's grocery store. To date, she has been very successful, as her working capital has increased to a level of 3,000,000 tugrugs. For the future of her business, Khuulai says, “I always dream of owning my own comfortable grocery store.” She is asking for a loan of 3,000,000 tugrugs to purchase a larger variety of groceries so that she can improve her business and achieve her dream.

loans.use: to purchase a larger variety of groceries

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana owns and operates a small variety store in front of their house. She wanted to further expand her business and with this she would like to avail a loan of PHP7,000.00. She plans to purchase additional commodities for her store and also to purchase feeds that she will sell in retail price.  She knows that she could able to generate higher profit if she could able to pursue her desired expansion of her store. 

She hopes that her business will grow and become successful through the continuous support of the lenders accompanied by perseverance and hard work.  Juana is 59 years old and married.  All of their children area already married.  Juana is taking all the opportunities that she can have for her business to become successful.

loans.use: Business Expansion

loans.name: Nergui

texts.en: Nergui J. lives with his wife and three school-aged children in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. He is 35 years old and has lived in his hometown since birth. In 2004 he started a food trading business with his brother, but in 2007, the two ended their partnership. Now, with the help of his wife, Nergui runs his business from a rented container shop at the local market. Thanks to their hard work, the business has been very successful. This success has much improved the family's quality of life and enabled them to buy their own home. One of the main reasons for his business' success is Nergui's strong customer service practices. Nergui treats all of his customers openly and nicely so that they come back over and over again. His dream is to one day own a spacious and comfortable workplace from which he can expand his business. Nergui is requesting a 2000,000 tugrugs loan to purchase food products for his store from Mongolia's capital, Ulaanbaatar.

loans.use: to purchase food products

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona H. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 24 years old. Chona is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Chona owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) store. The primary source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Chona is just starting this business.

In 2009, Chona joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services, and to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Chona is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Chona from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children and to supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Myanganzul

texts.en:
Myanganzul started a consumer goods trading business with her husband in 2006 at the local market XACU. They buy small-sized goods, such as pens, notebooks and hangers, from Erlian, China and sell them at their stall in the market and by traveling directly to herders in the countryside. Myanganzul is 36 years old and lives with her family in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. She and her husband, a local taxi operator, and their two school-age daughters live in a ger (traditional nomadic tent).

Myanganzul is very hardworking and her business is doing very well. Through her profits, she has been able to increase her capital from 500,000 tugrugs (~ $345), when she started the business, to nearly 1,500,000 tugrugs (~ $1,035) today. In 2008, she and her husband purchased a car for her husband's taxi service. She says, “All of the income generated from our businesses is used for our household needs.” She is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 tugrugs (~ $1,380 US) to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase small consumer goods such as pens, notebooks, hangers, etc.

loans.name: Lyngiene

texts.en:
Lyngiene C. runs a food stall selling cooked food and viands in her community. She is 41 years old, married and has school-age children. She is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. Lyngiene has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Lyngiene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Lyngiene is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional food products

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia makes a living running a general store in the rural village of San Ignacio, Ilagan, Isabela. She aspires to have her business grow and be competitive with other stores in their village. She has four children with Monato C., her husband, who works as an Overseas Filipino Worker in Saudi. Their four children are all studying. They need to help each other to give them a good education so that some day all of them will have a good future. Their eldest is now 13 years old, studying in high school with their second child. The two younger children are both in elementary school.

Alicia is asking for a loan to be used as additional business capital to purchase commodities for her general store. She hopes to access a loan of 10,000 PHP that will surely be very useful in the improvement of her store. Alicia believes that time is gold; thus, they work very hard and help each other in the progress of their daily lives, doing their best not to waste time for nothing.

loans.use: Additional capital for a general store

loans.name: Otgontsetseg

texts.en:
Otgontsetseg is a hardworking single mother who lives with her three children in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. She has operated a dairy trade business since 2001. She purchases her goods directly from herders and sells them at her stall in the local market, XACU. She generates most of her income during the spring, summer and fall months. These seasons are busiest due to the dairy milking period. During the busiest months, her oldest daughter helps out during her summer vacation from school.

As her business has grown, she has gained much experience in the dairy trade business and as a businesswoman. Her business has been profitable: her capital has increased to more than four times its start-up amount. As a single mother, her business is very important for her family. She says, “As my business grows better, I'd like to make savings for my children's future.” She is requesting an 800,000 tugrugs loan (~ $552 US) to purchase supplies and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase supplies and expand her dairy business

loans.name: Lani

texts.en:
Lani O. runs a food stall in a canteen selling snacks and delicacies in her community. She is 32 years old, married and has four school-age children. They are from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. Lani has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,800 PHP a month.

In 2009, Lani joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lani is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional food products to sell

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda started her general store after she married Martin. The couple is blessed with six children – five of them are in school. Their eldest is already working in Manila as a factory worker. Erlinda and her family live in the village of San Ignacio, Ilagan, Isabela. Their main dialect is Ybanag, the local language in their place.

Erlinda wants to borrow 10,000 PHP as additional business capital for her store. She plans to use the loan to buy additional merchandise for her store to meet the demands of her customers. Although her business is not that big, it contributes a lot to sending her children to school.

loans.use: Additional capital for a general store

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn C. aspires to have her own business and put her sewing skills into practice. She knows the business well, as she has been an employee of a tailoring shop for 28 years. Just starting up, Marilyn will be using her loan to purchase cloth and other things needed for her tailoring business. The people in her village are her potential customers.

Marilyn is a newly recognized member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI). She is motivated to get a loan from ASHI to start her own business. She was left with one child after she separated from her husband. Her child is 21 years old, and is dependent on her, as he is a high school undergraduate. She wants to support her only child independently from her live-in driver partner. She plans to get more loans through ASHI to really establish a stable business in the future and employ her own child.

loans.use: To start up a tailoring business

loans.name: Lolito

texts.en:
Lolito D. is just starting a sari-sari (variety) retail store to sell a variety of different products in his community. He is 35 years old, married and has two school-age children. They are from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City.

In 2009, Lolito joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolito is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase equipment and tools to start the business. This will be his first loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue to supplement the income of his family and support the education of his children.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta J. is from the city of Dapitan. She is 43 years old, is married, and has six school-aged children. Julieta owns and operates a business running a food stall, selling seafood products such as fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Julieta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 8th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of his children and to supplement his family’s income. loans.name: Jhoniffer

texts.en:
Jhoniffer is 27 years old and married to Gladys when they were only 16 years old. They now have three children and they are all studying.  He operates a passenger tricycle in the village at San Ignacio, Quirino, Isabela.

Jhoniffer is patient in maintaining his tricycle transport business in order to give his family with their daily needs and in supporting the education of their children.  He is also glad that his parents gave him a small farm which is also their source of additional income.  For the maintenance of his motorcycle business, he is now asking for a business capital of PHP4,000.00 from the Kiva lenders.  He hopes that they will give him the chance to improve his business for the welfare of his family.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Tura

texts.ru: Болтаев Тура проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст 46 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Тура более 10 лет занимается земледелием. Он в основном выращивает овощи, лук. Собрав урожай он продает его на рынке, но у него также имеются постоянные клиенты. Кредит просит для закупа семян и посева урожая, а собрав продать, т.е. для увеличения товараоборота. На полученную прибыль хочет отремонтировать свой дом.
texts.en:
Tura B. lives in the Shahrituz district. He is 46 years old, married and has 4 children. Tura has been involved in agriculture for over 10 years. He primarily grows vegetables and onions. After gathering the harvest, he sells it at a market, but he also has consistent clients. Tura is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, plant the crop and sell the harvest, i.e. for increasing product turnover. He wants to use resulting profits to repair his house.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

Hernan owns and operates a clothing business, providing new clothing services to local community members. He also engages in a sari-sari (variety) store. He is just starting this business. In 2009, Hernan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. loans.name: Farid

texts.ru: Рахмонов Фарид проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст 22 года. Женат, детей не имеет. По специальности Фарид является учителем. Но вот более 2 лет занимается торговлей, он в основном торгут одеждой в своем собственном магазине. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота. За счет прибыли хочет купить себе лекговую автомашину.

loans.use: Увеличение товараоборота

loans.name: Elda

texts.en:
48-year-old Edna was successful in the business she had established through her five times loan in ASHI since 2004. However, most of the financial and emotional investments she had then vanished when her husband died just recently. She spend thousands of money for her husband's medication before the death and even until the burial. Having her only 11-year-old child beside her, Edna realized she has to be strong to restart running her general store business for her child's education and future.

From a Php12,000 previously, Edna chose to lessen the amount she will loan now despite her qualification for loaning large amount because she will start all over again and for the first time, without her husband's support. In the near future she believes that she will be able to grow her business again with loans she will be getting from ASHI.

loans.use: Will be used to finance her general store business.

loans.name: Rozigul

texts.ru: Джуманазарова Розигул проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 58 лет. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Дети уехали на заработки в Россию. Сама Розигул более 6 лет занимается бизнесом. Она имеет торговую точку, где торгует продуктами питания. Ее муж также помогает ей с закупом ассортимента. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Rozigul J. lives in the Rumi region. She is 58 years old. She is married and has five children. Her children went to Russia as migrant workers. Rozigul has bee doing business for more than six years. She has a vendor slot where she sells food stuffs. Her husband also helps her with buying of the inventory. She is asking for a loan to increase the turnover.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase turnover

loans.name: Mehri

texts.ru: Мехри Тоссыева проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 33 года. Замужем, имеет  1 ребенка. Муж находится на заработках  в России. Сама Мехри более 13 лет работала преподавателем. Вот более 2 лет занимается еще и сельским хозяйством. Она выращивает и продает кукурузу. Кредит просит для закупа семян и удобрений, чтобы посадить овощи.
texts.en:
Mehri T. lives in the Rumi region. She is 33 years old. She is married and has one child. Her husband is now working in Russia. Mehri has been working as a teacher for more than thirteen years. Now she has been doing agriculture for more than two years. She grows and sells corn. She is asking for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer to sow vegetables.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Ma. Eliza

texts.en:
Ma. Eliza C. started with a variety store business when her sister gave her small amount of money for a capital after the death of her husband in 2004. She had two children that goes to school then. One in college and the other is in high school. Profit she had at that time wasn't enough for all expenses required by the education of her children and their personal needs thus, business was sporadic because capital was misused most of the times.

When one of her children is graduating from college, the financial need for her education is increasing affecting the stability of her business. Then, she realized she needs loan to sustain the financial need of her business and for making it grow to profit bigger. After paying her previous loans in ASHI, now she wants to loan larger amount for her business. Her two children are helping her in managing her store. One had graduated from college and the other one is highschool undergraduate.  With her family working in the business she put up and with the loans she can avail, someday she envisioned that her business can generate employment in their community. From a variety store she aims to make it a grocery store or a mini-mart in their community.

loans.use: Will be used to finance her growing variety store that offers covenience and accessebility of buying the basic commodities.

Он откармливает и продает мелкий и крупный рогатый скот на рынке. Ей в этом также помогают дети. Кредит просит для закупа скота.
texts.en:

She raises and sells small livestock and cattle at a market. Her children help her as well. She is requesting a loan to purchase livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

texts.en:
Foibe is a member of the Amkeni borrower group in sakina,Arusha,she is 39 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 4 children,Her children are aged 22,20,18 and 5 years.

Foibe started her own fishing business selling fish 10 years ago,she works 9 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Foibe`s second loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 350,000 in order to buy more fish for sale.

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan,Foibe hopes to save more money and expand her business.

Martha is another member of the same borrower group,she requested the amount of 350,000 Tsh in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish

В данный момент более 3 лет занимается животноводством, т.е. откармливанием и продажей скота. Кредит просит для закупа скота. На полученную прибыль хочет оставить себе несколько поголовье.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is a good and responsible mother to her children. She loves her family and will sacrifice everything for them.  She has operated a general store business since she was 21 years old.  She is now 33 years old and married to Rolly, who has been engaged in a furniture business for eight years. They now have two children. They reside in Branagy San Ignacio, Ilagan, Isabela. She knows that her business is of great help in sending her children to school and providing the needs of her family.  

Flordeliza is hoping that someday, through her business, she can continue to provide the educational needs of her children.  For her to fulfil her dreams, she would like to borrow a loan of PHP 8,000.00 that she will use for the development of her store.

loans.use: For additional capital

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is 24 years old and is single. He is living with his parents in Ramallah, Palestine.

Mohammed owns and operates an Internet café in the local community. Now, he is requesting a loan of 1,500 USD to improve his business. Let’s help this young man who, with great care and dedication, fights hard to improve his life.
