loans.name: Samwel

texts.en: Samwel N. is 43 years old and is the married father of four children: three daughters and a son. He is married to Grace who is a 35-year-old businesswoman. Samwel and his family live in Shanzu, Mombasa where he operates an egg-selling shop. He has been in the egg-supply business for the last fifteen years. Samwel was introduced to KADET through an existing client and this will be his first loan. With the money, he plans to increase his stock of eggs. Apart from the eggs supply business, Samwel owns two rental kiosks which supplement his income. Samwel hopes to procure a motorcycle for more efficiency in his deliveries and also plans to acquire a piece of land to facilitate poultry-keeping. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To purchase more eggs to sell

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana P., from the village of Libertad, Aurora, Zamboanga del sur, is a 52-year-old married mother of six adult-aged children. To make a living, Juana owns and operates a specialized retail store whose main source of income comes from selling gasoline in the local community. Juana has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2007, she joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC that was used to expand the business, Juana is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her fifth from GDMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
41-year-old Juliet along with her husband and three children, live in the village not far away from the seashore of Pandan, Antique. Juliet and her husband both fish and sell fish just like most people in the village. Ten years ago when they started the business, growth was sporadic due to insufficient business capital, but since joining Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI) in 2003,  progress has been steady owing to access to loans. Over the years of borrowing, Juliet has been able to send her three children to school from her profits, and now her eldest child is attending college studying to be a nurse. 

"Bangus fry" is a small milkfish (the country's national fish and favorite of many people for food) raised by people in a fish pond and then sold in the market when they have reached maturity. The cost for every kilo of Bangus raised is  Php120- Php250. Juliet's "bangus fry" business has grown well as she has been able to acquire costumers across the province and even in Manila. The growth in demand for her product is such that  she needs more business capital for sustainability.  Juliet therefore wants to borrow the maximum amount from ASHI that her business growth qualifies her for. She even wants to expand into other provinces. 

From her profits, Juliet wants to finance a college education for all of her children.

loans.use: Financing her "bangus fry" (milkfish fingerlings) wholesale business.

loans.name: Sinan

texts.en:
Sinan is 44 years old and is married with two kids. He lives in Ramallah City, Palestine.

Sinan is a good dentist, and he wants to provide the best service he can to his customers. The loan he is requesting will be used to furnish his office with dental materials and equipment. His work, his desire to succeed, and most of all his focus on his work with clients, will allow him to succeed with this loan.

loans.use: To furnish his office with dental materials and equipment

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is very patient in her vegetable-vending business. She roams around her village going from one house to another to sell her merchandise. She is glad that, through her diligence, she can generate a daily income of PHP 200. She needs to budget it wisely to meet the needs of her family.

Julieta is 36 years old and a mother who is full of hopes and dreams for her family. She has four children and two of them are already in high school. She hopes that, through her business, she can continue to send them to school.

With this in mind, Julieta is asking for financial assistance from Kiva lenders in the amount of PHP 4,000 that will serve as business capital. She knows that this amount will pave the way for business development and an increase in income.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma G. is from the village of Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 23 years old. Emma is single and has an infant child. Emma owns and operates a fish-selling business, selling ocean-caught fish in the local community through peddling (going door-to-door). She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Emma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

location.town: Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Hiyam

texts.en: Hiyam is a 48-year-old married woman and mother of 4 children. She has owned a mini market since 2007 in order to earn income to help satisfy the needs of her family, in collaboration with her husband. Today, Hiyam is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy more merchandise to increase her sales.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou C. G. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 45 years old. Marilou is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Marilou owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a sari-sari or general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, etc., in the local community. Marilou has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marilou joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilou is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marilou from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Ann Antonette

texts.en:
Ann Antonette R. is from the village of Upper Tambo, Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 22 years old. Ann Antonette is single. To make a living, Ann Antonette owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling dairy products like chocolates in the local community. Ann Antonette is just starting this business.

In 2009, Ann Antonette joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ann Antonette is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ann Antonette from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is a 36-year-old married man living with his wife. He has owned a barber shop since 1995 and has twenty years of experience in this field. Over the years, thanks to his business income, he has been able to meet his family's needs.

Today, Abbas is requesting $1,000 to renovate his tools and to purchase a new machine for his shop so as to be able to attract new clients.

loans.use: To renovate his tools and purchase a new machine

loans.name: Maryline

texts.en:
Maryline N. is 27-years-old and a married mother of three daughters. She lives in Shanzu, Mombasa where she operates a cereals store. She has been in that business for the last one year and most of her clients are the Shanzu residents.

This Kshs 50,000 loan marks Maryline's first borrowing from KADET and with the money she plans to increase her stock of cereals.

In future she hopes to expand her business and to start selling the cereals in wholesale.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To purchase more cereals

loans.name: Khodor Karim

texts.en: Khodor K. is a 51-year-old married man and father of 7 children. He has been working as a taxi driver since 1979. After this long experience in the field, Khodor K. is requesting to borrow $1,000 to perform maintenance for his car after bad circumstances to be able to provide, alone, better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: perform maintenance for his car

loans.name: Stela

texts.en:
Stela is a member of the Zizi la ngombe borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 50 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 6 children.Her children are aged 32,30,28,26,24,22 years.

Stela started her own shop business selling rice,wheat etc 2 years ago.She works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 100,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Stela first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order o buy more commodities for her business.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan  stela hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 44-year-old married man with 3 children. He has been working in the tile sector since 1990. Today, Ali is applying for a loan of $1,000 to buy a new specific machine for his work so he can satisfy the heavy demands of the market and help increase his income.

loans.use: buy a new specific machine

loans.name: Mouna

texts.en:
Mouna is a 40-year-old single woman living with her parents. She has been working as a home-based tailor since 2005 to provide, along with her brother, better living conditions for the family.

Today, Mouna is requesting $1,100 to purchase a new sewing machine for her work to satisfy the demands of her clientele.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

Fanula started her own shop business selling rice,sugar 3 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 200,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Fanula first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 in order to buy more commodities.

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan ,fanula hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en: Eduardo L. is from the village of Upper Tambo, Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 49 years old, is married, and has two adult children. Eduardo owns and operates a business providing videoke (also called karaoke - amateur singing to a music video background) rental services to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 7,800 PHP a month. In 2009, Eduardo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in renovating his business. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

location.town: Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Christopher Owino

texts.en:
Christopher, 24, is married and has a 9 month-old child. He is a hard-working man who earns income operating a motorbike taxi (called a piki piki by the locals) in Kisumu, Kenya.  However, he currently has to lease a motorcycle which costs a lot, leaving little profit.  Even if he does not get much business on a given day, Christopher has to pay the fee to the motorbike owner.  He therefore dreams of being able to save enough to afford his own motorbike, so that he can keep all the money he makes from his business.  Christopher already has decided on a particular model available at a downtown retail store, and will use his loan to make a down-payment.  
Christopher is extremely excited about the work that K-MET is doing and wants to recruit new members so that they can benefit from K-MET's work in the community.

loans.use: Down-payment on a motorcycle

loans.name: Elice

texts.en: Elice is a 51-year-old married woman with 4 children. In 2006, she decided to help her husband on the household by working as a book sales woman. Today, Elice is applying for a loan of $1,200 to purchase essentiA. books as a stock so she can satisfy the demands of the market and help increase her income

loans.use: purchase essential books

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en: Abbas, 19, is an ambitious young man who lives with his family and helps to support it financially. In 2007, he decided to open a coffee shop as his own business. Today, Abbas is requesting a loan of US$500 to purchase a Nescafe machine in order to increase his sales and, therefore, his income.

loans.use: Purchase of a Nescafe machine

loans.name: Mariedy

texts.en:
Mariedy R. is from the village of Upper Tambo, Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 35 years old, single and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Mariedy owns and operates a food stall, selling snacks and delicacies, such as banana cue and camote cue, in the local community. Mariedy has been engaged in her business for over 2 months, earning approximately 1,800 PHP per month.

In 2009, Mariedy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in the business. This will be Mariedy's first loan from HSPFI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children's education and supplement the family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Nadette has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nadette joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nadette is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the first loan taken out by Nadette from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Dudu

texts.en:
Dudu H. currently sells bread and is requesting a loan to open up a backery for high production of bread to sell. Dudu is 30 years old, married to a peaant and has three children who all go to school at Munuki primary school.  With the extra profits in future from her loan, she hopes to be able to produce more bread for sale

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: open up a backery

loans.name: Agripina

texts.en:
Agripina B. is from the village of La Victoria, Aurora, Zamboanga del sur. She is 59 years old. Agripina is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Agripina operates a business raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising cows for sale. Agripina is just starting this business.

In 2007, Agripina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Agripina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Agripina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Agripina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle T. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 49 years old. Annabelle is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Annabelle owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling scrap metal & other used products in the local community. Annabelle has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Annabelle joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Annabelle has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,500 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Annabelle is requesting a new loan of 14,500 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Annabelle from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Since Salvacion and her husband Rolly got married, they have been raising pigs for their hog business. They started with one piglet that they raised and sold. This is their source of income to support the basic needs of their four children and their education. However, the hog business alone cannot finance the family's financial needs, therefore Salvacion also sells fish. Even with all of her hard work and perseverance, the business wasn't stable because of insufficient business capital. In 2003, Salvacion joined Ahon Sa HIrap, Inc. (ASHI). She took out a loan from the institution to finance her business. As a result of the loans she received, her business has grown and she has been able to send all of her children to school. Three are high school graduates and her 8 year old youngest child is in elementary school. 

Out of the profits her business had generated, Salvacion was able to buy a motorcycle. Her desire for taking out a larger loan from ASHI is to increase her hog business and her profits to be able to buy a sidecar to attach to her motorcycle for a tricycle for hire business in the future.

Tricycle is one of the most common means of transportation all over the province. With this business, Salvacion could provide a daily income for her family's needs. She also hoped that out of her business profits her two children who are still in school will graduate from college.

loans.use: To support her hog business.

Esther feels that her shop is understocked and she plans to exploit the available space and grow the shop even further.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

texts.en:

She is hoping that some of them can finish their studies in the future.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma , 30 years old is  divorced mother of two children who both attend school. She had a business selling bread and cakes two years ago but found that the business was not expanding, so she now brews and sells alcohol locally.  In order to expand the business, she is requesting a loan to purchase more brewing materials including yeast and sugar.

She looks forward to eventually building a bar from the extra profits realized from her loan.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as  measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

texts.en: Omolara makes a living selling spare parts, and works with her husband, who taught her this trade. They have been in business for five years and are able to provide for their family. Omolara is 29 years old and has one child. She hopes for a loan of N140,000 to buy more spare parts in bulk, so that she can meet customer demand.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts to sell

loans.name: Akojo

texts.en:
Akojo L. 30 years marries a soldier and has two children who all go to school. She lives a half km from Hai game market in Buluk town, Juba. She travels on foot to her business resturant. She sells different types of foodstuffs in her resturant and requests a loan to purchase more foodstuffs, cooks and sells to her customers in her resturant. In the future, Akojo aims at pay the school fees of her children upto University level.


 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell in the resturant

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon D. lives in the village of Mambajao Camiguin. She is 48 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Corazon owns and operates a business where she sells specialty food items. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from her work.

Earlier this year, Corazon joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI, and is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP to expand her business and care for her family.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Thèophiline

texts.en:
Thèophiline is married and has four children.  Her youngest daughter is four years old and will soon start her first year of school. Thèophiline  was born in Porto-Novo, the capital of Benin. There she makes a living selling eggs and fabrics.  She buys her eggs on Mondays and Fridays from a chicken farm near Porto-Novo and sells them to passersby on the street.  Thèophiline's secondary work is the sale of fabrics.  She sells from her home to people who need clothes for ceremonies like weddings and funerals. Her customers use these Beninese fabrics, which are called pagnes, as formal attire for important events.  

Thèophiline is seeking her third loan from Alide, a Kiva Field Partner in Benin, in order to purchase eggs and fabrics.  She would like to expand her fabric sales because demand is high.  Thèophiline hopes to use this loan to increase her revenues.

loans.use: to buy eggs and fabric to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is engaged in the 'sari-sari' store (community-based store) business and her shop is located just in front of their house. She offers various goods in her store like detergent, soap, canned goods, snacks, and soft drinks. At present, she is requesting a loan of PHP10,000 that she can use for the expansion of her business. Aside from her store, she is also planning to venture into a new business which is hog-raising. Milagros believes that with the financial support coming from Kiva lenders, she will be able to fulfill her plans and sustain the needs of their family and pay for the education of their children.

Milagros is 40 years old and married to a farmer named Arnel. Their eldest child is enrolled in college taking a Midwifery course while their youngest is a high school graduate and at the moment stopped his studies due to lack of money. He is now helping his father in maintaining their farm.

loans.use: Business Expansion

loans.name: Marry

texts.en:
Marry is a member of the Mlandege borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 29 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 3 children.

Marry started her own clothing business selling used clothes 2 years ago,she works 8 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 100,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Marry`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more used clothes for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Marry hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes

loans.name: Oluwabimi

texts.en:
Oluwabimi is a photographer. She covers events and special occasions and has been in business for five years. She also has a shop where plastics are sold. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more printing chemicals and a camera.

Oluwabimi is 38 years old and married with four children. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase printing chemicals and a camera

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia M. is from the village of Jang, Poblacion Mahinog Camiguin. Patricia is married and has school-aged children. To make a living, Patricia owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling variety of viands and such in the local community. Patricia has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In September 2008, Patricia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Patricia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. Patricia is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Patricia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Mateo

texts.en:
Mateo A. is from the village of Tabid, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. He is 40 years old. Mateo is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Mateo owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from cultivating seaweed and harvesting this seaweed for sale. Mateo has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Mateo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mateo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Mateo is requesting a new loan of ,PHP which will be used to purchase materials for seaweed production. This will be the second loan taken out by Mateo from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchase materials for seaweed production

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is married and has five children.  She lives with her family in Porto-Novo, the capital of Benin.  For almost thirty years, she has been preparing food to sell.  She prepares traditional Beninese meals of attasi, pates, gumbo sauce, and beans at her home.  Attasi and pates are both made out of corn.  While Beatrice is cooking her meals, goats, sheep, and chickens wander around her yard.  Her children help her prepare her meals when they are not in school.  Beatrice finishes cooking in late morning and then brings her food to a food stall on the side of a busy Porto-Novo street.  There she sells her food during the day.  

Beatrice has already acquired a from a loan from Alide, a Kiva Field Partner in Benin.  This loan helped her to restock her goods and to start selling Beninese fabrics called pagnes.   Beatrice is seeking another loan in order to buy beans, gumbo, corn, and more fabrics.  In the future, Beatrice hopes to have the financial means to increase the variety of her products.

loans.use: Beans, gumbo, corn, and fabrics

loans.name: Rasidatu

texts.en:
Rasidatu sells foodstuffs and drinks. She has been in business for the past nine years and with this income assists her husband in the children's upbringing. She has been borrowing from LAPO for the past three years and is a faithful client. She goes to Cotonou once every two weeks to get foodstuffs in bags in large quantity at a discount. She hopes for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more foodstuffs which will enable her to meet customers' demand.

Rasidatu is 32 years old and has four children. She says thank you and promises to pay back promptly.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena owns and manage a grocery store in their village for ten years. She is now 54 years old and still doing her best to become productive.  She is married to Hilario and he is helping her in managing the store. Through her business, she was able to send her six children to school and two of them are already graduated from college.  Some owns a small business and some are employed in a private sector.  Two are still studying.   

At the moment, she is asking for a loan of PHP20, 000 as additional capital for her humble grocery store in Calamgui 1st of Ilagan, Isbaela. She is hoping for the continuous success of her store so she can provide the educational needs of their children.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther E. is from the town of Kinangay Sur, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Esther is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Esther owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcab transport services to local community members. Esther has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 3,600 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Esther joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esther is requesting a loan of 23,314 PHP which will be used to purchase equipment to improve the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Esther from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Kpedetin

texts.en:
M. Kpèdétin is married and has four children. She prepares dishes of rice, beans, and pasta, topped off with spicy Beninese sauces.  Kpèdétin buys her ingredients at the Ouando Market in Porto-Novo, a bustling conglomeration of hundreds of small stalls.  She is busiest around midday, when people take normally their meals.  

Kpèdétin is seeking her second loan from Alide, a Kiva Field Partner in Benin.  She is seeking another loan to restock her supplies and to buy in bulk.  Kpèdétin hopes to acquire a loan and to increase her profits.

loans.use: Beans, rice, vegetables, and bread

loans.name: Everly

texts.en:
Everly T. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin. Everly is widowed and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Everly owns and operates a 'sari-sari' (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Everly has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In May 2009, Everly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Everly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. Everly is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Everly from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Folashade

texts.en:
Folashade sells provisions and drinks. She has been in business for the past four years and with her income assists her husband in the children's upbringing. Folashade has been borrowing from LAPO for the past three years and is a faithful client. She goes to market once every two weeks to get goods in large quantity at a discount. She is requesting the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more foodstuffs which will enable her to meet customers' demand.

Folashade is 37 years old and married with three children. She says thank you and promises to pay back promptly.

loans.use: To purchase provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Carlina

texts.en:
Carlina is 53 years old and married to Leopoldo.  They are living in Cabisera 25, Ilagan, Isabela. His husband is working as a carpenter and sometimes as a farmer.  They are blessed with eight children, seven of them are already married. Most of them finished a two-year course in college. 

Carlina has been managing her village store for almost six years.  However, due to financial difficulties brought by economic crisis, she had experienced failure in her business.  She is glad that she was able to maintain the business.  She wanted to improve it and she is now asking for  and to further improve it, she is requesting a loan amounting to PHP10, 000 as additional business capital to make her business more progressive and sustainable for the future of her family.  The loan will be of big help towards the survival of her business and she hopes that through the loan, she could expand her business.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Yemi

texts.en:
Yemi sells chickens and also supplies eggs to women who in turn retail them to the final consumers. She buys layers which when fed continue to lay eggs till they are sold off. Yemi has been in this business for the past five years, but before that, she was selling second-hand clothes. Business was not moving well hence she switched to poultry farming.

Yemi said she is requesting the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase layers in large quantity at a reduced price. This, she said, will enable her to meet the increasing demand of her customers.Yemi is based in Lagos State with her entire family. She is 46 years old and married with seven children. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase poultry feed and day-old chicks

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris A. is from the village of Liposong, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old. Doris is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Doris owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising poultry. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising chickens for sale. Doris has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 20000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Doris joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Doris is requesting a new loan of 50000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Doris from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.

loans.name: Akpoton

texts.en:
Akpoton lives in Porto-Novo, the capital of Benin.  She is married and has five children, the youngest of which is still in secondary school.  Akpoton runs a small general store near a busy road in Porto-Novo.  There she sells a whole range of goods, including candy, eggs, vegetables, medicine, and gasoline.  Akpoton has been working for twenty-two years.  She used to prepare gumbo sauce and vegetables for sale, but stopped that activity because it was too time consuming.  

Akpoton has already acquired two loans from Alide, a Kiva Field Partner in Benin.  These loans helped her to buy medicines, and twenty liters of oil to sell in her store.  Akpoton is seeking a third loan from Alide in order to buy grains, beans, and peppers.  She hopes to increase her profits enough to one day  buy a parcel of land of her own.

To make a living, Zosima owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motor cab for hire to local community members. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Zosima from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

This is suzana first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more medicine.

She purchases frozen food from Cotonu, a border town city by Lagos state, and goes to get goods once every week to meet up with customers' demands. Yemisi is 54 years old and married with four children. She is requesting a loan of N140,000 to purchase goods in bulk at a discount. She says thanks!

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara is a member of the Mwangata borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 42 years old woman,she is married.

sara started her own shop business selling commodities like sugar,cooking oil.rice,salts 3 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 50,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Sara`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 300,000 Tsh in order to buy more shop commodities.


With the profit she gains from the use of this loan,Sara hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.name: Temitope

texts.en: Temitope is 34 years old and married with two children. She has been borrowing from LAPO for the past two years. Temitope sells provisions and goes to market once in two week to buy provisions. She hopes for the loan amount of N140,000 to increase her goods to meet customers' demands. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Amatour Ramath

texts.fr: Amatour Ramath est née en 1985 à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique de la République du BENIN. Ramath est célibataire sans enfant. Ramath vit à Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin depuis vingt quatre ans. Ramath a fait des études universitaires mais c’est le commerce que Ramath a choisi de faire. En effet, Ramath va au Nigeria, État frontalier au Bénin pour acheter ses articles. Ramath vend des tissus de tout genre (Hollandais, WAS, Hitarget, Bazin…) et des foulards à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. Ramath a déjà cinq ans d’expérience dans cette activité. Ramath veut renforcer son fonds de roulement, c’est pourquoi elle sollicite ce premier prêt d’ALIDé.

loans.use: Achat de tissus Bazin

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase turnover

loans.name: Rafiatou

texts.fr: Rafiatou est née en 1980 à Adjarra, elle est mariée à Idrissou. Idrissou et Rafiatou ont deux enfants mais c’est l’ainé seul qui est scolarisé. Rafiatou vit avec sa famille à Cotonou, Capitale Économique  de la République du Bénin depuis trois ans. C’est le mari de Rafiatou qui supporte les dépenses de la famille. C’est des draps de lit, les taies d’oreillers, les foulards et chapeaux de femme et des rideaux que Rafiatou vend à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. Rafiatou va au Togo, pays frontalier au Bénin pour s’approvisionner en ces différents articles. Rafiatou veut renforcer son fonds de roulement ; c’est pourquoi elle sollicite ce premier prêt d’ALIDé.

loans.use: Achat de draps de lit, taies d’oreillers, foulards et chapeaux de femme et des rideaux.

loans.name: Dupe

texts.en: Dupe sells fire-wood and is a cheap means of cooking for commercial and home use, Dupe also has machine for milling various items like maize, tomatoes e.t.c. she buys fire-wood from neighbouring villages and sells them in Lagos state. She has been in these businesses for many years and from this she assists her husband in running the home. Dupe is requesting for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase fire-wood in bulk at a reduced price, Dupe is 50 years old and married with  three children, her entire family is based in Lagos state. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase fire-wood to sell

loans.name: Holbat

texts.ru: Урозов Холбат проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 35 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Холбат более 5 лет работает "трактористом". В данный момент момент более 6 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. Он в основном выращивает бахчевые растения на продажу. Кредит просит для закупа семян и удобрений, чтобы посеить урожай.
texts.en:
Holbat U. lives in the Rumi region. He is 35 years old. He is married and has four children. Holbat has been working as a tractor driver for more than five years. At this time he has been in agriculture for more than six years. He mainly grows cereals for resale. He is asking for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer to sow a harvest.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Folashade

texts.en: Folashade sells cement and bricks and has been in this business since 2004. She also makes bricks which she supplies to those building houses. With profit from this business through past loan she said her children’s school fees are always paid on time unlike before now when the situation was different. Folashade hopes for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase cement to sell, this she said will enable her meet customers demand and also make more blocks for sale. Folashade is 43 years old and married with five children. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase cement to sell.

loans.name: Folashade

texts.en: Folashade sells frozen food and foodstuff and has been in business for five years. She joined LAPO a year after starting her business. She is requesting for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase frozen food and foodstuff in large quantity this she said will enable her meet the demand of customers.Folashade is 45 years old and married with two children. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuff and frozen food to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Увеличение товараоборота

loans.name: Sawsan

texts.en:
Sawsan started her business to help her husband pay for their household expenses. She opened her grocery store in Nablus City, Palestine, where she sells staples such as rice, noodles, sugar, tea, bread, sodas, etc. She is now 31 years old and married with one child. 

The requested loan will be used to purchase more merchandise for her store. One of her main goals is that her child will have opportunities that Sawsan never had when she was young.

loans.use: purchase more merchandise for her store

loans.name: Emilina

texts.en:
Emeliana is a member of the Mwangata D borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 40 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children.Her children are aged 7 and 3 years.

Emiliana started her own business selling vibatari 3 years ago,she works 8 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 40,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Emeliana`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more material for her business.

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan Emeliana hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more materials

loans.name: Sahadatou

texts.fr: Sahadatou est née en 1961 à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique de la République du BENIN. Sahadatou est mariée à Sadikou Salam . Sahadatou et Sadikou Salam ont quatre enfants tous scolarisés. La famille vit à Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. C’est le mari de Sahadatou qui assure les dépenses de la famille. C’est des draps de lit, les taies d’oreillers, les foulards et chapeaux de femme et des rideaux que Sahadatou vend à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. Sahadatou est dans cette activité depuis dix ans. Et c’est au Nigeria, État frontalier au Bénin que  Sahadatou achète ses articles. Sahadatou veut renforcer son fonds de roulement ; c’est pourquoi elle sollicite ce premier prêt d’ALIDé.
texts.en:
Sahadatou was born in 1961 in Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of the Republic of Benin. Sahadatou is married to Sadikou Salam. Sahadatou and Sadikou have four children all of whom go to school. The family lives in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. Sahadatou’s husband looks after the family’s finances. Sahadatou sells bed linen, pillowcases, scarves, women’s hats and curtains in Dantokpa, the large international market in Benin. Sahadatou has been selling these items for ten years. Sahadatou buys her stock in Nigeria, Benin’s border state. Sahadatou wants to increase her working capital which is why she is asking for her first loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bed linen, pillowcases, scarves, women's hats and curtains

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 51 years old and married with four children who all assist her in the trade when they are not in school. Grace sells drinks and foodstuffs and has been in this business since 2004. She buys foodstuffs from a village market and sells to women who retail it. She buys drinks from distributors who the company supplies. Grace said she hopes for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase directly from the company at a reduced rate. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell.

loans.name: Zita

texts.fr: Zita est née en 1973 à Hêvié au Sud de Bénin; elle est mariée à Belmard. Ensemble ils ont faits trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Zita elle-même est allée à l’école jusqu’au cours secondaire. La famille vit à Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin depuis vingt cinq ans. Zita vend de l’huile végétale et des jus de fruits (ananas, bissap, baobab, maïs et citron) chez elle à domicile depuis quatre ans. Zita achète ses provisions à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. Zita sollicite ce premier prêt d’ALIDé pour acheter ses produits en gros.

loans.use: Achat d’huile de palme, du sucre en poudre et des fruits (ananas, bissap, baobab, maïs et citron).

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a photographer, and she studied this business for four years before setting up her own photo studio. Elizabeth covers occasions like wedding ceremonies, etc. Oftentimes she has had more than one customer at a time and because of that, she finds it difficult meeting their demands because she has one camera only. She loses them to other competitors. She is requesting for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase printing chemicals and a digital camera so as to meet the demands of her customers. She already has a trained shop assistant who will use a second camera to cover ceremonies. Elizabeth is 50 years old, married and has five children who are in all in school. Elizabeth says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals for printing and a digital camera

loans.name: Ayham

texts.en:
Ayham is an active and hard-working young man. He is 29 years old, single, and lives in his parent’s house. He really feels like doing something to improve his life and succeed. He earns a living taking his customers from one place to another. Inseparable from his taxi, he drives up and down the streets of Nablus City of Palestine, looking for people who wish to use fast and safe transport. 

As any business generating income, the business of Ayham also requires some investment from time to time. Thus, now his car needs some fixing. For this purpose he is requesting a loan. Ayham promises to repay the loan promptly and thanks all supporting him.

loans.use: fix his vehicle used for providing taxi services

loans.name: Monisola

texts.en: Monisola is 56 years old and married with two children who are in higher institution of learning. Monisola has been trading on foodstuff like plantain, beans, fufu (native food prepared from cassava) for a long time as she never had a formal education. She says due to family demand she find it difficult put back her profit into the business in other to expand it.Monisola goes to village market buys foodstuff in bulk as they are cheaper there, she comes back and sells in retail and wholesale. She is requesting for the loan amount of N120,000 to purchase more foodstuff. Thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more bunch of plantain

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: A. sells clothing material (sarongs) that can be used to make various styles of one's choice. She has been selling these for the past nine years. She hopes for the loan amount of N120,000 to purchase sarong material in bulk at a reduced cost, and to also reduce the risk of being on the road often. A. is 45 years old and married with three children. When the children are on holiday from their schools, they assist her a lot in the business. A. says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more sarong material to sell

loans.name: Lili

texts.fr: Lili est née le 15/12/1979 à Agoné. Lili est mariée à Christian. Ils ont un seul enfant qui est scolarisé. La famille vit à Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin depuis vingt cinq ans. C’est le mari de Lili qui assure les dépenses de la famille. Lili vend à manger devant chez elle à la maison. Lili est dans cette activité depuis dix ans. C’est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Lili achète ses provisions. Pour renforcer son fonds de roulement et faire ses provisions en gros, Lili sollicite ce premier crédit d’ALIDé.

loans.use: Achat de sacs de maïs, riz, de causette d’igname, de paniers de tomates fraîches, d’oignons, des épices et de l’huile d’arachide.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en: Rachael sells tailoring materials and has been in this business for the past four years, on her own, after training for two years. In her locality she is the only one selling tailoring materials, hence the increasing demand. She is requesting for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. Rachael is 32 years old and married with two children. She says thank you,

loans.use: To purchase tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.en:
Gulshan lives in the town of Istaravshan with her husband and three children. She has had a retail business for about 8 years and is in the process of expanding it. Gulshan sells a variety of clothing for women in local market. By offering a range of clothing items, she provides a convenient stop for her customers who often will buy more than just one item from her. Gulshan has requested a loan to increase her working capital and help sustain her business. Purchasing inventory from wholesalers has required a substantial investment from Gulshan, which is why she decided to obtain a loan. This loan will give her added flexibility and will help cover some of her growing expenses while she develops a larger business. Additional profits generated by her business will provide her with stable income and the ability to support her family financially. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of clothing for selling

loans.name: Suhair

texts.en:
Suhair works very hard in her clothing sales business.She lives in Palestine where she is married and has one child. At the moment she needs to purchase clothing to continue her business so she has turned to Ryada to request a loan. With this amount of money she will be able to get ahead with her business, which really needs this investment.

Note: The picture featured in this business profile is the husband of the female entrepreneur. With some families in Palestine, it is culturally unacceptable to post a picture of a woman on the Internet, but the loan is to the female entrepreneur.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Rasidatu

texts.en: Rasidatu sells frozen food. Apart from this shop where she sells frozen food, she also sells smoked ice fish in the market. She has been in this business for the past ten years. Rasidatu is 37 years old and married with five children. She is requesting for the loan amount of N120,000 to purchase more cartoons of frozen goods to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase frozen food to sell

loans.name: Sabohat

texts.en:
J. Sabohat is a brave married woman who works hard for the good of her two children. The strict discipline she uses with her children allows her to count on her household’s advice and support in working the fields. Sabohat’s children’s grateful attitude continues to encourage her, and they have learned many lessons during this time that they can use when they form their own households. What Sabohat urgently needs right now are fertilizers and other chemicals for cultivating her land and to be prepared for upcoming growing season. Sabohat doesn’t just need good land; she also needs a friendly hand to help her out.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasw of seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Mirnumon

texts.en:
K. Mirnumon is a 52-year-old farmer who lives with his family consisting of three children and his wife. He has two milk cows and sells dairy products to the local and capital traders. Mirnumon has 15 years of experience in raising cattle and selling dairy products. The milk products are in very high demand in his village. Mirnumon’s orders for these products are very high, but the milk his cows give is not enough for tradersm and he decided to apply for 6000 Somoni to purchase an additional cow and fodder. Mirnumon is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to improve his living with this loan. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. loans.use: Purchasw cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Mirhalim

texts.en:
M. Mirhalim is 51 years old. He has experience of 2 years preparing and selling cookies and different kinds of sweets. He began working with a friend delivering bread. With the money he saved in the activity, he decided to buy an oven and now works as an independent with his wife. The business is successful, generating stable, considerable income, allowing Mirhalim to support his family. Mirhalim wants the Kiva loan to be able to buy products and necessary equipment for the preparation of the extra cookies, because at this time he is only supplying the part of the demand. With this loan he wants to expand his business, thus to be able to supply all of his customers and also to make better condition of the business. Mirhalim would like to thank everyone for supporting him and promises to repay the loan in time. The well-being of this family is in your hands. Help them by contributing to the growth of Mirhalim’s business, and they will sincerely thank you. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new equipment and making better condition of the business

loans.name: Débora

texts.fr: Débora est née en 1984 à Kétou dans le Département de Plateau. Débora est mariée à Moïse. Ils ont un enfant ensemble. La famille vit à Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. C’est le mari de Débora qui assure les dépenses du foyer. Débora vend des bijoux. Pour acheter ses articles, Débora va au Nigeria et au Ghana, États frontaliers au Bénin. C’est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Débora vend ses bijoux. Il y a dix ans que Débora est dans cette activité de vente de bijoux. Pour mieux développer son activité, Débora sollicite ce premier prêt d’ALIDé.
texts.en:
Débora was born in 1984 in Kétou (Plateau County). She is married to Moïse. Together they have one child. The family lives in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. Débora’s husband ensures that household expenses are met. Débora sells jewelry. To buy her goods, she goes to Nigeria and Ghana, nations near Benin. Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin, is where she sells her jewelry. She has been in this business for ten years. To develop her business further, she is requesting this loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy jewelry

loans.name: Suzanne

texts.en:
Suzanne was born in Adjohoun, a small town near Porto-Novo, the capital of Benin. In Porto-Novo, she runs a small restaurant near a main road, where she sells rice, beans, noodles, and spicy Beninese sauce. Suzanne has been running this activity for at least fifteen years. Suzanne is very busy during the middle of the day, when Beninese people take their main meal.  

Suzanne is seeking her second loan from Alide, a Kiva Field Partner in Benin. She would like to restock her supplies of beans, rice, and noodles. Suzanne hopes to increase her profits enough to one day be able to buy a piece of land of her own. Suzanne has four children, all of whom are already grown.

loans.use: Rice, beans, and noodles

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary sells drinks, fried meat and pepper soup. She gets her drinks from the company vehicle, which goes 'round the town to supply those who buy in large quantity. Mary has been in these businesses for over eight years. Mary hopes for the loan amount of N120,000 to purchase drinks to sell. She is 50 years old and married with two children, with the increase in profit as a result of this loan my family will be better cared for. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase drinks to sell

loans.name: Damaris Waithera

texts.en: Damaris N. is 30 years old and married with two children. Her husband is a public-service driver. She lives in the Muthure area which is an upcoming business centre in Kikuyu where she also operates her business. She has been in business for the last year, and is currently involved in various activities. Damaris was introduced to KADET by a friend and had initially borrowed from a micro-finance organization called Kenya Women Finance Trust. Damaris has a good credit history with KADET, as she paid all her loans well and on time. This will be her third loan which she plans to invest her dairy farming business by buying another cow for milk production. Her customers are largely the traders in the Muthure center. Damaris hopes to get orders to supply to shops, hotels and dairy societies. Besides farming, she also sells shoes for extra income. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To buy another cow to increase her milk supply

loans.name: Erali

texts.en:
Born in Istaravshan town in 1979, Erali now lives with his wife and their two children. They are also responsible for caring of his old parents. Erali is a farmer. Recognized by the people of the neighborhood as a serious man, Erali would like to expand his crop into a viable source of income. In order to do that, he needs a loan of 3000 Somoni to buy seeds and fertilizer so as to expand his crop. The income from it will then help him to cope with the needs of his large family and educate all his children. Erali is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to achieve his dreams with this loan.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing the seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Djiguiya 1 De Wayere Farakala Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe Djiguiya 1 sont des hommes mariés  ayant en moyenne  35ans, 4 enfants et vivant  la plupart dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies à WAYERE un des villages de la commune rurale de FARAKALA, préfecture  de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs cultures de maïs. Ils sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce  prêt, ils comptent acheter,  des  engrais et d’herbicides pour entretenir 10 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, aux marchés de FARAKALA  et  de SIKASSO après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes souvent venant de BAMAKO ou du SENEGAL. 
Ils comptent réaliser un bénefice moyen de 55.000FCFA par campagne.
Les producteurs du groupe Djiguiya 1 souhaitent avoir des montants à hauteur de souhait.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Djiguiya 1 group are married men with an average age of 35 and on average, 4 children. They mostly live in traditional extended families in Wayere, one of the villages of the rural township of Farakala, prefecture of Sikasso, 3rd administrative region of Mali.

They work together with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso so that they can successfully grow their maize crops. They are working with the institution for the first time.

With this loan, they intend to buy fertilizer and herbicides to maintain 10 hectares. Their crops are sold in the village, in the markets of Farakala and Sikasso, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women, often coming from Bamako or from Senegal. They expect to make an average profit of 55,000 F CFA per growing season. The agriculturalists of the Djiguiya 1 group would like to have unlimited amounts.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of fertilizer and herbicides

loans.name: Karomat

texts.en: N. Karomat is a 63-year-old woman who has been working the land for twenty years. She is a strong physical and spiritual woman and, each day, she and her husband work diligently to make sure that they take good care of their crop. Their biggest source of income is the fruit of their labor; they grow onions, wheat and watermelons. Karomat is proud of the quality of her crops and of her knowledge. While waiting for the best moment of production, she is requesting a loan in order to maintain her crops, holding off on the harvest until the market indicates that it is the best time to yield the biggest profits. Karomat’s dream is to acquire more land and produce more crops in the future because the land that she loves and has been a part of her life has allowed her to move her family forward. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, including ammonium sulfate, and herbicides

loans.name: Danielle

texts.en:
K. Danielle was born in Porto-Novo. On the edge of town, a short walk from her home, she runs a small stand, where she sells food, candy, drinks, and cell phone cards. She also has a telephone, which she lets her customers use for a fee. During the school year, Danielle sells her products to students at different schools in Porto-Novo.

Business is going well, but could be better. Danielle would like a loan in order to restock her inventory in order to increase her sales. Specifically, she will buy rice, cell phone cards, and peanut oil.

Danielle is married and has four children. Her husband works for an electricity company in Porto-Novo. Her oldest child is 16 and her youngest is seven months.

loans.use: To buy more rice, peanut oil, and cell phone cards

loans.name: Mahmad

texts.en: O. Mahmad is a 44-year-old married man who owns a small farm. He is a hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and educate his children who, today, are working adults thanks to his example. Mahmad runs a business of raising and selling cattle and has sixteen years of experience in this field. Since cattle-raising and selling is a profitable business, he has become a very successful businessman. He works very hard and spends all his time with his animals, cleaning them, feeding them and pasturing them. Now, Mahmad wants to expand his business and buy more cattle. To do that, he applied for a loan of 825 USD. He thanks all lenders for their support. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy more cattle in order to expand his business

loans.name: Rosemonde

texts.en:
H. Rosemonde is married and has four children. Her oldest child is 16 and her youngest is 6. Her husband is an electrician.

There she sells a variety of goods in a stand near her home. Her stand is on the edge of a dirt road, a short walk from a busy Porto-Novo street. Among other things, Rosemonde sells candy, soap, medicine, toothpaste, drinks, and snacks. She has been selling in this place for seventeen years. Before, when she was younger, Rosemonde sold goods near her parents’ home. She buys her products at the Ouando Market.

Supplementing her income, Rosemonde is the owner of a motorcycle taxi. She employs someone to drive the motorcycle and they share the profits.

Rosemonde is seeking a loan from Alidé, a Kiva Field Partner, in order to restock her inventory. In the future, she also hopes to be able to start selling Beninese fabrics, necklaces, and jewelry.

loans.use: To buy more candy, soap, medicine and other products to sell

loans.name: Farrukh

texts.en: T. Farrukh is a 29-year-old man. His wife works as a housekeeper, and they have four children. His family plans include moving forward with crop production so that he can financially support his children’s studies. Farrukh has been working in agriculture for five years. The biggest problem he faces is that pest insects have affected his crops, and he does not have enough money to deal with the problem. He is requesting this loan in order to use it for his crops, thus thwarting losses. Agriculture is his family’s source of income. For this reason, Farrukh gives thanks to IMON and Kiva for the support they are giving him with this loan, which will be of great benefit to his crops. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C.
