And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase insecticide as well as seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Djiguiya 2 De Wayere Farakala Group

texts.fr:
Les dix   membres du groupe  Djiguiya 2 sont tous des hommes mariés  qui ont en moyenne  37ans, 5 enfants et vivent la plupart dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies à WAYERE un des villages de la commune rurale de FARAKALA, préfecture  de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Les membres du groupe Djiguiya 2 collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs cultures de maïs.
Ils sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution et comptent acheter avec ce prêt, des engrais et des herbicides pour entretenir 10 hectares. 
Leurs productions sont vendues au niveau du village, dans les marchés de FARAKALA  et  de SIKASSO après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes souvent venant de BAMAKO (capitale du Mali) ou du SENEGAL. 
Ils comptent réaliser un bénefice moyen de 55.000FCFA par campagne.
Les producteurs du groupe Djiguiya 2 souhaitent avoir des montants à hauteur de souhait.

loans.use: Achat d’engrais et d’herbicides.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. sells groceries at Elmina. She has senior high school education. She is single and has two children. She is responsible for paying the utility bills and for the upkeep of her dependents.

Mary has been selling groceries since 2006. Her loan will be used to purchase more groceries to sell in her shop. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to further her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell in her shop

loans.name: Djiguiya 3 De Wayere Farakala Group

texts.fr:
Les sept  membres du groupe Djiguiya 3 sont tous des hommes mariés  avec une moyenne d’âge de 31ans, 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies à WAYERE un des villages de la commune rurale de FARAKALA, préfecture  de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs cultures de maïs. 
Ils sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution et comptent acheter, des engrais et des herbicides pour entretenir 7 hectares. 
Leurs productions sont vendues au niveau du village, dans les marchés de FARAKALA  et  de SIKASSO après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes souvent venant de BAMAKO ou du SENEGAL. 
Ils comptent réaliser un bénefice moyen de 55.000FCFA par campagne.
Les producteurs du groupe Djiguiya souhaitent avoir des montants à hauteur de souhait.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Djiguiya 3 group are all married men with an average age of 31 and on average, 3 children. They mostly live in traditional extended families in Wayere, one of the villages of the rural township of Farakala, prefecture of Sikasso, 3rd administrative region of Mali.

They work together with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso so that they can successfully raise their maize crops. They are working with the institution for the first time, and they intend to buy fertilizer and herbicides to maintain 7 hectares.

Their crops are sold in the village, in the markets of Farakala and Sikasso, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women, often coming from Bamako or from Senegal. They expect to make an average profit of 55,000 F CFA per growing season. The agriculturalists of the Djiguiya 1 group would like to have unlimited amounts.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of fertilizer and herbicides

loans.name: Ben K.

texts.en: Ben G. is 37 years old and married with two children. He lives in, and operates his business in, Zambezi which is a very busy business center and with a lot of construction work going on. Hence, his hardware shop is strategically placed and stands a good chance of expanding. His customers are mainly retailers and builders. Ben was introduced to KADET by a friend, and this will be his first loan. He has not borrowed from other sources before and with the loan he has applied for he hopes to restock his hardware shop. Ben hopes to expand his business and be able to supply to construction companies and grow the business to wholesale. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To restock his hardware shop so as to meet his customers' needs

loans.name: Djiguiya 4 De Wayere Farakala Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe Djiguiya 4 sont tous des hommes mariés  qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 35ans, 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies à WAYERE un des villages de la commune rurale de FARAKALA,  préfecture  de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs cultures de maïs. 
Ils sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution et comptent  acheter des engrais et des herbicides pour entretenir 7 hectares. 
Leurs productions sont vendues au niveau du village, dans les marchés de FARAKALA  et  de SIKASSO après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes souvent venant de BAMAKO ou du SENEGAL. 
Ils comptent réaliser un bénefice moyen de 55.000FCFA par campagne.
NB: Daouda B. est absent de la photo car était allé accompagner son épouse au centre de santé.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Djiguiya 4 group are all married men with an average age of 35 and on average, 4 children. They mostly live in traditional extended families in Wayere, one of the villages of the rural township of Farakala, prefecture of Sikasso, 3rd administrative region of Mali.

They work together with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso so that they can successfully raise their maize crops. They are working with the institution for the first time, and they intend to buy fertilizer and herbicides to maintain 7 hectares.

Their crops are sold in the village, in the markets of Farakala and Sikasso, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women, often coming from Bamako or from Senegal. They expect to make an average profit of 55,000 F CFA per growing season.

Note: Daouda B. is not in the photo because he had gone to accompany his spouse to the health center.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of fertilizer and herbicides

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Agatha A. sells pastries alongside her small fast-food restaurant at Elmina. She has a vocational background. Agatha is a single parent with three children. She is responsible for the payment of utility bills and the upkeep of her dependents.

Agatha has been selling pastries alongside her fast food restaurant since 2004.  Her loan will be used to buy more margarine and oil to make her pastries and also to buy other ingredients to operate her restaurant. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more margarine and oil to make her pastries and also other ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Korofo

texts.en:
Korofo runs a business selling foodstuffs in a restaurant and needs a loan in order to set up another restaurant. She is a 45-year-old woman who has three children. She is married.

 With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house that she can put up for rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. The programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs, as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program – which is targeted towards returning war refugees – has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To set up another restaurant

loans.name: Aminu

texts.en:
Aminu produces and sells a locally-made cooker. Aminu is 48 years old and married to Mr. O., who is a teacher, and they have seven children. The family lives in Lagos state.

Aminu has been in this business for five years now. She hopes for a loan of 150,000 nairas to purchase materials in bulk for producing the cooker. She says this will reduce the unit cost and will help pay for transportation to the market. This will increase her profit which will help her in better caring for her family.

loans.use: To purchase material for cooker production

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan has owned a satellite station for nine years. His clients are people from his region. He did not have problems starting his business. Hassan decided on this business because he wanted to work independently. He is a 51-year-old man who lives in Tyre, Southern Lebanon, with his wife and their five children. He requested a loan of $1000 US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase new satellite machines for his work. 

Hassan has been a microcredit client for five years now and has always paid on time. His previous loans helped him improve his business as well as his financial situation. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase new satellite machines for his work.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa A. is married and has two children. She has received schooling through senior high school. Theresa sells soap and salt at Elmina, which she has been doing since 2008. Her husband works with the forestry department. Theresa uses her income to support in the up keep of the house. Theresa will use the loan to purchase soap and salt in large quantities to resell at the market. With the new profits from her expanded business, Theresa plans to educate her dependants.

loans.use: Theresa will use the loan to purchase soap and salt in large quantities to resell at the market.

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en:
Kassem has been selling construction materials like iron, stones and sand for four years. He uses a truck for his work. His clients can be anybody, but they are mostly construction firms. When Kassem first started his work, he didn’t face difficulties. He decided on this business because he wanted to work independently. 

Kassem is a 32-year-old man who lives in Tyre, Southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. He requested a loan of $2000 US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is his fourth loan cycle and he has always repaid on time. His previous loan helped him improve his business. In the future, he plans on improving his work by purchasing more sophisticated tools.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Slayman

texts.en:
S. is a 39 year old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife and their four children. S. has been working as a taxi driver for eleven years. S. requested a loan of 2200 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his car and purchase new car seats. This is his third cycle and he has always on time. 
S. is special in his work because he knows how to treat his client and has a clean car. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. When he first started his business, he didn’t have a lot of cash and used to work as a driver. S. decided on doing his business because he didn’t want to work for someone, he wanted to have an independent work. In the future, he plans on expanding his business by purchasing a school van.

loans.use: To do some maintenance work on his car and purchase new car seats.

loans.name: Baker

texts.en:
Baker has owned a home products store for eleven years, selling home products and cleaning supplies. He is outstanding in his work because he knows how to treat his clients and offers a large variety of products. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. When he first started his business, he didn’t have a lot of cash and there were not a lot of passer-bys. Baker decided on this business because he wanted to work independently and likes sales. 

Baker is a 45 year old man who lives in Saida, Southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. He requested a loan of $1300 US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his business. This is his second loan cycle and he has always repaid on time. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his home products store

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary P. sells gari, sugar and groundnuts at Elmina, which she has done since 2007. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a carpenter. She has received schooling through junior high school. Mary uses her income for the upkeep of her home. She will use this loan to purchase more food supplies to resell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to save toward building a new house.

loans.use: To purchase more food supplies to resell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 66 year old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Ali has owned a grocery store for nineteen years. Ali requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise. This is his third cycle and he has always on time. 
Ali is special in his work because he knows how to treat his client. His clients are family members, friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t have a lot of cash, as well as not a lot of passer-bys. Ali decided on doing his business because he used to work as a furniture painter but he didn’t like it and he also wanted to have an independent work. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Chaker

texts.en:
Chaker is a 44 year old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Chaker has been working as a carpenter for nine years. Chaker requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a new tool for his work. This is the first time that Chaker has requested a loan.
Chaker is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t have a lot of cash. Chaker decided on doing his business because of his experience since he learned when he was young. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase a new tool for his work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more flour and margarine to increase the production of her bread and pastries.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 27 year old man who lives in Beirut, capital of Lebanon. Mohamad has owned an Internet cafe. He requested a loan of 1500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase UPS and electrical wires. This is the first time that Mohamad has requested a loan.
Mohamad is special in his work because he owns new materials and knows how to suits his clients. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When Mohamad first started his business, he had financial issues. He decided on doing his business because of his experience, as well as his self-confidence in opening his work. In the future, he plans on expanding.

loans.use: To purchase UPS and electrical wires.

loans.name: Houda

texts.en:
Houda has been working as a hairdresser. Houda is outstanding in her work because she knows how to treat her clients and is aware of new hairstyles. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she didn’t have startup capital. She decided on this business to take advantage of her experience. 

Houda is a 45-year-old woman who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with her husband and their four children. She requested a loan of $1700 US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase new tools for her work. This is her second loan cycle and she has always repaid on time. In the future, she plans on expanding her business.

loans.use: To purchase new tools for her salon

loans.name: Bosede

texts.en: Bosede is 48 years old. She is married and has three children. She lives with the entire family in Lagos State. Bosede sells drinks and has been in this business for the past eight years. She is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase a freezer for cooling the drinks. This will enable her to reduce costs, increase profits and satisfy customers. She promises to repay the loan and says "thank you."

loans.use: To purchase a freezer

loans.name: Sekinatu

texts.en:
Sekinatu sells clothing materials and the fabrics that are used to make native clothing. She sells clothing in different styles based on customer demand. She goes to Lagos Island twice every month to purchase these goods. She has been in this trade for five years and, with patience, has groomed her business to this level. She is hoping for a loan of N100,000 to purchase clothing materials to sell. 

Sekinatu is 50 years old. She is married and has four children. 

"Loans from LAPO have greatly improved my business and family life. I am grateful to all who make this loan accessible," says Sekinatu.

loans.use: To purchase clothing materials to sell.

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en:
Mouhamad is a 58-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Mouhamad owns a grocery store. He has requested a loan of $2200 US dollars from Al Majmoua  to purchase merchandise and change his decor. This is his second loan and he has always paid on time. 

His previous loans helped him to diversify his merchandise. Mouhamad is special in his work because he offers a large variety of products. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When Mouhamad first started his business, he had financial issues. He decided to start his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans to expand his store.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and change his decor.

loans.name: Tausi

texts.en:
Tausi is a member of the zizi la ngombe borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 38 years old woman,she is married and a mother of  children.Her children are aged  and  years.she also cares for 1 dependent.

Tausi started her own business selling tomatoes,anions,banana 1 year ago,she works  hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately , Tanzania shillings.

This is Tausi first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more banana,tomatoes etc.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Tausi hopes to save money,pay school fees and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more tpmatoes,banana,onions

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret J. lives in Hai mayo, Buluk, Juba. She is 38, married with two children. Margret previously ran a retail shop near her home since 9 months ago and finally closed the shop because of low profits.

The little capital she had, made her possible to purchase local alcohol to sell in the bar and is requesting a loan to stock crates of beer to sell. In the future, Margret wants to pay school fees for her children.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase beer to sell

loans.name: Shosanya

texts.en: Shosanya sells clothing materials used as lining in making clothes of different styles by customers as occasion demands. She has been in this trade for the past five years and with patience has groomed this business to this level. She is requesting for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase clothing materials to sell.Shosanya is 27 years old and married with two children. I am grateful to all who makes this loan accessible.

loans.use: To purchase clothing materials to sell.

loans.name: Blue Group

texts.en:
Jamila D., age 34, is single with three children ages 14, 12 and 3years.  She has a table top (fruits and vegetable) and grocery (cold drinks)business, which she started 3 years ago.  She works daily from 7am until 11pm.     She is able to earn a monthly profit of around $188.
 
This will be Jamila’s 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to increase stock on the table top and started selling cold drinks and has paid back the loan successfully. She hopes for a new loan to still increase on both businesses.
	
Jamila will share this loan with her loan group Blue, which totals 17 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Jamila is  second from right at the back in white..

loans.use: To increase on business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary D. sells bread and pastries at Elmina. Mary has received senior high school education.  She is married and has two children. Her husband is an electrician. Mary has been selling bread and pastries since 2006. She helps in the upkeep of her home. Her loan will be used to buy more flour and margarine to increase the production of her bread and pastries. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more flour and margarine to increase the production of her bread and pastries.

loans.name: Tope

texts.en: Tope is 38 years old and married with three children. She is a hardworking woman and she has been borrowing from LAPO for the past two years. She has fish farm and also sells fresh fish and has been in business for the past eight years. Tope’s focus is to expand her business and she is doing all she can to pull her family to a higher level financially.Tope is requesting for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase fingerling to sell and thereby meet customer’s needs. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase fingerling (baby fish)

loans.name: Bineta

texts.fr: bineta M. est une societaire parent beneficiaire depuis 1994.elle s'exerce dans le domaine de la fripperie et capitalise une experience de dix ans dans cet activite.elle sollicite un pret de cent cinquante mille(150 000)frs pour elargir son marche et accroitre ses benefices pour mieux faire face a ses responsabilites familiales car c'est une femme qui contribue beaucoup a l'entretien de sa famille.
texts.en:
Bineta M. has been a recipient parent member since 1994. She operates in the domain of second-hand clothing and capitalizes on ten years of experience in this business. She’s requesting a loan of 150,000 francs to expand her market and to grow her profits in order to cope better with family responsibilities, since she’s a woman who does a lot to look after her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Union Cascada Group

texts.es: La asociación comunal “Unión Cascada” es parte del centro focal Cascada, trabajan  junto  a Pro-Mujer hace diez años,  su presidenta es  Paula L.,  ella es una de las fundadoras , ha formado el grupo en sus inicios con familiares, vecinas de su barrio y amigas. Diversas son las actividades de este grupo, como ser; costura de ropa, trenzado de mantas, tejido de mantas artesanales, otras son comerciantes de verdura, fruta, víveres y cereales entre otros. Esta asociación desea comprar mercadería para ampliar sus ventas, de este modo generaran mayores ganancias y por lo tanto mejores ingresos para el bienestar de sus familias.
texts.en:
The community group “Unión Cascada” is part of the Cascada focal group. They have worked together with Pro-Mujer for ten years. Their president, Paula L. who is one of the founders, first formed the group with her family members, neighbours and friends. The group's activities are very diverse, such as; sewing clothing, weaving blankets, sewing handcrafted blankets. Others sell vegetables, fruit, general provisions and cereals, among other things. This association wishes to buy merchandise to increase their sales, and in this way generate higher earnings and therefore better incomes for the wellbeing of their families.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise/COMPRA DE MERCADERIA

loans.name: Zoila Del Socorro

texts.es:
La microempresaria Zoila del Socorro E. tiene 37 años de edad, tiene 5 hijos de los cuales solamente 3 estudian los otros 2 aun no se encuentran en edad de estudiar, Doña Zoila se dedica a la actividad de costura desde un poco mas de 20 años y sus principales clientes son jóvenes del barrio a quienes les confecciona sus uniformes y trajes casuales.
Esta costurera ya ha sido beneficiada con un crédito de US 500 dólares los cuales pudo cancelar antes del tiempo previsto, ya que obtuvo un pequeño contrato en donde confecciono uniformes de una institución local. El cual aprovecha la microempresaria Zoila E. para agradecer a Kiva y a los prestamistas por su gesto tan noble al cederle ese préstamo.
Sin embargo el próximo mes de Septiembre se aproximan las fiestas patrias y desde ya tiene varios encargos para confeccionar blusas y camisas escolares al igual que faldas y pantalones de uniformes.
Para tal encargo la señora E. debe comprar la tela tanto de las camisas y blusas como de los pantalones y faldas, por lo que necesita se le financie para comprar:

2 Rollos de Tela color blanca marca Sincatex la cual compra a US 260 cada rollo  y 2 rollos de  tela color azul marca Dacron tico la cual compra a US 90 cada rollo.
texts.en:
The micro-entrepreneur Zoila del Socorro E. is 37 years old and has 5 children, of whom only 3 are in school and the other 2 are not yet school-aged. Mrs. Zoila has pursued sewing for more than 20 years, and her main clients are youngsters from the neighborhood, for whom she makes uniforms and casual clothes. This seamstress has already benefitted from a loan of $500, which she repaid before the designated time, since she got a small contract, for which she made uniforms for a local institution. Zoila E. is thankful to Kiva and the lenders for their noble gesture of granting her this loan. In September, many parties are getting closer and until then, she has many orders to make blouses and school shirts, as well as skirts and pants for uniforms. For such orders, Mrs. E. must buy enough fabric for shirts, blouses, pants and skirts. She needs the loan to buy 2 rolls of Sincatex-brand white fabric, each of which costs $260, and 2 rolls of Dacron-brand blue fabric, each of which costs $90.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy Sincatex-brand white fabric and Dacron-brand blue fabric

loans.name: Crane Group

texts.en:
Fredy R., age 35, is widower with three children ages 8, 4 and 2 years. He has a hardware business that he started 5 years ago. He works daily from 8am until 6pm. He is able to earn a monthly profit of around $228.
 
This will be R.’s 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He hopes to get a loan to increase his hardware stock.
	
R. will share this loan with his loan group, Crane Group, which has 17 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans. In the picture, R. is 2nd from left at the back.

loans.use: Increase his business.

loans.name: Luciernagas Group

texts.es: La asociación comunal “Luciérnagas”  pertenece al centro Focal Collpani,  ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto, trabajan  junto  a Pro-Mujer hace tres años. Este grupo en su mayoría son comerciantes, por ejemplo se dedican a la venta de artefactos electrónicos, cremas y pomadas, detergentes, cosméticos,  otras de las socias tienen tiendas de barrio. Este grupo  necesita comprar productos al por mayor para conseguir mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
The community group “Luciérnagas” ('fireflies'), belongs to the focal centre Collpani and is located in the city of El Alto. They have worked together with Pro-Mujer for three years. The majority of this group are salespeople, for example they dedicate themselves to selling electronic equipment, creams and ointments, detergents and cosmetics, and other members have stores in the neighbourhood. This group needs to buy products in bulk to generate higher earnings.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products in bulk/COMPRA DE PRODUCTOS AL POR MAYOR

loans.name: Funmi

texts.en: Funmi sells utensils and drinks. She gets goods directly from the producers, because she is a big dealer and has been in this business since 2003. Funmi is 42 years old and married with a child. Funmi is hoping for a loan of N140,000 to purchase more utensils and drinks to sell. She thanks you

loans.use: To purchase utensils and drinks to sell

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie lives in Porto Novo, the capital of Benin. She has seven children, all of whom are adults. Her principal business activity is preparing smoked fish. She buys fish every morning in the St. Pierre neighborhood of Porto-Novo and then prepares them at her house. Marie makes a smoky fire under a grill and lets the fish smoke until they are blackened. She covers the fish to preserve the moisture. When she is finished, Marie sells the fish on the streets of Porto-Novo. Marie also sells tomatoes on the side.
  
Marie has been preparing smoked fish for thirteen years. Before that, she made soldabi, a Beninese liquor, but quit that business because it was too time consuming. She says that the current economic crisis has made her sales more difficult. Marie is seeking her second loan from Alide, a Kiva field partner in Benin, to buy more fish. She hopes to increase her profits by restocking her supplies and selling more fish.

loans.use: Fish

loans.name: Morenike

texts.en: Morenike is 45 years old. She is married and has four children. She has been borrowing from LAPO for the past three years. Morenike sells noodles in cartons. She has been in this business for nine years. Morenike is requesting a loan of N140,000 to purchase more noodles to sell. She promises to pay back promptly and says "thank you."

loans.use: To purchase noodles to sell

loans.name: Amig Chaco Group

texts.es:
En el centro focal Collpani, se reúne la asociación “Amig Chaco”, está conformado por trece mujeres , demostrando responsabilidad en sus dos años de trabajo junto a Pro-Mujer. Actualmente su presidenta es  Petrona M.,  ella prepara almuerzos y los vende en una pensión familiar.
Diversos son los negocios de este grupo, tales como: venta de cosméticos, costura y venta de polleras, centros y mantas, chompas y ponchos tejidos a mano, venta de fruta, verduras, material de escritorio . Ellas afirman que necesitan comprar mercadería y/o materia prima (compra de lana, tela, arroz por quintal y otros dependiendo el caso).
texts.en:
The association "Amig Chaco" meets in the focal centre Collpani and is made up of thirteen women who have demonstrated their responsible natures during the two years that they have been working with Pro-Mujer. Their current president is Petrona M., and she prepares lunches and sells them at a family hostel.

This group's activities are diverse, such as; the sale of cosmetics, sewing, the sale of hand-woven skirts, blankets, sweaters and ponchos, the sale of fruit, vegetables and writing materials. They need to buy merchandise and /or basic materials (such as wool, fabric, rice by the kilo and other things depending on the case).


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise and/or basic materials/COMPRA DE MERCADERIA Y/O MATERIA PRIMA

loans.name: Aurora Flavia

texts.es:
La señora Aurora es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres progresivas”, ubicado en la el distrito de Asillo, provincia de Azangaro, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 36 años de edad, es soltera y es madre de 02 hijos, ella estudio educación secundaria completa.  Vive en la Comunidad de Santa Cruz.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 6 meses, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió para la comprar de  ganado menor (ovinos).

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, con este monto ella comprará ganado menor (ovinos) para engorde.  Aurora los compra y vende en las ferias de ganado de la región.

Su deseo es darles una profesión a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan los encuentros y las reuniones entre Bancos Comunales.

loans.use: Para la compra de ovinos

loans.name: Lydia Kai

texts.en:
Lydia is married and has four children. Her husband is a welder. Her oldest child passed the Bac this year and will go to university in the fall. Lydia lives on the outskirts of Porto-Novo, the capital of Benin. She sells second-hand clothes, snacks, and vegetables in front of her home. She has been involved in this activity for ten years. Lydia buys her goods in Cotonou, a large city that is about an hour away. 

Lydia has already had two loans from Alide, a Kiva field partner in Benin. Thanks to these Alide loans, she was able to buy a machine that grinds peppers that are used in many Beninese dishes. She supplements her sales by letting people use the grinder for a fee. Lydia is seeking a third loan to restock her inventory. She would also like to start selling jewelry and necklaces.

loans.use: Second-hand clothes, jewelry, necklaces, and other goods

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Fe Y Alegria De Huancalle Group

texts.es:
Los socios son 11 miembros conformando el banco comunal  “FE Y ALEGRÍA D. HUANCALLE”, ellos viven en la comunidad D. Huancalle, ubicado en el distrito D. Taray en la Provincia D. Calca en la ciudad D. Cusco.

Nuestros socios alternan sus diferentes actividades tanto del hogar como la agricultura y la crianza D. animales menores para su venta, con la artesanía, ellos están ubicados en el primer acceso al valle sagrado D. los Inkas y aprovechan esto, para instalar sus artesanías en el mirador D. Taray, desD. ahí se aprecia una bellísima vista hacia parte del valle sagrado D. los inkas y las montañas vistosas y algunos nevados, en este punto los visitantes a la ciudad del Cusco hacen una parada obligada para tomarse algunas fotos y aprovechar a comprar algunos recuerdos en arcilla fina. Nuestros socios solicitan el crédito para poder comprar materiales,  alquilar el horno para coser la arcilla, también muchos para comprar mas souvenirs al por mayor y venderlos.

Nuestros socios agradecen y valoran el préstamo otorgado y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
There are eleven members that make up the community group “FE Y ALEGRÍA D. HUANCALLE” ('The Faith and Happiness of Huancalle'), and they live in the community of Huancalle which is located in the district of Taray, in the province of Calca, in the city of Cusco.

Our members alternate their home commitments with agriculture, the rearing of young animals for sale, and handcrafts. They are all located in the sacred valley of the Inkas and they take advantage of this to set up their handcraft stalls at the viewpoint in Taray from where there is a beautiful view of the sacred valley of the Inkas and the clear mountains and the snow-covered mountains. It is at this point that all the visitors of the city of Cusco make an obligatory stop to take photos and take the opportunity to buy some souvenirs maD. out of fine clay. Our members would like credit to be able to buy materials, rent ovens to dry the clay, as well as buying more souvenirs by bulk to sell them.

Our members are grateful for and value these loans, and at the same time promise to meet the repayments at the appointed time.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital/Capital de trabajo.

loans.name: Gardenia Milagros

texts.es:
La señora Gardenia es socia del Banco Comunal “Flor de Canela” que esta ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 33 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, es madre de 03 hijos, ella pudo estudiar solo la secundaria completa, vive en el Barrio Bellavista.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace varios años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para adquirir galletas para venderlos en su negocio.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, este préstamo le servirá para poder comprar variedad de galletas, gaseosas, gelatinas.

Su deseo es poner una tienda de venta de galletas al por mayor.

A ella le gusta el cumplimiento y la puntualidad en su Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gardenia is a member of the “Cinnamon Flower” (Flor de Canela) Community Bank, which is located in the district of Puno, in the province of Puno, in the department of Puno. She is 33 years old, lives with her partner, and is the mother of 3 children. She was not able to complete secondary school. She lives in the Bellavista neighborhood. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for many years. Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles. She used the loan as capital to buy cookies and sell them through her business. At present, she needs another loan for 300 nuevos soles. This loan will be used to buy a variety of cookies, soda, and gelatin. Her dream is to have a store to sell cookies at wholesale. She like the performance and punctuality of her community bank.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cookies, soda, and gelatin

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase the quantity of her footwear stock

loans.name: Zinhoue

texts.en:
Zinhoue lives in Porto-Novo, Benin. She is married to a tailor and they have two children, ages seven and three. Zinhoue sells meals consisting of eggs, rice, and beans in Porto-Novo. She buys her ingredients each morning from the local farms surrounding Porto-Novo. She has a small stand on the side of a busy street where has been working for over five years. Before this, she helped her mother with her business, in which she sells rice and vegetables.   

Zinhoue is seeking a loan from Alide, a Kiva field partner in Benin. She has already acquired an Alide loan, which allowed her to start selling eggs along with her meals. With the help of another loan, she would like to replenish her supplies so that she can better serve her clientele. In the future, if she has the financial means, Zinhoue would like to start selling clothing.

loans.use: Eggs, bread, beans, and other foods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bananas, cookies, sweets, applies, etc.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La señora Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal “21 de Febrero”, en el distrito de de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y es madre de 5 hijos, ella pudo estudiar la educación secundaria  solo hasta 1er grado.  Vive en el Barrio Yaurima.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 3 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó en su negocio de compra de ganado menor.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 900.00 nuevos soles, el préstamo le servirá para poder comprar ganado mayor para engorde.  La señora Nancy también se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías (prendas de vestir).

Su deseo es  continuar trabajando y educar a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan los ahorros.
texts.en:
Señora Nancy is a member of the February 21st Community Bank in the district of Ilave, El Collao province, Puno department. She is 33 years old, married, and has five children. She completed the first year of high school and lives in the neighbourhood of Yaurima. She has worked with Kiva Parner Manuela Ramos for three years. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to buy young animals. She now needs a loan of 900 soles to buy livestock for fattening. Sra Nancy also earns her living by making handcrafted clothing. She would like to continue working as long as possible and to educate her children. Nancy likes being able to save with her bank.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy livestock

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La señora Julia es socia del Banco Comunal “21 D. Febrero”, en el distrito D. D. Ilave, provincia D. El Collao, en el departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 49 años D. edad, está casada y es madre D. 7 hijos, ella pudo estudiar la educación primaria solo hasta el 2do grado, vive en el Barrio D. Lacaya.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 2 años, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó en su negocio D. compra y venta D. ropa.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, el préstamo le servirá para poder comprar una vaca y un toro.  Ella también trabaja con artesanías elaborando colchas para bebes, etc.

Su deseo es  poner una tienda para vender artesanías.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y los encuentros entre Bancos Comunales.
texts.en:
Señora Julia is a member of the February 21st Community Bank in the district of Ilave, El Collao province, Puno department. She is 49 years old, married, and has seven children. She was only able to study up to second graD. and lives in the neighbourhood of Lacaya. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos organisation for two years. Her first loan of 500 soles was used for her business of buying and selling clothes. Julia now needs a loan of 1500 soles which she will use to buy a cow and a bull. She also makes handcrafted bedcovers for babies. Her wish is to open a store selling crafts. She enjoys the savings and meetings associated with the local community banks.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a cow and a bull

loans.name: Lysbeth

texts.es:
Lisbeth es socia del Banco Comunal “Diana de Gales”, en el distrito de Puno, provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 23 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Tiene estudios de educación superior (profesora de primaria).  Vive en el Barrio Victoria.

Lisbeth es socia nueva, y requiere un primer préstamo de   S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que le servirá para aumentar su capital en su negocio de venta de golosinas, ella va a comprar gaseosas, galletas, chocolates, caramelos, etc.

Su deseo es comprarse una casita.

A ella le gustan las facilidades en los préstamos y pagos.

loans.use: Para la compra de gaseosas, galletas, chocolates, caramelos, etc.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Maria Cristina es socia del Banco Comunal “Flor de Canela”, ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 60 años de edad, de estado civil soltera y es madre de 02 hijos, ella pudo estudiar solo la primaria completa.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 1 año, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para la preparación de comida.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional de S/. 600.00 Nuevos soles, el préstamo le servirá para poder comprar papa, arroz, carne, aceite, combustible, etc. Para poder preparar comida que vende en forma ambulatoria y también atiende pedidos.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando así ayudar a sus hijos y luego poner un restaurante.

A ella le gustan las reuniones y las facilidades en los pagos
texts.en:
Señora Maria Cristina is a member of the Flor de Canela (Cinnamon Flower) Community Bank in the district of Puno, Puno province, Puno department. She is 60 years old, single, has two children, and completed her primary education. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos organisation for one year. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to buy ingredients for making food. She now needs an additional loan of 600 soles to buy potatoes, rice, meat, oil, and fuel etc so that she can prepare food which she sells in the street. She also accepts orders. Maria Cristina wishes to continue working so that she can help her children and open a restaurant. She enjoys the meetings and the credit facilities associated with her bank.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy potatoes, rice, meat, oil, fuel etc

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres progresivas”, ubicado en la el distrito de Asillo, provincia de Azangaro, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y es madre de 1 hija, ella estudió educación secundaria completa, vive en el Sector Los Ángeles.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 6 meses, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió para la comprar ganado menor ovinos.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, con este monto ella va a comprar ganado vacunos para engorde.  Rosa los compra y vende en las ferias de ganado de la región.

Su deseo es darle una profesión a su hija.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las reuniones de Bancos Comunales.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa is a member of the community bank “Mujeres Progresivas” (Progressive Women), located in the district of Asillo, Azangaro Province, in the department of Puno. She is 46 years of age, is married, and is the mother of one daughter. She completed her secondary education. She lives in the Los Angeles Sector. Rosa has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 6 months. Her first loan was for 500 new soles, an amount that allowed her to buy young sheep. Currently, she is requesting an additional loan of 1000 new soles. With this sum, she is going to buy cattle for fattening. Rosa buys and sells them in the region’s livestock markets. Her wish is to give a profession to her daughter. She likes the savings and the meetings of the community bank

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of cattle for fattening

loans.name: Adeshola

texts.en: Adeshola is 30 years old, married with four children and runs a shop where she sells cooked food as well as raw foodstuffs. She opened her own shop after joining LAPO two years ago, prior to which hawked cooked food from place to place but could sell only what she could carry. Adeshola hopes for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Mónica

texts.es:
La señora Mónica es socia del Banco Comunal “Central Progreso”, en el distrito D. Cuturapi, provincia D. Yunguyo, en el departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 57 años D. edad, D. estado civil conviviente, tiene 3 hijos todos independientes, ella estudió primaria completa, vive en el Sector Pamplona II.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 8 años, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto con el cual pudo adquirir ganado menor.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 1800.00 nuevos soles, el préstamo le servirá para poder adquirir ganado menor,  que luego D. 8 semanas D. engorD., ella los venderá en las ferias zonales.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le gusta mucho las reuniones ya que se distrae mucho.
texts.en:
Mónica is a member of the Central Progreso Community Bank in the Cuturapi district, Yunguyo province, Puno department. She is 57, in a common law marriage, and has three independent children. She has an elementary school education. She lives in the Sector Pamplono II. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for eight years. With her first loan for 300 PEN she bought small livestock. She currently needs a loan for 1,800 PEN to buy small livestock. She will fatten them for eight weeks. Then she will sell them in the regional fairs. Her wish is to keep working. She likes the meetings a lot because they are very entertaining.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy small livestock

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal “Central Progreso”, en el distrito de Cuturapi, provincia de Yunguyo, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 58 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 7 hijos (5 a su cargo), ella es no letrada, vive en el Sector Flor Kantuta del centro poblado de Chimbo.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 9 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto con el cual pudo adquirir ganado menor.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, este préstamo le servirá para poder adquirir ganado menor (ovinos), además también va a comprar burros los cuales los vende en las ferias de ganado.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando para educar a  sus hijos.

A ella le gustan las reuniones y los ahorros.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa is a member of the community bank “Central Progreso” in the district of Cuturapi, Yunguyo Province, in the department of Puno. She is 58 years of age and married. She has 7 children (5 under her care). She is not educated.. She lives in the Flor Kantuta Sector of the community of Chimbo. Rosa has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 9 years. Her first loan was for 300 new soles, an amount with which she was able to acquire young livestock. Currently she is requesting a loan of 300 new soles. This loan will be used to enable her to acquire young sheep. In addition she is going to buy burros which she sells at livestock markets. Her wish is to continue working in order to educate her children.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of sheep and burros.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal “21 de Febrero”, en el distrito de de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y no tiene hijos, ella pudo estudiar la secundaria completa, vive en el Barrio Yaurima.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 3 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó para la compra de ganado menor.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, este préstamo le servirá para poder comprar papa para la elaboración de tunta (chuño), también comprar ganado menor en las mismas ferias regionales.  Su actividad la realiza solo los días de ferias..

Su deseo es comprarse un carro y seguir trabajando.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y la forma de trabajar con las socias.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of "21 de Febrero" community bank, in the Ilave district of El Collao province, department of Puno. She is 32 years old, is married and doesn't have children. She has completed secondary education and lives in the Yaurima neighborhood. Rosa has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 3 years. Her first loan was for 300 PEN, which she used to purchase small livestock. Currently, she needs a loan of 800 PEN. This loan will allow her to buy potatoes to make tunta (chuño, freeze-dried potato traditionally made in Quechua and Aymara communities). She will also buy small livestock in the regional markets. Rosa works on market days only. She hopes to buy a cart and continue working. Rosa likes to save money and the way the members of her community bank work together.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sheep and potatoes.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 33 years old and married with two children, a son and a daughter. Both of his children are still in school. He works very hard to be able to provide for the family and lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in Dunkwa in the Central region of Ghana.

George operates a snack bar which sells all kinds of soft drinks and pastries in a roadside shop in his community. George has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy supplies from distributors in bulk to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy crates of supplies

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora MARGARITA C. C. , tiene 41 años, vive en el distrito del Porvenir  , provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal SEMILLITAS CREATIVAS 
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria  , tiene 3 hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella.
MARGARITA se dedica a la venta de insumos alimenticios en la tienda de comestibles que tiene en su casa.
Su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra de mas insumos alimenticios para surtir su tienda y tener todo lo que sus clientes le solicitan.
Este crédito de 200 nuevos soles lo invertirá  en la compra de mas productos alimenticios para surtir su tienda.
MARITZA  sueña con ampliar su tienda y generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Margarita C. C. is 41 years old and lives in the Porvenir district, part of Trujillo province, in the department of La Libertad, Peru. She belongs to the communal bank Semillitas Creativas (Creative Little Seeds). This businesswoman has completed secondary school and financially supports her three children. Margarita sells groceries in a store that she has in her house. She invested her first loan of 300 neuvos soles in buying groceries to stock her store and supplying her customers with all that they require. This loan of 200 neuvos soles will be invested in the purchase of more food products to stock her store. Margarita dreams of growing her store and generating more revenue.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase more food products to stock a grocery store

loans.name: Yaqueline Milagros

texts.es:
Yaqueline  es socia del Banco Comunal “Señor de la Justicia”, ubicado en la cuidad de Puno, provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 29 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos, ella estudio educación secundaria completa, vive en el Barrio Bellavista.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para se negocio de preparación de comida.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, con este monto ella comprará arroz, fideos, aceite, papas, chuño, verduras, condimentos, carnes, gas, etc.

Su deseo es  poner un restaurante.

A ella le gusta la puntualidad y el interés que gana en la cuenta interna (ahorros).
texts.en:
Yaqueline is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor de la Justicia” (Lord of Justice), which is located in the city of Puno, Puno Province, Department of Puno. She is 29 years old, single, and does not have children. She has a high school education and lives in the neighborhood of Bellavista. Yaqueline has been working with Manuela Ramos for the past 2 years. Her first loan of 300 soles was used as capital for her food preparation business. At the moment, she is requesting another loan in the amount of 1500 soles to buy rice, noodles, oil, potatoes, potato flour, vegetables, spices, meat, and gas for her burners. Yaqueline hopes to open a restaurant. She likes the timeliness of her loans and the interest she earns on her internal savings account.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, noodles, oil, potatoes, potato flour, vegetables, spices, meat, and gas

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys tiene 43 años y vive con su hijo David de 20, quien es albañil. Desde hace 6 años ella se dedica a la elaboración de collares, anillos, pulseras, etc. ya que aprendió esta labor en un curso de bisutería y ahora usa esta actividad para obtener ingresos económicos. Gladys empieza a trabajar a las 7 de la mañana y la culmina aproximadamente las 10 de la noche, parando sólo para preparar los alimentos y para el aseo de su casa. Terminadas estas labores se dedica íntegramente al acabado de sus joyas, como ella las llama. La elaboración le demanda una muy buena vista, aunque su hijo le dice que no se esfuerce demasiado porque sus ojos pueden sufrir las consecuencias, pero Gladys cree que su trabajo más que un oficio es un pasatiempo, el cual le gusta realizar, además las ganancias son buenas. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará mayor cantidad materiales (mostacillas) en todos los colores, así como variedad de hilos, los cuales le permitirán aumentar su producción.

loans.use: Compra de materiales para sus joyas

loans.name: Nancy Olinda

texts.es:
La señora Nancy  es socia del Banco Comunal “Señor de la Justicia”, ubicado en la cuidad de Puno, provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y es madre de 03 hijos, ella estudió educación superior (Trabajo Social).  Vive en el Barrio Independencia.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 8 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para su negocio de compra y venta de Ropa.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional de S/. 1300.00 nuevos soles, con este monto ella va adquirir arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche, gaseosas, etc. para su tienda de abarrotes, negocio que tiene actualmente.

Su deseo es Poner una bodega bien surtida por el centro de la cuidad.

A ella le gustan los bajos intereses y la confianza que Manuela Ramos deposita en las socias.
texts.en:
Sra. Nancy is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor de la Justicia” (Lord of Justice), which is located in the city of Puno, Puno Province, Department of Puno. She is 40 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children. Sra. Nancy has a degree in Social Work and lives in the neighborhood of Independencia. She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 8 years. Her first loan of 300 soles was used as capital for her business of buying and selling clothes. She is now requesting another loan in the amount of 1300 soles to purchase rice, sugar, oil, milk, sodas, and other items for her grocery store – the business she operates now. She hopes to open a well-stocked grocery store in the central part of town. Sra. Nancy enjoys the low interest rates and the confidence Manuela Ramos has in its members.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, oil, milk, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Nancy Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres progresivas”, ubicado en la el distrito de Asillo, provincia de Azangaro, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 40 años de edad, es conviviente y es madre de 02 hijos, ella estudió educación primaria completa.  Vive en la comunidad Casa Blanca.


La señora Nancy es socia nueva, ella requiere un primer préstamo es de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvirá para comprar ganado menor (ovinos).  Esta actividad la realiza solo una vez a la semana en las ferias regionales.

Su deseo es comprarse una casa en Juliaca.

A ella le gustan y las reuniones entre Bancos Comunales.
texts.en:
Sra. Nancy is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Progresivas” (Progressive Women), which is located in the District of Asillo, Azangaro Province, Department of Puno. She is 40 years old, in a common law marriage, and has 2 children. She completed her elementary school education and lives in the community of Casa Blanca. Sra. Nancy is a new member and is requesting her first of loan of 500 soles to buy small livestock (sheep). She conducts her business once a week when she travels to the regional fairs. She hopes to buy a house in Juliaca. Sra. Nancy enjoys her Communal Bank meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheep for fattening

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is forty – three years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, two sons and two daughters. All of her children are still in school. Mary works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Dunkwa in the Central region of Ghana. Mary is a trader. She trades in cereals such as maize, beans, groundnuts, etc. She also deals in sugar. Mary buys her goods all the way from Northern Ghana. She supplies to food vendors and other retailers in her community. She has been in business for over twenty – five years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José es un hombre muy empeñoso, tiene 64 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Sabina y sus 2 hijos: Aldo de 17 y Fernando de 11. Él y su esposa trabajan en su puesto de venta de carne de pollo, Sabina es la que mayormente atiende el puesto, ya que José debe dedicarse a la compra de mercadería, por lo que está constantemente de viaje. Es por ello que encontramos a su esposa (en la foto) en su puesto, quien atiende a los clientes siempre con una sonrisa en el rostro. José se dedica mucho a su trabajo para poder brindarle a su familia un buen futuro, sus hijos están estudiando y él quiere que más adelante puedan seguir una carrera universitaria y para eso necesita obtener mayores ingresos económicos. Felizmente, todos son un equipo, tanto su esposa como sus hijos se apoyan en todo, por lo que José confía que poco a poco logrará todos sus objetivos. El dinero que viene solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de mayor cantidad de pollos y así mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
José is extremely hardworking. He is 64 years old and lives in his own home with his wife Sabina and their 2 children, Aldo (age 17) and Fernando (age 11). He and his wife work together selling butchered chickens. Sabina is mainly responsible for tending to the vending post while José spends his time acquiring the merchandise, which requires constant travel. This is why we find his wife (shown in the photograph) alone at their business. She always greets customers with a smile on her face.

José works in order to give his family a better future and enable his children to pursue their education. At some point, José greatly wants to resume his academic career, but in order to do that, he needs to generate more income. Happily, his family works as a team. José, his wife, and his kids all support one another, so he is confident that they will eventually reach their goals. The money he is requesting will be used to buy chickens in larger quantity so that he can improve his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens in larger quantity

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 51 year old widow with six children, four sons and two daughters. Some of her children are still in school. As a single parent, Rose says she works very hard to be able to provide for the family. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Dunkwa in the Central region of Ghana.

Rose supplies cereals such as maize, beans, etc. to food vendors and other retailers in her community. She buys her goods all the way from Northern Ghana and has been in business for over thirty years. Rose would like a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business, as she aspires to give all her children good education.

loans.use: To buy cereals for her food supply business

loans.name: Abiba

texts.en:
Abiba is a sixty year old widow with six children, five sons and a daughter, all out of school. As a single parent, she says she works very hard to be able to provide for the family. Abiba lives with some of her children in a rented apartment in Dunkwa in the Central region of Ghana.

Abiba sells cereals such as maize, beans, etc at the local market and also supplies to food vendors and other retailers in her community. She buys her goods all the way from Northern Ghana and has been in business for over fifteen years. She would like a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy cereals to sell

loans.name: Gumercinda

texts.es:
La señora Gumercinda  es socia del Banco Comunal “Señor de la Justicia”, ubicado en la cuidad de Puno, provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 72 años de edad, está casada y es madre de 03 hijos, todos ya casados.  Ella estudió educación primaria solo hasta 4to grado, vive en el Barrio Independencia.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para se negocio de pensión familiar (renta habitaciones).

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, con este monto ella comprará víveres tales como arroz, aceite, papa, carne, fideos, leche, etc. para la preparación de alimentos.  Ella tiene como clientes a sus mismos inquilinos que en su mayoría son estudiantes.

Su deseo es  continuar trabajando.

A ella le gustan las facilidades en los préstamos y los ahorros
texts.en:
Sra. Gumercinda is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor de la Justicia” (Lord of Justice), located in the city of Puno, Puno Province, Department of Puno. She is 72 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children (all are married). Sra. Gumercinda has a 4th grade education. She lives in the neighborhood of Independencia. She has been working with Manuela Ramos for the past 2 years. Her first loan of 500 soles was used as capital for her boarding house (rooms for rent). She is requesting another loan in the amount of 500 soles to buy food items such as rice, oil, potatoes, meat, noodles, milk, etc., for preparing meals. The majority of her tenants are students. Sra. Gumercinda hopes to continue working. She enjoys the simplicity of her loans and having the ability to save.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, oil, potatoes, meat, noodles, milk, etc.

loans.name: Mantou

texts.fr: mantou F. evolue dans le domaine du commerce et vend des produits cosmetiques depuis plus de sept ans.elle est parent beneficiaire depuis 1994.elle sollicite un credit de cent cinquante mille(150 000)frs pour pour faire face a la forte demande et augmenter sa part du marche.ses benefices supplementaires lui permettront de mieux assister sa famille.
texts.en:
Mantou F. has been improving in the domain of selling cosmetic products for over seven years. She has been a recipient parent since 1994. She’s requesting a loan of 150,000 francs in order to cope with the strong demand and to increase her market share. Her additional profits will enable her to assist her family further.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Fati

texts.en: Fati is forty – eight years old. She is widowed and has given birth to five children, two sons and three daughters. All of her children are still in school. As a single parent, she says she works very hard to be able to provide for the family. Fati lives with her children in a rented apartment in Dunkwa in the Central region of Ghana. She is a trader. She trades in food items such as rice, oil, vegetables, beans, etc. Fati buys her goods from Kumasi and sells at the local market. She also supplies to food vendors and other retailers in her community. She has been in business for over fifteen years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy food items

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa is sixty years old and married with six children, three sons and three daughters. All of her children are out of school and working. Adwoa works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and some grandchildren in a family house in Dunkwa in the Central region of Ghana.

Adwoa sells smoked fish at the market square in her community. She buys her goods all the way from the Eastern region where she claims costs are lower. Adwoa has been in business for over ten years and would like a loan to buy smoked fish in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy smoked fish to sell

loans.name: Nafisa

texts.en: Nafisa is fort years old. She is married and has given birth to six children, three sons and three daughters. All of her children are still in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Dunkwa in the Central region of Ghana. Nafisa is a food vendor. She prepares and sells porridge in the mornings by the roadside. She buys her raw material such as maize, sugar, etc. from Techiman where she claims cost is effective. She has been in business for over twenty – nine years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy maize

loans.name: Judy

texts.es: Judy tiene 33 años, vive con su hija Stefanny de 9 años de edad, en su casa propia. Desde hace más de 2 años posee un bazar, donde ofrece variedad de productos; como adornos, artículos de librería, agendas, cuadros, etc. Judy recuerda con alegría cómo decidió incursionar en este negocio: todo comenzó un día de los enamorados (14 de febrero), cuando empezó a vender algunos adornos florales en caja, la venta resulto tan buena que con las ganancias decidió invertir en la compra de adornos y otros artículos. Con el paso del tiempo y asociada con su hermana logró habilitar en su casa una pequeña tienda, compró mostradores y vitrinas donde hoy en día expone su diversa mercadería. Judy se encuentra muy feliz con su negocio, el cual atiende su prima, ya que adicionalmente ella trabaja como profesora en un centro educativo, es así que también puede darle trabajo a su prima, con la cual se siente complacida. Este es su sexto préstamo con MFP como parte de un banco comunal, donde en sus anteriores créditos ha demostrado puntualidad en sus pagos. Con el dinero que viene solicitando incursionará en la venta de zapatos por pedido, actividad que podría realizar en sus tiempos libres y así generarse otros ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Judy is 33 years old and lives in her own home with her 9 year old daughter Stefanny. For over 2 years, she has operated a bazaar where she sells a variety of products such as ornaments, reading materials, calendars, pictures, etc. Judy happily remembers when she decided to start her business – on Valentine’s Day (February 14th). She started by selling boxed floral arrangements. Her resulting sales were so good that she decided to invest her profits into buying ornaments and other items. Over time, she partnered with her sister to open a small shop from her home. They purchased shelving and displays cases so that they could exhibit their wide range of merchandise.

Judy is very happy with her business which she treats as a priority. In addition, she also works as a school teacher, a job she also treats with high priority and from which she receives much satisfaction.

As a member of her Communal Bank, she is requesting her sixth loan from MFP. Her previous loans were paid on time. The loan she is requesting will be used to start a business selling shoes by order. Judy plans to pursue this endeavor in her spare time so that she can generate additional income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Start a second business selling shoes

loans.name: Cornelly

texts.fr: Cornelly est née le 27 aout 1965 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Cornelly est mariée et mère de trois enfants. La famille y vit à Cotonou. Cornelly vend de tissus, des savons et des plastiques qu'elle achète à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. Cornelly est aide-soignante de formation, elle mène cette seconde activité pour venir en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Cornelly a une clientèle importante dans des entreprises où elle passe pour proposer ses produits. Alors, Cornelly sollicite son deuxième crédit d’ALIDé pour renforcer son fonds de roulement afin de répondre efficacement à la demande de sa clientèle. Cornelly a eu à bien rembourser son premier crédit.
texts.en:
Cornelly was born on August 27, 1965 in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. She is married and the mother of three children. The family lives in Cotonou. She sells cloth, soaps, and plastics that she buys in Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Bénin. She is a nurse’s aid by training. It's a second job that she has to help her husband with family expenses. Cornelly has a major customer base in private companies, where she goes to offer her merchandise. She is therefore requesting her second loan from ALIDé to bolster her working capital in order to respond suitably to customer demands. Cornelly had fully repaid her first loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy five 12-meter bolts of cloth, three boxes of soaps, and four dozen plastic items

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María es una mujer muy empeñosa que desde muy joven se ha dedicado a trabajar para poder salir adelante. Hoy en día, con un esposo y una familia por mantener ha logrado adquirir su propia casa que es donde actualmente viven. Gracias a su arduo trabajo ella y su esposo lograron ahorrar lo suficiente como para comprar un auto, el cual es su principal fuente de ingresos económicos, siendo la administración del mismo su faena de todos los días, pues su esposo es quien maneja el carro. María tiene que velar para que el auto funcione con eficiencia y estar pendiente de los mantenimientos mecánicos necesarios. Su esposo sale aproximadamente a las 8 de la mañana y trabaja durante todo el día, mientras ella prepara los alimentos y cuida de sus hijos. Esta actividad les viene muy bien, ya que además le da cierta independencia para poder disponer de su tiempo. María quiere obtener más ingresos para comprar otra movilidad y con el tiempo tener una gran flota de taxis, lo cual la haría crecer como microempresaria. Este es su décimo préstamo con MFP y siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero que viene solicitando refaccionará su auto, ya que le hace falta un cambio de llantas para poder quedar en óptimas condiciones.
texts.en:
From an early age, María has been determined to work hard in order to succeed. Today, her husband and family have managed to buy the house in which they currently live. Thanks to her hard work and that of her husband, they have been able to save enough money to purchase a car that helps provide their main source of income. María handles the daily business administration while her husband focuses on driving the taxi. She makes sure that the vehicle operates efficiently and schedules the required maintenance.

Her husband leaves around 8am for work and is gone all day, while she prepares the meals and cares of their children. This arrangement works very well because it gives her true independence since she has time for herself. María wants to generate more income so that she can buy another vehicle and, over time, eventually have a large fleet of taxis.

She hopes to continue growing as a micro-entrepreneur. María is requesting her 10th loan from MFP and she has always been on time with her payments. She will use the money to replace the tires on her vehicle so that it will be in optimal condition.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replace the tires on her vehicle

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is a 57-year-old trader. Married with ten children, unfortunately she lost four of them as time went by. Currently she has five boys and one girl of whom some are schooling.

Theresa believes in hardworking and dedication as the primary antidote to minimizing poverty and, for that matter, she is very serious with her business. She trades in cereals like maize and gari. Gari is produced from cassava.

Theresa started her business twelve years ago with just a small amount of working capital. Through this, she has been very resourceful to her family. She wants to use the loan to buy a larger supply of maize and gari to serve her customers throughout the season, especially in the face of increasing prices due to the current food crisis in the country.

Theresa believes that, with the loan, she can buy more bags of maize and gari grains from the farmers rather than from middlemen who retail to her at a high price.

loans.use: To buy a larger supply of maize and gari

loans.name: Titilayo

texts.en: Titilayo sells drinks and she has been in this business for the past seven years. She is requesting the loan of N140,000 to purchase drinks to sell, so as to be able to meet the demands of her customers. Her customers appreciate knowing that she will always have what they need. She says thank you.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Ayishetu

texts.en:
Ayishetu is thirty-seven years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, all of whom are daughters. All of her children are still in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Dunkwa in the Central region of Ghana.

Ayishetu is a food vendor. She sells rice and stew on a table by the roadside. She buys bags of rice and other ingredient from Kumasi. She has been in business for over ten years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy rice in bulk

loans.name: Isabelle

texts.fr: Isabelle est âgée de 34 ans ; elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Isabelle est couturière de formation. Isabelle a comme activité secondaire, la vente de tissus, bijoux et savons et ustensiles en aliminium. C’est pour mieux assurer ses besoins et ceux de sa famille que Isabelle s’est donnée à cette seconde activité. En effet, Isabelle achète ses produits à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. Isabelle distribue à crédit ces produits à ses clients qui ont fait la demande ; chaque cinq jours,  Isabelle passe chez ceux-ci pour collecter ses fonds. Isabelle a déjà bénéficié d’un premier prêt d’ALIDé, prêt qu’elle a bien remboursé. Isabelle sollicite un deuxième crédit d’ALIDé pour renforcer son fonds de roulement afin de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
