Josefina A.. Clothing sales. Angelica P.. Recycling. Antolina S.. Drink sales. Isabel A.. Clothing designer. Liz P.. Seamstress. Juliana C.. Purse sales. Marcia A.. Clothing designer. Ada N.. Manicurist.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase assorted merchandise.

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est spécialisé dans la vente des téléphones portables et de leurs accessoires. Il exerce cette activité depuis 2002 à Lomé dans son quartier Attiégou. Cette activité lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de son enfant. Pour avoir un nouveau stock de téléphones portables ainsi que des accessoires, il sollicite un prêt de WAGES pour acheter  20 téléphones portables, 15 batteries d'alimentation ainsi que d’autres accessoires. Ce monsieur n’est pas marié
texts.en:
This gentleman is a specialist at selling mobile phone and the accessories for them.  He has been in this business since 2002 in Lomé in his district of Attiégou.  This business enables him to provide for his child.  To obtain a new stock of mobile phones, as well as accessories, he's requesting a WAGES loan to buy 20 mobile phones, 15 batteries, and other accessories.  This gentleman is not married.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy mobile phones and accessories for them

loans.name: Jackeline Argentina

texts.es: Doña Jackeline M. de 31 años de edad, su negocio es la venta de fritanga y rifas el cual hace ambulante y es cansado ya que aun no logra tener un local fijo ,  lleva tres años en las ventas, logro ponerlo con liquidación de su trabajo anterior en la zona franca, casada  y con dos hijos de 2 y 5 años de edad, su esposo vende verduras en los departamentos, y reside en el barrio Raspan Norte en la capital de Managua, sus anhelo es poder terminar de hacer su casa ya que es de zinc y sus servicio es de letrina, lo cual desea darle a su familia una mejor vida, con seguridad de tener una vivienda mejor y un servicio higiénico. Con este préstamo instalara las aguas negras para instalar un inodoro  y hacer el arranque de su casa hasta donde ajuste. Da las gracias a la institución ya que traerá alegría  a sus hijos y mejores condiciones higiénicas.
texts.en:
Jackeline M. is 31 years old. She runs a fast food business, offering her products from a push cart. She finds it very tiring work and she has not managed to find a fixed location. She has been selling for the last 3 years. She established herself with the serverance pay she received from her past employment. She is married, and has two children of 2 and 5 years of age. Her husband sells vegetables to stores. She lives in the Raspan Norte district of the capital city Managua. Her goal is to finish building her house, especially to finish installing the bathroom. She wishes to provide her family with a better life, with a safe home to live in and hygenic conditions. With this loan she will have the sewer built to put in place a bathroom and invest the rest in the renovations. She is grateful to the organization, especially because all this will bring happiness inthe her children's lives, and will provide them with hygenic living conditions.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install a sewer and install a bathroom.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 42-year-old father of three who supplies cakes on his bicycle in Buruburu, Nairobi. He has been running this business for the last 17 years. He has requested a second loan of Ksh. 50,000 after successful repayment of his first loan of Ksh. 20,000, in order to add to his stock of cakes. He hopes to own a real estate business one day and educate his children. He describes himself as jovial and industrious.



Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add to his stock of cakes

loans.name: Mathieu Wolawolé

texts.fr: Ce monsieur vend depuis 2002 à Tokoin-Ramco à Lomé des pneus d’occasion pour voitures. Son atelier de réparaton est très connue des conducteurs de taxi qui trouvent chez lui tous ceux dont ils ont besoin. Ce commerce lui permet de se prendre en charge et de régler les besoins de son enfant. Pour commander de nouveaux pneus d’occasion venant du Nigéria, il sollicite un crédit de WAGES. Il est célibataire.
texts.en:
This gentleman has been selling used automobile tires since 2002 in Tokoin-Ramco in Lomé.  His repair shop is well-known by taxi drivers who find everything they need from him.  This business enables him to support himself and to meet the needs of his child.  To order more second-hand tires from Nigeria, he's requesting a WAGES loan.  He is unmarried.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires

loans.name: Cheyla Luz

texts.es:
La microempresaria Cheyla Luz Pérez Montalbán tiene 51 años de edad, es madre soltera con 3 hijos mayores de edad, tiene desde hace 3 años una pulpería la cual esta ubicada en el barrio San Pedro de esta ciudad, anteriormente ayudaba a su mama quien también tiene una pulpería, pero desde hace 3 años decidió independizarse económicamente administrando su propio negocio.

La microempresaria Cheyla conoció a través de su mama Norma Amador (Quien a sido beneficiada con dos crédito de Kiva) que se realizan estos prestamos los cuales a ella le han ayudado, por tal razón es que Cheyla Pérez esta solicitando se le financie para comprar los siguientes productos:

3 Quintales de Arroz americano el cual compra  US 45 cada quintal, 3 quintales de azúcar el cual compra  US 35 cada quintal, 2 bidones de aceite que compra a US 29 cada bidón, 80 libras de pollo la compra a US 1.70 cada libra, 80 libras de Carne de res la compra a US 1.80 cada libra, 3 cajillas de Huevos compra a US 5 cada cajilla, 30 sacos de carbón a US 3 cada saco y 2 bolsones de papel higiénico a US 8.50 cada bolsón.
texts.en:
Small-business owner Cheyla Luz Pérez Montalbán is 51 years old and is a single mother with 3 grown children. For 3 years she has had a small grocery store located in the San Pedro neighborhood of this city. Prior to that, she helped her mother, who also has a small grocery store. Three years ago she decided to become financially independent by running her own business. Cheyla learned through her mother, Norma Amador (who has received two loans through Kiva), that these loans exist and they have been helpful to her mother. So, Cheyla Pérez is requesting a loan to buy the following products: Three 100-pound sacks of American rice, which cost $45.00 each; three 100-pound sacks of sugar, which she can buy for $35.00 per sack; 2 drums of cooking oil, which cost $29.00 each; 80 pounds of chicken, which costs $1.70 per pound; 80 pounds of beef, which she buys at $1.80 per pound; 3 crates of eggs at $5.00 per crate; 30 sacks of charcoal, which cost $3.00 per sack; and 2 large bags of toilet paper at $8.50 per bag.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, chicken, beef, eggs, charcoal, and toilet paper.

loans.name: Hoa Vo

texts.en:
Miss Hoa Vo T. is a vender in Mercado 4. She’s an extremely kind person and a hard worker. She sells phones and phone accessories, cosmetics, prescription glasses and sunglasses, and MP3 and MP4 players among other things. She’s a young woman who has started to become more independent and she now has two stalls in the Santo Domingo gallery.

Most of her clients include people that work in the market with her as well as other clients just passing through, some of whom are foreigners and some Paraguayans.

She is very well recommended in her community and is a very active person. She wants to start to work with the Fundación so she can have the opportunity to open another stall.

loans.use: to buy cell phones and accesories for resale

loans.name: Celenia Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Celenia de 47 años de edad, reside en el barrio Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua, procreo dos hijos con edades de 10 y 12 años de edad, sus anhelo es poder terminar de hacer su casa, no vive con su esposo le ha tocado trabajar duro para poder mantener a sus hijos, y darle la educación que merecen, ella trabaja en servicios domésticos, trabajo que le rinde muchas veces, la tratan bien lo único que no es asegurada y se le hace mas difícil cuando esta enferma. Con este préstamo en Afodenic lograra cambiar el techo de su vivienda ya que esta en mal estado, y espera cambiarlo para mejorar su situación y la de su familia de poder vivir dignamente. Da las gracias ala institución por los beneficios en mejorar su casa.

loans.use: Comprar zicn para cambiar el techo de su casa que esta en mal estado

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 49 year-old father of four who supplies fruits in Eastlands in Nairobi. Samuel has been in this business for the past 27 years. Samuel is requesting his second loan of Ksh. 50,000 after successful completion of his first loan of Ksh. 20,000 in order to increase his stock of fruits. He hopes to one day own a wholesale shop and have rental units. In the future, Samuel would like to buy a home for his family. He describes himself as good, social, jovial and diligent.



Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add stock of fruits

loans.name: Koudjéga

texts.fr: Cet homme a appris le métier de maçon, mais il ne trouve pas souvent de chantier à construire pour subvenir aux besoins de sa femme et de ses 02 enfants. Pour cette raison il s’est lancé  en 2008 dans son quartier Avépozo à Lomé dans l’élevage et la vente de porcs. Il est très connu et reçoit des clients venant même du Bénin, le pays voisin. Pour acheter de la nourriture à ses animaux, mais aussi acheter une moto pour ses déplacements vers sa clientèle, il sollicite un crédit de WAGES.
texts.en:
This man learned the trade of a mason, but he can't often find a construction site where he can earn enough to support his wife and two children. For this reason he began, in 2008, to raise and sell pigs in his district, Avépozo, in Lomé. He is well known and gets customers even from Benin, the neighboring country. To buy the feed for his animals, but also to buy a motorcycle for his trips to see his clientele, he is asking WAGES for a loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of pig feed and a motorcycle

loans.name: Azucena Geoconda

texts.es:
La señora Azucena M. posee su negocio de salón de belleza en su propio establecimiento en el departamento de León donde atiende a sus clientes y de igual manera vende calzados para sus clientes.

Ella ha acudido a Ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un crédito para la compra de los materiales de trabajo para el salón y es por esta razón que confiadamente espera en que Ceprodel le brindará el crédito y de esta manera logrará la satisfacción de sus clientes en el negocio.
texts.en:
Azucena M. lives in the department of León. She operates a beauty salon in her own house where she serves her customers. Furthermore, she sells shoes to them.

Azucena approached Kiva partner Ceprodel and applied for a loan to buy working materials for her salon and shoes for sale. She confidently waits to see her loan provided and achieve a good customer satisfaction in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy working materials for her salon and shoes for sale

loans.name: Paubla Francis

texts.es: La señora Paubla Francis C. de 32 años de edad, reside en el barrio Laureles Sur, casada, con dos hijos los cuales estudian en la primaria, su esposo trabaja en servicios de vigilancias y su salario es bajo, es por ella busco un trabajo en servicios domestico para sobre salir adelante con los gastos de la familia lo mas difícil la confianza de sus patrones ya que siempre desconfía. Con este préstamo es el octavo ciclo en Afodenic con estos préstamo ella ha ido mejorando poco a poco su casa. Con este préstamo hará un sumidero ya que el que tiene esta en malas condiciones y no es higiénico es por eso le urge comenzar a que le trabajen y poder dar a su familia lo que merecen.

loans.use: Comprar los materiales necesarios para hacer un sumidero

loans.name: María Adela

texts.es:
En el departamento de León, la señora María L. dedica sus esfuerzos para atender su negocio de venta de granos básicos el cual los posee en sacos grandes almacenados en su establecimiento.

Hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los granos básicos como es el frijol y por esta razón espera ser beneficiada grandemente y así continuar brindando mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
María L. lives in the department of León. She operates a business in which she sells basic grains. The grains are stored in large bags in her shop.

Today she came to the office of Kiva partner Ceprodel and applied for a loan to buy basic grains, particularly beans. She expects to benefit greatly from this loan and be able to continue to provide her family with better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Zovoin Komla

texts.fr: Ce Monsieur est spécialisé dans la broderie. Il exerce cette activité depuis 1998 et confectionne des broderies de type « sénégalaise » ou « sahélienne » très appréciées de la population. Il a même des clients en dehors du pays, venant spécialement pour faire des commandes. Pour confectionner de nouvelles broderies avec ses tissus et acheter une nouvelle machine de broderie à la mode, il voudrait avoir un crédit de WAGES. Son atelier se situe dans le quartier Adakpamé à Lomé. Il est marié et père de 02 enfants.

loans.use: Achat de machine à broderie et des tissus

loans.name: Ruth María

texts.es:
La señora Ruth A. es propietaria de un negocio de venta de ropa para dama, caballeros y niños atendiendo en su establecimiento en el departamento de León donde es muy visitada a diario por sus clientes.
Ella se ha desatacado por ser una excelente trabajadora que ha logrado llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación y para ello ha hecho uso de los créditos brindados por Ceprodel. Hoy en día ha solicitado un nuevo crédito con el propósito de invertirlo directamente en la compra de la ropa y así continuarla comercializando en su establecimiento.

loans.use: Compra de la ropa

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 37-year-old father of three who sells second-hand shoes in Muthurwa market in Nairobi. David has been in this business for the past 7 years, and he previously sold insurance policies. David is requesting his first loan of Ksh. 20,000 in order to increase his stock of shoes. He hopes to one day import shoes himself, rather than purchasing from a middleman. In the future, David would like to have a prosperous family and to build a good home.



Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add to his stock of used shoes

loans.name: Flor De María

texts.es:
La señora Flor de María R. a diario vende ropa en el departamento de León siendo este el ingreso que percibe para llevar el sustento a su hogar. De igual manera ella vende bebidas gaseosas de diferentes sabores.

El motivo por el que acudió a Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito para la compra de la mercadería que consta de ropa y a la vez para la compra de las bebidas. Espera que su crédito sea otorgado sin ningún problema y así salir adelante en su neogocio.

loans.use: Compra de ropa y bebidas

loans.name: Virginia Auxiliadora

texts.es: La joven Virginia de 24 años de edad, casada, con dos hijos de 4 y 2 años de edad,  su esposo trabaja en la mecánica, reside en el barrio Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, sus planes es terminar de hacer su casa y poder dar a sus hijos una vida digna. Su negocio es la venta de chatarra el cual inicio con ayuda de su esposo hace cuatro años, con este préstamo quiere construir un cuarto para poder estar en mejores condiciones, ya que su casa la tiene mitad de concreto y el resto de zinc,  lo cual espera terminar pronto de construir y poder gozar de una vivienda digna. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo a través de los préstamos  ya que se ha beneficiado para ir construyendo su casa.
texts.en:
Virginia is a young lady of 24 years, married, and the mother of two children aged 4 and 2. Her husband is a mechanic. They live in the neighborhood of Memorial Sandino in the capital city of Managua. Virginia is a scrap iron seller. She started this business four years ago with the help of her husband.

Virginia's plans for the future are to finish the construction of their house and provide their children with a decent life. She will use this loan to build a room of good quality, since their house is made half of concrete and half of zinc. She hopes to finish the construction soon and enjoy decent housing. She thanks our institution for the support given to her through the previous loans, which she used to build their house.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a room

loans.name: Terry

texts.en:
Terry is a 48 year-old mother of 3 and grandmother to one. A landlady, Terry owns a large building and rents out both residences and small businesses. She has been in this business for the past 20 years. Terry is requesting a loan of Ksh. 70,000 in order to complete construction on her rental homes, as well as open a butchery business. A mother of three and grandmother to one, Terry hopes to pass on her assets to her children and grandchildren one day. She describes herself as social and determined.


Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Complete construction and open a butchery business

loans.name: Felipa Consuelo

texts.es:
En el departamento de León, la señora Felipa Consuelo R. dedica su tiempo a atender su negocio de venta de bisuterías tales como peines, colas, aros, entre otros productos. Es de importancia destacar que la señora Felipa es una excelente trabajadora y ha llevado el sustento a su hogar por medio de su negocio.

Ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de las bisuterías y de esta forma continuar en el negocio logrando la satisfacción de sus clientes.

loans.use: Compra de bisuterías

loans.name: Silvia María

texts.es: Doña Silvia Maria de 34 años de edad, es una mujer esforzada y trabajadora, tiene una pequeña pulpería y lava y plancha ajeno para obtener otros ingresos,  desde hace diez año se gana la vida ya que se caso joven y tiene dos hijos de 5 y 10 años de edad,  los cuales los tiene estudiando, reside en el barrio Hialeah en la capital de Managua, su esposo trabaja elaborando vitrinas, con este crédito quiere  construir un porche para tener mejor comodidad con el espacio lo cual comprara materiales de construcción . Da las gracias a la institución por los préstamo con este es su quinto ciclo y ha logrado invertir en su venta como en las mejoras de su casa.
texts.en:
Doña Silvia María, aged 34, got married at a young age and is now the mother of two children, aged 5 and 10, who attend school. She lives in the neighborhood of Hialeah in the capital city of Managua. Her husband produces showcases.

Silvia María is an enthusiastic and hard-working woman. She has a small convenience store. She also washes and irons for other people to earn more money. She made a living this way for the last ten years.

Silvia María applies for this loan to buy construction materials and build a porch for better comfort on her property. This is her fifth loan cycle. She thanks our institution for the support given to her through the previous loans, which she used to invest in her store and in home improvement.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a porch

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 27 year-old mother of two who sells second-hand children’s clothing in Muthurwa market in Nairobi. Grace is requesting her first loan of Ksh. 20,000 in order to add to her stock of clothing. She hopes to one day have a children’s ware shop in town.  On a personal level, Grace would like to educate her children and give them a good home. She describes herself as jovial and diligent.



Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add stock

loans.name: Sara Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Sara del Socorro reside en el barrio 380 de la capita de Managua, tiene 35 años de edad, casada  y con una bella familia de dos hijos, una niña de 10 años y un varón de 5 años,  los cuales estudian su primaria, su esposo trabaja como conductor a una empresa privada. La señora Sara es ama de casa y vive cerca con su mama lo cual comparten la felicidad y los problemas en el núcleo familiar, ella recibe remesa de su hermana mayor  que emigro a España para contar con mejores ingresos y mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia, lo cual su meta se hecho una realidad, ya que han mejorado en gran medida, sus condiciones económica y remodelación de la casa. En Afodenic lleva el tercer ciclo  el cual este realizara la terminación de un cuarto de la casa  para tener mejores condiciones de vida y comodidad en el haga. Su meta es poder encontrar un trabajo y poder asegurarles una economía mejor a sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Doña Sara del Socorro, aged 35, is married and the mother of two beautiful children, a girl aged 10 and a boy aged 5, who both attend primary school. She lives in the neighborhood 380 of the capital city of Managua. Her husband is a driver in a private company. Sara is a housewife and lives with her mother who shares the happiness and the problems in this small family. Sara's older sister emigrated to Spain for better income and periodically sends money to Sara to help her to improve the living conditions of her family. This goal has become a reality, as they have greatly improved their economic condition and renovated their house.

This is Sara's third loan with Afodenic. She will use it to finish the construction of a room in their house to have better living conditions and more comfort in their home. Her goal is to find a job and be able to provide her two children with a better economic future.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials to finish a room

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es: El señor Juan N. de 33 años de edad, casado su esposa ama de casa, reside en el barrio El Paraisito en la capital de Managua, su anhelo es poder tener su propia casa ya que habita en la casa de sus padres ya que se le ha hecho difícil poder construir la propia. De joven comenzó a trabajar en un taller de enderezado y pintura, el cual adquirió experiencia y ha logrado poner su propio taller y se siente sastifecho ya que tiene dos años de administrarlo y ahora si espera ahorrar para hacer su casa ya que también ayuda al medicamento de su mama que es diabetes y es caro. En Afodenic es su tercer ciclo el cual invertirá con este préstamo, en la compra de una power que es para enderezar vehiculo y esto será de gran beneficios para dar una mejor servicio a sus clientes. Da las gracias a la institución por la prosperidad de su negocio lo cual viene hacer de gran beneficio para su familia.

loans.use: comprar una power para enderezar vehiculo

loans.name: Elsa Maria

texts.es: Doña Elsa M. de 54 años de edad, casada, reside en el barrio Augusto Cesar Sandino, procreo dos hijos los cuales están mayores, su esposo  trabaja como técnico en Enitel, tiene una pulpería que logro poner hace ocho años, esto lo inicio con un poco de ayuda de su esposo y crédito que Afodenic otorgo es el noveno ciclo el cual invertirá en la compra de granos básicos, productos lácteos, carnes y golosinas dando a sus cliente un mejor servicio y para vender masa. Da las gracias a la institución ya que se ha beneficiado para incrementar sus ventas y poder salir adelante en la economía junto con su familia.

loans.use: comprar granos basicos, golosinas, carnes y productos lacteos

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Doña Ana Maria de 67 años de edad,  ha logrado  mantener su negocio de venta de ropa lo cual inicio hace doce años para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos, tiene un hijo que le ayuda, a mucho esfuerzo se preparo y es ingeniero químico. Ya no tiene la ayuda de su esposo ya que falleció pero en vida ayudo junto con su hijo a poner la venta, reside en el barrio Leonel Rugama, sus planes es seguir ayudando a su hijo y salir a delante con el negocio con este crédito invertirá en la compra de ropa nueva ay variada para ofertar a sus clientes a si como la captación de nuevos clientes con esto espera incrementar las ventas como sus ganancias. Da las gracias Afodenic por la oportunidad de poder seguir mejorando a cada familia Nicaragüense con sus préstamos.
texts.en:
Ana Maria, aged 67, has succeeded in maintaining her clothing business, which she opened twelve years ago to help her husband out with expenses. She has one son, who assists her. After a lot of difficult training, he is now a chemical engineer. Ana Maria's husband has passed away, so he is no longer there for her. While he was alive, though, he and her son helped her with her sales. Ana Maria lives in the Leonel Rugama neighborhood. She plans to keep helping her son get ahead with the business. She'll invest her loan in the purchase of a selection of new clothing to offer her current clients, and to attract more clientele. She hopes she can increase her sales as well as her profits. She is grateful to Afodenic for being able to continue improving each Nicaraguan family with its loans.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a selection of men's and women's clothing.

loans.name: Las Amigas Group

texts.es:
Marcela C.  tiene 49 años, vende radios pequeñas hace 18 años en la feria “16 de Julio”, donde tiene su puesto de venta,  y sale a vender los días Jueves y Domingo, los demás días atiende a su familia ya que tiene 5 hijos, aunque ya son mayores ella no los quiere descuidar. Marcela ingresa al grupo hace 3 años, por invitación de una de sus amigas y manifiesta que le gusta la forma de trabajo, sobre todo compartir con sus amigas en cada reunión. Actualmente necesita el préstamo para seguir comprando mercadería, es decir, radios pequeñas ya que está pensando en dar a crédito.

Las demás integrantes del grupo tienen sus propios negocios como  la costura de prendas, venta de dulces, comida, repuestos de autos, muebles y alimento seco y requieren el préstamo para la compra de mercadería y materia prima.

loans.use: COMPRA DE MERCADERIA Y MATERIA PRIMA

loans.name: Villa Nueva Group

texts.es: El grupo “Villa Nueva” esta representado por la señora Silvia y conformada por 14 miembros que conforman un grupo relativamente nuevo con socias(os) muy responsables en sus pagos y unidos como lo han demostrado en sus reuniones previas. En general los socios se caracterizan en su trabajo por no dejarse vencer por ninguna adversidad porque saben que el fruto D. su trabajo servirá para darles a sus familias un mejor futuro, es por esta razón que requieren el financiamiento que ayudara en la adquisición D. materiales, mercadería, insumos y herramientas para hacer crecer sus negocios D. venta D. verduras, pan, comida, abarrotes, cosméticos por catálogos, coca medicinal, costura D. prendas D. vestir y la agricultura. La competencia a nivel comercial es alta pero la socias tienen mucha experiencia y saben como sacar adelante sus negocios ofreciendo productos variados y D. buena calidad. La socias van cursando su primer ciclo pero ya cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios por lo se comprometen a dar todo D. si para salir adelante con responsabilidad y unidad.
texts.en:
The “New Town” Group is represented by Sra. Silvia and has fourteen members. It is a relatively new group with members who show responsibility in their repayments and demonstrate in their meetings that they can work together. The strong work ethic of the group is shown by their desire not to let any adversity get in their way--they know that the fruit of their work will allow them to offer their families a better future. For this reason they require a loan to buy materials, merchandise, ingredients, and tools so that they can grow their businesses selling vegetables, bread, food, groceries, cosmetics by catalogue, medicinal coca, making clothing, and farming. There is a lot of competition, but the members have a great deal of experience and know how to make their businesses successful: by offering a variety of good-quality products. The members are taking out their first loan, but they already talk knowledgeably about group solidarity. They promise to work together responsibly and make every effort to help each other succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Ceferino

texts.es: El señor Ceferino M., tiene la edad de 55 años, habita en el barrio Los Martínez, junto a su esposa la cual trabaja y le apoya con los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen cuatro hijos, ya todos independientes, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y apoyar a sus hijos para que tengan un techo digno, don Ceferino desde hace 30 años se dedica a la agricultura la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , él inicio esta actividad con el apoyo de sus padres , los planes hacia un futuro es diversificar el cultivo . Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para mejorar el cultivo y poder vender la producción a mejor precio en el M.
texts.en:
Mr. Ceferino M., age 55, lives in the neighborhood of Los Martinez, together with his wife who works and helps with the expenses of their home. They have four children, all are independent. The plans for his family include improving their living conditions and supporting his children so they have a decent home. Mr. Ceferino has been working in agriculture for the past 30 years, the greatest difficulty that he has faced is his lack of financing. He started this work with the support of his parents, his plans for the future include diversifying his crops. With the loan, he is going to buy fertilizers and supplies that will help to improve his crops and allow him to sell his produce at a better price in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies and fertilizers to improve crop production

loans.name: Niño Divino Group

texts.es: El grupo “Niño Divino” esta representado por la señora Verónica Shirley  y conformado poe15 miembros los cuales se dedican a la venta D. comida, ropa, pan, perfumes y cosméticos por catalogo, abarrotes en tiendas propias, a la confección D. prendas D. vestir para varones y la atención en billares. La competencia a nivel comercial es alta pero la socias tienen mucha experiencia y saben como sacar adelante sus negocios ofreciendo productos variados y D. buena calidad. El crédito que han obtenido, es para aumentar su capital D. trabajo y emprender pequeños negocios para incrementar más sus ganancias, que se traduce en mejorar la calidad D. vida D. sus familias que día a día van mejorando mas, por ello están muy agradecidos por la confianza depositada para seguir trabajando con mas ganas. La socias van cursando su primer ciclo pero ya cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios por lo se comprometen a dar todo D. si para salir adelante con responsabilidad y unidad.
texts.en:
The group "Niño Divino" is represented by Sra. Veronica Shirley and maD. up of 15 members who are devoted to sales in the following categories: food, clothes, bread, perfumes and cosmetics through catalogues, groceries sold in their own stores, tailoring for men's clothing, and billiards services. Competition at a commercial level is high, but the partners have extensive experience and know how to get their businesses ahead by offering a variety of high quality products. The loan they have obtained is to expand their work capital and launch small businesses to further increase their gains. This translates into an improved quality of life for their families. They are very appreciative of this as well as the confidence that their investors put in them and it gives them motivation to continue working even harder. This is the first cycle the business partners are undergoing, but they are familiar with working as a unified group. They promise to give all they can to come out ahead with responsibility and unity.

Translated from Spanish by Colleen Godfrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for Operations

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah owns a small tailoring shop in Kayole. A mother of three, Hannah aspires to grow her business and become a fabric wholesaler. She has requested her first loan of Ksh. 20,000 in order to add to her stock of materials. Hannah dreams of educating her children to the highest level.  She describes herself as patient and hard-working.



Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add to her stock of materials

loans.name: Generacion 2009 Group

texts.es:
Diversos son las actividades económicas de las  integrantes del grupo “Generación 2009”,  como la venta comida (salchipapa), tienda de abarrotes, venta de pasteles, revistas, colorantes para ropa y pisos de goma. Ellas necesitan el préstamo para comprar mercadería e insumos y seguir operando en sus negocios.
“Generación 2009” es un grupo nuevo de 10 personas y son vecinas de la zona Los Andes, su presidenta es Verónica L. y espera trabajar mucho tiempo con la familia de Pro Mujer. Todas están dispuestas a cumplir los reglamentos internos de su grupo y los de la institución, además de capacitarse en todos las reuniones que vengan.
texts.en:
The Generación 2009 Group members own diverse businesses, such as food sales (salchipapas—Peruvian street food made of pan-fried sausages and French fries), general store, cake sales, magazines, clothing dyes, and rubber flooring. The members need a loan in order to purchase merchandise and supplies so that they can keep their businesses running.

Generación 2009 is a new group that is comprised of 10 members who are all neighbors in the Los Andes zone. Their president is Verónica L., and she hopes to work with the Pro Mujer family for a long time. They are all willing to comply with both the group and institute regulations, as well as receive training at all the scheduled meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise and supplies

loans.name: Jorge Luís

texts.es: El señor Jorge Luís T. L. , tiene la edad de 40 años , habita en el barrio , San José de los Ríos ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa , la cual trabaja y le apoya con las actividades agrícolas , ellos tienen un hijo de siete años de edad , el cual estudia su primaria , los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida , don Jorge desde hace ocho años se dedica a ala agricultura , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , él inicio esta activad con el apoyo de sus padres . Con  el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para aplicar al cultivo y poder tener una buena cosecha
texts.en:
Jorge Luís T. L., aged 40, is married and the father of a son, aged 7, who attends primary school. They live in the neighborhood of San José de los Ríos in the municipality of Ticuantepe. His wife works and supports him in his farm activities. They hope for a future with better living conditions.

Jorge has been a farmer for eight years. He began this activity with the help of his parents. His greatest challenge is lack of funding. Jorge will use his loan to buy fertilizers and other inputs to his cultivation and get a good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his cultivation

loans.name: Guadalupe Group

texts.es: El grupo “Guadalupe” esta representado por la señora Carmen Silvia y conformado por 16 socias las cuales van cursando ya su S. ciclo demostrando honestidad, responsabilidad y  sobre todo ganas D. salir adelante; la mayoría D. sus miembros se dedican a la venta D. comida, pan, empanadas, verduras, colchones abarrote y a actividades como la atención en centros D. estética, transporte D. pasajeros y al servicio D. limpieza. La competencia a nivel comercial es alta pero la socias tienen mucha experiencia y saben como sacar adelante sus negocios ofreciendo productos variados y D. buena calidad. El crédito que han obtenido, es para aumentar su capital D. trabajo adquiriendo mercaderías, insumos y materiales para seguir generando mejores ingresos que cada día se traducen en mejores oportunidades para sus familias, por ello están muy agradecidos por la confianza depositada para seguir trabajando con mas ganas con la institución.
texts.en:
The Guadalupe Group, represented by Ms. Carmen Silvia, is comprised of 16 members who are currently in their second loan cycle. They have demonstrated honesty, responsibility, and above all, the desire to get ahead. The majority of the group members sell bread, empanadas (stuffed pastry), vegetables, mattresses, and groceries. Other members work at a beauty salon, or proviD. cleaning or transportation services. Competition is high, but the members have lots of experience and they know how to move their businesses forward by offering a variety of high quality products. They need this loan in order to increase their working capital to purchase merchandise, supplies, and materials so that they can keep generating better profits, which translates into better opportunities for their families. For this reason, they are very grateful for the trust they have been given to keep working with the institution more vigorously.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Erminia

texts.en:
Erminia is a member of the Purple Christ communal bank. She is 59-years-old and just two months ago lost her husband. She has four children of 39,37, 27, and 23-years-old. Erminia is from Ayacucho where she went to a small school and learned sewing and dressmaking. When she finished she went to work in a sewing factory for 8 years. She learned a lot and decided to work out of her home making clothes and linens. 

In addition to her first job she decided to wash cloths by hand. To improve her productivity she used her savings to buy a washing machine. The sudden death of her husband has been very hard for Erminia. After his death she joined FINCA and accrued more capital that has helped bring her more customers. Erminia is requesting a loan of 1,200 soles to buy fabric materials to make curtains and furniture linens. Her dream is to have a successful sewing business.

loans.use: buy fabric materials to make curtains and furniture linens

loans.name: Gladys Rosa

texts.en:
Gladiy is a member of the Purple Christ communal bank. She is 42 years old and has 4 children 21, 20, 16, and 10 years old. Her youngest two children are studying in the nearby public school. Gladiy’s also has a disabled brother whom she also looks after, in addition to her children. Despite not being able to walk he has learned to make crafts out of leather and sheepskin. He taught Gladiy, who then worked making artisan goods for 12 years before she decided that she needed to spend more time looking after her children. However, after a few years, hard economic circumstances required her to return to making crafts. She says she enjoys creating the chests, decorations, and other memorabilia.

Since Gladiy has joined FINCA her economic situation has improved greatly. She uses the loans to invest in more materials and the education of her children. Gladiy is requesting a loan of 1200 soles to buy more sheepskin, thread, and leather. Her dream is to someday have a workshop that produces fine leather goods.

loans.use: buy more sheepskin, thread, and leather

loans.name: Noemi Lourdes

texts.en:
Noemí is a member of the Purple Christ communal bank. She is 37 years old and has two children 13 and 9 years old. Both of her children are studying in the local public school. Noemí studied administration and took secretarial classes. After finishing her education, she worked in a law firm for two years until she was presented with an opportunity to work in Argentina. She had to return when her mother was diagnosed with a tumor, however, the operation was a success and the tumor was removed safely.

Noemí is dedicated to her husband and children and wants to return to work. This time she wants to have her own business selling school supplies. She is already successfully selling school supplies out of her home. Noemí feels that her personal and business goals are being met since she joined FINCA. Also, she says the support of fellow entrepreneurs has been inspirational for her.

Noemí is requesting a loan for 1600 soles to buy poster boards, mechanical pencils, and other school supplies. Her dream is to have a bookstore that sells school supplies and also functions as an internet café.

loans.use: buy poster boards, mechanical pencils, and other school supplies

loans.name: Maria Cecilia

texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Purple Christ communal bank. She is 36 years old and has a 20-year-old daughter who is married. Since she was four years old, she has been involved in selling second-hand clothes. Maria travels all over Peru buying a variety of second-hand clothes that she sells in the market when she returns. She also buys wines from the southern regions of Peru and sells them to neighbors, friends, and family.

Since she joined FINCA, she feels more self-sufficient because she is learning how to invest in her business and save. Maria needs a loan of 800 soles to travel and buy more clothes. Maria’s dream is to be able to work in another country with more opportunities.

loans.use: buy more used clothing for resale

loans.name: Sarita Angelica

texts.en:
Sarita is a member of the Purple Christ communal bank. She is 32 years old and has four children who are 14, 12, 10, and 4 years old. All her children go to the local public school. For 8 years, Sarita has been working with her mother selling comforters in her district. She also sells carbonated water and cleaning supplies.

Since Sarita joined FINCA she has learned to manage her savings and invest in her business. She wants to buy a computer for her children so that they can learn some computer skills and do their homework. Sarita needs a loan of 1,200 soles to buy rice, sugar, and oil which she also wants to start selling. Her dream is to move out of her parents’ house and have a house of her own for her family.

loans.use: buy rice, sugar, and oil for resale

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad is a member of the Purple Christ communal bank. She is 45 years-old, single, and has four children. Her two youngest children who are 28 and 14 years-old live with her the her youngest goes to school at the local public school. 

Soledad works out of her house and has several different trades making sacks, weaving sweaters, making woodcrafts, and selling fabric. She began her business selling sheets and comforters with money borrowed from FINCA. Her neighborhood is dangerous and says she is constantly cautious. Her greatest enjoyment is spending time with her kids. She says FINCA has been a tremendous help to her economically and that she is learning the value of saving. 

Soledad needs a loan for 1,200 soles to buy 10 more comforters and sheets. Her dream is to open a kindergarten for children on the land she has already bought.

loans.use: 10 more comforters and sheets

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Purple Christ communal bank. She is 52 years old and has two children who are 26 and 16 years old. Her youngest lives with her and goes to the local school. Juana is a teacher but decided to sell second-hand clothes that she gets from Chile and Guayaquil. She prefers to work with clothes and recently bought a sewing machine to make petticoats and skirts that she sells at local street markets. She wants to start making sports apparel, which is currently in trend, and begin selling to clothing stores.

She is requesting a loan of 3,000 soles to purchase 'tasian' and polyester fabric rolls. Since joining FINCA, Juana has learned to save and manage her business better. Her dream is to establish her own clothing business and eventually import and export her products.

loans.use: purchase 'tasian' and polyester fabric rolls

loans.name: Isabel Cristina

texts.en:
Isabel, 33, is a member of the Purple Christ communal bank. She has three children. The first two are 17 and 15 years old and go to school, but her last child is only 10 months old. Isabel studied cosmetics in school and started a job in that field after she finished her education. However, she quit that job because it did not pay very well, and with her savings she started a business selling parts and accessories for cell phones. She also started a small convenience store operating out of her house.

Since she has been with FINCA she says her life has been better, and she appreciates all of the loans she has been able to take out. Isabel now needs a loan of 1,600 soles to buy noodles, rice, oil, and beans which she wants to sell in her store. Her dream is to keep growing her business.

loans.use: To buy noodles, rice, oil, and beans which she wants to sell in her store

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
José is a member of the Purple Christ communal bank. He is married, 57 years-old, and has 5 children, three of which live with him and two of which are married. 

José works as a taxi driver but has recently started a new business selling accessories for parlor games. He sells chalk, gloves, and cases for billiards. He also does minor repairs on tables and pool cues. José says that since he joined FINCA he has learned to be responsible with loans and to value clients. 

José needs a loan of 2,000 soles to buy carpentry machinery to make more accessories and repairs. His dream is expand his business to sell sports accessories to stores and eventually become a distributor.

loans.use: buy carpentry machinery to make more accessories and repairs

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda G., 33 years old and  married, lives in Warri Delta State, Nigeria. She sells poly bags and is requesting the loan amount of N160,000 from Kiva lenders to purchase more bags to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more poly bags to sell.

loans.name: Señor De Acoria Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal Señor D. Acoria se encuentra, como su nombre lo indica en L. Comunidad D. Señor D. Acoria, distrito D. Acoria, departamento D. Huancavelica. Esta Comunidad está rodeada D. sombríos D. frutas como guinda, tuna, tumbo, etc. con zonas ganaderas y D. crianza D. truchas.

EstherfiL. es casada y tiene 03 hijos. EstherfiL. se dedica a L. crianza y ventas D. truchas. ElL. comenzó este negocio con un pequeña cantidad D. ellas, ahora su criadero es mucho mas granD.. ElL. solicita un préstamo D. S/.1,000 con los cuales va comprar truchas hembras, con las cuales haría reproducir aun mas su criadero.

Ninfa es casada y tiene 02 hijos. Ninfa se dedica a vender bollos y empanadas en forma ambulatoria, conjuntamente con L. venta D. abarrotes. Ninfa, solita un préstamo D. S/200 con los cuales comprará productos D. primera necesitad para abastecer su puesto D. abarrotes.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Señor D. Acoria" is, as the name indicates, composed of members living in the neighborhood of Señor D. Acoria in the district of Acoria, department of Huancavelica. This neighborhood is surrounded by shady orchards which produce cherries, prickly pears, passion fruit, etc, as well as by cattle-breeding areas and trout farms.

EstherfiL. is married with three children. She farms and sells trout. She began this activity with a small amount of trout and now her farm is much larger. EstherfiL. applies for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles (US$338) which she will invest in female trout and expand her farm.

Ninfa is married with two children. She is a traveling seller of bread rolls and pies. In addition, she sells groceries. Ninfa solicits a loan of 200 nuevos soles (US$68) which she will use to buy bare necessities to supply her grocery.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The members of the communal bank "Señor de Acoria" solicit a loan of 9000 nuevos soles to invest in their businesses

loans.name: Anasoronye

texts.en: Anasoronye, 43 years old and married with six children, sells secondhand clothes. She is requesting the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. She thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes, 50 years old and married with one child, sells cosmetics. She is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more cosmetics to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Oghale

texts.en: Oghale is 36yrs old and married with 6 children. She lives in warri with her family. She sells fruits and she has been in business for the past 16 years. She is requesting for the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more fruits to sell. Thanks to kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits to sell

loans.name: Palomitas Blancas Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal “Palomitas Blancas” se encuentra en el Centro Focal “Los Andes”, se agruparon hace tres años, por la necesidad de contar con capital de trabajo para mejorar sus negocios. Una buena parte de las integrantes tiene el negocio de venta de medicina natural como jarabes hecho a base de eucalipto y miel, pomadas caceras para la piel, jarabes de uña de gato y otros,  una de las que se dedica  a la venta de estos productos es Roxana A. hace 10 años, ella trae su mercadería de Perú y vende en diferentes ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y La Paz, en esta ocasión requiere del préstamo para la compra de mercadería.

Otra buena parte de las integrantes del grupo se dedican a la confección de  prendas de vestir como chamarras, faldas, camisas y necesitan el préstamo para comprar tela,forro o hacer mantenimiento a sus máquinas de costura.
texts.en:
The Community Association “Palomitas Blancas” (Little White Doves) is located in the regional center of “Los Andes”. The members joined together three years ago because they needed working capital to improve their businesses.

Most of the members have businesses selling natural medicines such as syrups made of eucalyptus and honey, homemade skin creams, cat’s claw elixir, and other remedies. One member who has been selling these products is Roxana A., who has been in business for 10 years. She brings in her merchandise from Peru and sells them at different fairs in the cities of El Alto and La Paz. At the moment, she needs a loan to buy more merchandise.

Other members of the group manufacture clothing such as jackets, skirts, and shirts. They need a loan to buy fabric and lining, as well as pay for repairs and maintenance of their sewing machines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise & raw materials

loans.name: Ermine

texts.en: Ermine, 43 years old and married with two children, lives in Warri with her family. She sells air fresheners and insect killers.  She hopes for the loan amount of N80000 to purchase more air fresheners to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more air fresheners to selll

loans.name: Julie

texts.en: Julie, 33 years old and single, is a stylist who has been in business for the past 11 years. She is requesting  the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more hair extensions and hair creams to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and hair creams to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria, 43 years old and married with eight children, sells provisions and foodstuffs. She is requesting a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase a refrigerator for the cooling of drinks and provisions to sell. She thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary, 41 years old and married with two children, has been selling medicine for many years. She is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more medicine to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es: Fredy tiene 23 años, es un joven muy amable y feliz, vive en la casa de sus padres, a quienes desea dar una vejez tranquila. Ser repartidor de gas para Fredy es un trabajo digno, que le permite no sólo ganar el dinero necesario, sino también terminar sus estudios técnicos. Él es un repartidor muy rápido y eficiente, lo que ha hecho que se convierta en el principal repartidor de su sucursal y la mano derecha de su jefe. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es salir con la moto a distribuir sus pedidos, ya que aprovecha para pasear por las calles de la ciudad. Lleva 3 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es llevar los balones de gas a los pisos más altos de los edificios, ya que le es muy cansado. Para el futuro anhela tener su propia distribuidora de gas y así tener mejores ingresos económicos. Este es el quinto préstamo de Fredy con MFP y está muy contento por haberlo obtenido, ya que piensa invertirlo bien. En su banco comunal es una persona muy respetada, ya que siempre pone orden en el grupo. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados planea hacerse socio de la sucursal donde trabaja, porque siente que ya es hora de pensar en aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Fredy is 23 years of age and a happy and good-natured young man. He lives at home with parents and would like nothing more than to give them a peaceful retirement. Fredy delivers gas in order to earn money so that he can complete his technical studies. He is very fast and efficient, which has led him to being promoted to the position of primary distributor of his branch and the right hand of his boss. What he likes most about his job is that he gets to make his deliveries on a motorbike instead of having to walk through the streets of the city. He has been in this business for 3 years, and he believes the most difficult part of his job is carrying gas tanks to the upper floors of buildings, which easily makes him tired. In the future, he would like to start his own gas distribution business so that he can make more money.

Fredy is happy to be receiving his 5th loan with MFP because he plans to invest it well. He is highly respected by the rest of his Communal Bank because he always brings order to the group. With his requested loan of 1000 soles, Fredy plans to become a member of the branch where he works because he feels it is time for him to consider increasing his profits.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital investment into his business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz tiene 23 años, es una joven muy alegre, vive en su propia casa y lo que más desea es salir adelante en la vida. El negocio de Liz es la venta de películas, canciones, documentales, dibujos animados, etc, en formato DVD, ella aprovecha las ferias dominicales de la ciudad de Juliaca para vender sus artículos, ya que sabe que existe una gran demanda por los DVDs y es un negocio muy rentable.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede decidir cuando trabaja y cuando no, ya que también tiene que dedicarle tiempo a sus estudios. Lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que llevar sus DVDs hasta las distintas ferias, pero sabe que ese es su trabajo y que tiene que cumplirlo. Para un futuro cercano desea tener una tienda de videos, con la cual obtenga mejores ingresos económicos. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y está dispuesta a pagarlo puntualmente, ya que no desea causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde participa activamente. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más DVDs, para ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.es:
En el departamento de León, la señora Rafaela M. dedica su tiempo a atender su negocio de venta de bisuterías tales como colas, aretes, prensadores para el cabello, pinturas de uña, entre otros.

Este negocio actualmente tiene ocho años de existir y en este lapso ella lo ha logrado suplir logrando la satisfacción de sus clientes. Es de importancia destacar que actualmente ella ha acudido a Ceprodel con el propósito de solicitar un crédito para la compra de las bisuterías y así continuar con su actividad.
texts.en:
In the District of León, Sra. Rafaela M. tends to her business selling various sundries such as costume jewelry, hair extensions, earrings, curling irons, nail polishes, and other items.

She has been in business for 8 years and managed to satisfy her customers. It is important to note that Sra. Rafaela has come to CEPRODEL to request a loan to purchase costume jewelry so that her business can continue.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase costume jewelry

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is 56years old and married with 7 children. She sells provisions. She has been in the business for the past 15 years. She is requesting for a loan amount of N140, 000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es: Marleni tiene 25 años, es una joven muy trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida. Su negocio de venta de ropa ha sido una actividad que le ha ayudado a obtener los ingresos necesarios para sostenerse por sí sola. A los 18 años decidió independizarse y salir de la casa de sus padres, y hoy es una de las vendedoras de ropa más solicitadas del mercado Tupac Amaru (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca). Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas de venta, lleva 5 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto de venta, ya que hace mucho frió, aun así sabe que ese es su trabajo y que tiene que cumplirlo. Para el futuro espera tener una tienda más grande donde pueda vender con más comodidad su mercadería. Este es el primer préstamo de Marleni con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo, en su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y responsable. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más ropa, para así incrementar la cantidad de mercadería que tiene en stock.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es:
En el departamento de León, la señora María Eugenia A. se dedica a la venta de bebidas como gaseosas de todo tipo de sabores ofrecidas por ella misma con el fin de llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación y así beneficiar a sus dos pequeños hijos ya que ella es una madre soltera.

El motivo por el que solicita el crédito es para invertirlo directamente en la compra de las bebidas gaseosas para proceder a su venta y así continuar con su actividad de ventas logrando satisfacer a los clientes proveyéndoles de las bebidas.
texts.en:
In the District of León, Sra. María Eugenia A. sells beverages such as sodas of various flavors. Her sales generate income for her household, which benefits her two small children. She is a single mother.

She is requesting a loan to purchase soft drinks for resale so that she can continue her business and satisfy her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
La señora Miriam R. S. por más de 15 años se ha dedicado a su negocio de venta de frutas y verduras en el departamento de León donde a diario vende los productos perecederos como frutas y verduras.

La razón por la que ha solicitado el crédito es para la compra de los perecederos como lo son tomates, cebollas, chiltomas, pitahayas, bananos, mamones, entre otros. Ella espera en que el crédito le será otorgado y así suplirá su pequeña venta de frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
Sra. Miriam R. S. has been selling fruits and vegetables in the District of León for over 15 years. Her perishable products are sold every day.

She has requested a loan so that she buy perishable items such as tomatoes, onions, peppers, pitahaya (cactus fruit), bananas, mamoncillos, and other items. She hopes that her loan will be approved so that she can purchase a small supply of fruits and vegetables to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits & vegetables

loans.name: Rosa Olivia

texts.es:
En el departamento de León, la señora Rosa P. se dedica a atender su pulpería la que ofrece todo tipo de productos tanto como comestibles, así como productos de uso domésticos. Ella ha buscado la manera de mejorar el negocio y para ello muy sabiamente ha solicitado un crédito para la compra de los productos y así comercializarlos en su establecimiento.

Con el crédito se beneficiará grandemente porque suplirá la pulpería de productos y así brindará un mejor servicio a sus clientes en su establecimiento.
texts.en:
In the department of León, Mrs. Rosa P. takes care of her small grocery store, which offers all kinds of products like food products and home-use products. She has looked for a way to improve her business and she has wisely requested a loan to buy products and sell them in her store. With the loan, she will benefit by supplying her grocery store with products and offering better services to her clients in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products for her grocery store

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria O., 39 years old and married with one child, lives in Warri with her family. She sells sarongs and is requesting the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma tiene 25 años, es una joven muy trabajadora, vive alquilada en un pequeño cuarto y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Su negocio son las llamadas por celular de forma ambulante, ella cuenta con 4 celulares, con los cuales trabaja muy bien, ya que es una persona muy persuasiva y siempre convence a sus clientes de realizar más llamadas de las planeadas. Su puesto ambulatorio está ubicado en una de las calles más céntricas de la ciudad de Juliaca, es por eso que siempre está muy ocupada atendiendo a la gente. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 2 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es tener que permanecer en la calle todo el día, ya que muchas veces las inclemencias del clima le juegan malas pasadas y la hacen enfermarse. Es por eso que para el futuro espera tener el dinero necesario para tener una tienda de abarrotes y un local estable para su locutorio ya que le gusta mucho el trabajo de las llamadas. Este es el quinto préstamo de Vilma con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo podrá acceder a otro con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará un nuevo celular, para que así sus clientes no tengan que esperar tanto por una llamada.
texts.en:
Vilma is 25 years old, and she is a hard-working youngster. She lives in a rented small room and what she wants most is to improve the quality of her life. She sells cell phone calls by traveling. She has 4 cell phones, which work very well. Because she is a very persuasive person, she always convinces her clients to make more calls than they had planned. Her traveling stand is located in one of the most central streets in the city of Juliaca. Because of this, she is always very busy taking care of her clients. What she likes most about her work is talking with her clients. She has spent 2 years in this activity, and she thinks that the most difficult part of her job remaining on the street all day, especially because many times the severity of the weather is bad and makes her sick. Because of this, in the future, she hopes to have the money necessary to have a grocery store and a stable location for her call center, since she enjoys this work. This is her fifth loan with MFP. She knows that if she repays her loan on time, she will be able to get another loan easily and without brining any complications to her community bank, where is well-liked by her peers. With the 1000 nuevos soles she has requested, she will buy a new cell phone, so that her clients don’t have to wait as long for a call.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cell phone

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Union Group

texts.es:
En uno de los Centros Focales de Pro Mujer “Santiago II” se encuentra la Asociación Comunal “Unión” que recientemente se organizaron y agruparon para acceder al préstamo, ya que la mayoría son madres de familia y necesitan generar ingresos que les perM. cubrir los gastos de su hogar.

Todas tienen diferentes negocios como la venta de jugos, café, comida, carne, víveres y material de reciclaje y necesitan el préstamo para la comprar de mercadería e insumos. A la cabeza de su presidenta Faustina G. y con el apoyo de la asesora de crédito (funcionaria de Pro Mujer) elaboran sus reglamentos internos y se comprometen a cumplirlos.

loans.use: COMPRA DE MERCADERIA E INSUMOS

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en: Philomena, 36 years old and married with five children, has been selling sarongs for the past seven years. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Ii Group

texts.es:
Florencia M. tiene 57 años y tiene el negocio de venta de regalos, ella compra vajillas, vasos, camas, peluches y otros y los adorna con papel de regalo en un embase sólido (cartón) y los vende cerca de locales, además tiene su puesto de venta en San Pedro. Ella se animó a ingresar al grupo “Nuevo Amanecer II” por invitación de unas vecinas y porque necesita del préstamo para comprar mercadería.

Roxana, Alicia, Carlota, Margarita y el resto de los integrantes de este grupo también tienen sus negocios como la venta de verduras, víveres, galletas, otras tejen prendas, pero todas necesitan el crédito para mejorar su negocio comprando mercadería y materia prima.
texts.en:
Florencia Madani, 57, sells gifts. She buys dishes, glasses, stuffed animals, and others. She puts them in cardboard containers and decorates them with gift paper. She sells them in nearby locations. She also has a sale’s location in San Pedro. She was motivated to join the Nuevo Amanecer II group by an invitation from a neighbor. She needs the loan to buy merchandise. Roxana, Alicia, Carlota, Margarita, and the rest of the group members also have businesses like selling vegetables, supplies, and crackers. Others knit clothes. They all need a loan to improve their business by purchasing merchandise and raw material.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise and raw material

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
El señor Oscar I. C. cuando compro su casa el empezó a construirla con apoyo de esta institución. El esta muy agradecido por el apoyo que le han brindado, por que con estos prestamos el comenzó  la construcción de su casita; aunque son pequeños los cuarto el prefiere vivir en un lugar que sea de el y no de renta. Ahora el recurre por que desde que compro su casa no ha escriturado el terreno por falta de dinero en este momento el quiere arreglar estos tramites por que quiere dejar todo en ley para cuando el empiece a faltar o su vejez ya no lo deje moverse y las personas que lo rodean tengan problemas sobre esto.
El siempre piensa en le bienestar de su familia y desea dejarles un buen patrimonio, su esposa y el trabajan para el sustento de la casa como también para darles mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
When Mr. Oscar I. C. bought his house, he began to build it with the support of this institution. He is very thankful for the support that they have offered him, because with these loans, he began building his small house. Even though the rooms are small, he prefers to live in a place that is his and is not rented. Now he is returning to the institution because since he bought his house, he has not executed the deed to the land because he lacked the money. At this time, he wants to complete these processes because he wants to do everything lawfully so that he doesn’t have to move because of a lack of money or old age. The people around him have had problems with this. He always thinks about the well-being of his family and wants to leave them with a good estate. He and his wife work to bring sustenance to the house and to give a good education to their children.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To execute the deed for his house

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jovanna

texts.es: Jovanna es una joven de 25 años que vive en la casa de sus padres. Hace un año y medio decidió ser independiente económicamente, para ello emprendió su propio negocio de venta de comida en su restaurante, donde su madre la apoya con la atención de los comensales. Su trabajo es de todos los días, incluyendo los domingos, ella misma cocina y ofrece a sus clientes platos muy bien preparados. Por las mañanas se abastece de los ingredientes necesarios para los almuerzos; y por la tarde, una vez terminadas sus ventas, limpia todos los platos y demás utensilios para el día siguiente. Aunque el trabajo es agotador, Jovanna lo disfruta mucho, además que es su propio negocio. Por tal motivo, se mira en el futuro con un mejor local y una mayor cantidad de clientes. Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es una socia activa de su banco comunal y su deseo es continuar con esta metodología de trabajo. El dinero que viene solicitando será destinado a la compra de comestibles no perecibles, al por mayor, y de bebidas gaseosas.
texts.en:
Jovana is 25 years old and lives with her parents. About a year and a half ago, she decided she wanted to become financially independent, so she launched her own business selling food from her restaurant. Her mother helps tend to the customers, while she does all the cooking. She works every day, including Sundays, and offers her clients well-prepared dishes. In the mornings, she stocks up on ingredients that she needs to prepare lunches. When the afternoons arrive, she closes down the shop and cleans all of the plates and utensils for the following day. Although the work is exhausting, Jovana enjoys it very much because she can call the business her own. To keep herself motivated, she plans in the future to find a better location and attract a greater number of customers.

Jovana is starting her third loan with MFP. She is an active member of her Communal Bank and hopes to continue working in the same manner. The money she is requesting will be used to purchase non-perishable ingredients wholesale, as well as soft drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for preparing meals

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es:
El señor Isidro O. es una persona emprendedora  desde hace 4 años el inicio como chofer de Transporte Escolar, ha ido progresando poco a poco ahora el ya tiene cuatro unidades, en las que también su esposa le ayuda y otros dos empleados para el traslado de cada niño. Aparte de ser un pequeño empresario también es generador de empleo ya que a sus dos empleados les paga por cada unidad.
Lo que nos llamo la atención de Isidro fue cuando en una plática nos comentó que tiene un proyecto llamado “Adopta un Niño”, este se trata de que le da apoyo al estudiante que no cuenta con dinero (bajos recursos) para el traslado a la escuela. Isidro preocupado por la Educación de cada niño; al comienzo del ciclo escolar con la ayuda del Director de la Escuela seleccionan al niño para que pueda entrar en este programa es una causa noble de parte de el ya que hay pocas personas que se preocupan por esto.
Ahora el recurre a nosotros pidiendo un préstamo para darle mantenimiento a sus 4 transportes ya que se vienen el inicio  a clases y el desea que sus unidades este en perfectas condiciones para la seguridad de las personas que lo abordan.
Aparte de esto el también quiere darle mejor calidad de vida a su familia; a sus dos hijos y al que viene en camino.
texts.en:
Sr. Isidro O. is an entrepreneur who has been operating a school transportation service for the past 4 years. His business has grown slowly over time, and now he has a fleet of 4 vehicles. This allows his wife and two other employees to help with transporting students. Being a small businessman, he has been able to provide employment for his two employees who are paid for each trip.

When we talked to Sr. Isidro, he mentioned that he started a program called “Adopt a Child” in which he provides free transportation to low-income students who cannot afford to pay for this service. Isidro is concerned about the education of each child. At the beginning of the school year, he meets with the School Director to select which students to accept into the program. For the few people who care about this situation, they feel this is a noble cause.

Sr. Isidro is now a requesting a loan in order to pay for maintenance of his 4 transport vehicles. With the start of classes, he wants his vehicles to be in perfect condition for the sake of his passengers’ safety. In addition, he wants to provide the best quality of life for his family. He and his wife are expecting two children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance of 4 school transportation vehicles

loans.name: Marlon Jose

texts.es: El señor Marlon José Velásquez Reynosa, tiene la edad de 46 años habita en  el barrio, buenos aires, ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa la cual trabaja y le apoya con los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen tres hijos, los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida y apoyar a sus hijos para que sean unos profesionales, desde hace 19 años se dedica a la agricultura , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , él inicio esta actividad con el apoyo de sus padres , el préstamo lo quiere para la comprar fertilizantes e insumos para aplicar al cultivo y lograr una buena cosecha. Lo cual será de muchos beneficios para sastifacer los gastos de su familia. Da las gracias a la institución por hacer posible el desarrollo de su negocio.
texts.en:
Sr. Marlon José Velásquez Reynosa is 46 years old and lives in the Buenos Aires neighborhood, which located in the town of Ticuantepe. Both he and his wife work and support one another with the household expenses. They have 3 children. Their future plans include improving their living conditions and supporting their children so that they can become professionals.

Sr. Marlon has worked as a farmer for 19 years. His greatest challenge has been a lack of financing. He began farming with the help of his parents. The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase fertilizers and supplies so that he can cultivate his crops for a good harvest, which will enable him to cover his family expenses. He thanks the Institution for making it possible for him to develop his business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & farming supplies

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es: Valentina tiene 35 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 17 años se dedica a la venta de la alfalfa que cultiva en sus tierras y de la leche que producen sus vacas. Todos los días se levanta muy temprano por la mañana para extraer la leche y limpiar su establo. Además, el guano que recoge le sirve como un fertilizante orgánico para sus tierras de cultivo. Adicionalmente, elabora quesos que ella misma vende, y con todas estas actividades logra sostener la economía familiar. Esta es la cuarta vez que Valentina tiene un crédito con MFP y tiene grandes deseos de continuar siendo parte de su banco comunal. El dinero que viene solicitando será invertido en la compra de sacos de abono y para el pago del transporte de sus cosechas desde sus chacras.

loans.use: Compra de abono y pago del transporte de sus productos

loans.name: Albina

texts.es: Albina tiene 43 años, vive con sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Ella es agricultora desde su niñez, desde hace 22 años se desempeña de manera independiente cultivando sus propias tierras y criando animales como cerdos, ovejas y toros. Albina se levanta todas las mañanas para cortar los pastos frescos para alimentar a sus animales o llevarlos a pastar, luego prepara los alimentos de su familia y posteriormente recorre sus tierras para verificar que las plantaciones estén en buen estado.
