De esta manera, se asegura una buena cosecha, la cual es vendida por grandes cantidades a diversos comerciantes o en ocasiones las vende ella directamente en los mercados de la ciudad. Albina tiene planes para el futuro de  mejorar su establo y poseer ganado de buena raza, la cual garantice sus ganancias. Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y está muy contenta de ser parte de su  banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de grandes cantidades de abono y semillas de papa.
texts.en:
Albina is 43 years old and lives with her 4 children in their own home. She has been farming since she was a little girl. For 22 years, she has been managing her own land and raising animals such as pigs, sheep, and bulls. Albina wakes up every morning to feed her animals, either by cutting fresh grass for them to feed on or taking them out to graze. She then prepares food for her family and afterwards surveys her land to make sure her fields are in good condition. Her attentiveness helps to ensure a good harvest, since she sells in large quantities to various merchants or occasionally in the city market directly to customers. In the future, Albina plans to renovate her stable so that she can start raising pure-breed cattle to earn more profits.

This is Albina’s third loan with MFP. She is excited to be part of her Communal Bank. The money she is requesting will be used to purchase large quantities of fertilizer and potato seedlings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & seeds

loans.name: Pilar Jesus

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Jesús, pertenece al banco comunal “señor de la agonía - taray”, ubicado en el distrito de Taray a una hora de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 5 hijos (22,14,10,6,1) años de edad ella es casada tiene 42 años, ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta de verduras en el mercado central, ella tienen un terreno dónde produce maíz y verduras, al por mayor, la socia tiene este stand en el mercado desde muy temprano en la mañana hasta que la noche la sorprenda, también es una madre muy amorosa y dedicada a sus hijos, la socia requiere el dinero para poder comprar otros productos al por mayor y de este modo surtir su mercadería.

Nuestra socia se compromete en cumplir con el pago total de la deuda en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Jesús is a member of the Señor de la Agaonía - Taray Community Bank, which is located in the Taray district an hour from the city of Cusco. She has five children (22, 14, 10, 6, 1). She is 42 and married. She alternates her activities between her house and selling vegetables in the central market. She has a piece of land where she produces corn and vegetables wholesale. She is at her stand in the market from very early in the morning until the nightfall. She is also a very loving and devoted mother to her children. She needs the money to be able to buy other wholesale products to stock her merchandise. She promises to make all of her payments on time in order to completely repay the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more products to sell

loans.name: Eriberta

texts.es:
La socia Eriberta, pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de la Agonía de Taray”, situado en el distrito de Taray, a 1 hora de la misma ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 43 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos, y alterna sus actividades del hogar y  la agricultura, con la compra y venta de artesanía, en los mercados feriales de Pisac y de Taray, los días de feria a los turistas que se dirigen al valle sagrado de los inkas. La socia requiere el préstamo en razón de invertir en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de artesanía y para comprar otras artesanías y así alternar sus productos.

La socia se muestra muy agradecida y ratifica su compromiso de cumplir con sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

loans.use: Capital para comprar insumos  para la elaboración de artesanía.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Francisca, pertenece al banco comunal “señor de la agonía - taray”, ubicado en el distrito de Taray a una hora de la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia es casada tiene 4 hijos (26,24,14,9) años de edad, la socia alterna sus actividades con la artesanía al por mayor y por menor, en el mirador de Taray, este esta estratégicamente ubicado al entrar al valle sagrado de los inkas, desde este mirador se aprecia la hermosísima vista de los nevados y montañas y un poco del valle de los inkas, mientras el turista baja a tomar fotografías las artesanas ofrecen sus diversos productos, para lo cual esta socia requiere el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de la artesanía.

Nuestra socia se compromete a cumplir con el pago total de sus cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Francisca belongs to the Señor de la Agonía – Taray Community Bank, which is located in the Taray district an hour from the city of Cusco. She is married and has four children (26, 24, 14, 9). She alternates her activities of handicrafts for credit or for cash. The viewpoint of Taray is strategically located at the entrance to the sacred valley of the Incas. From this viewpoint you can see the beautiful sight of the snow covered mountains and a bit of the valley of the Incas. When the tourists come down to take photographs, the artisans offer their diverse products. That is why she needs a loan to be able to invest in buying supplies to make handicrafts. She promises to make all of her payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies to make handicrafts

loans.name: Bertha Luz

texts.es:
La señora Bertha, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y trabajo, Distrito D. Juanjui, Provincia D. Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 47 años y 04 hijos, 02 que aun dependen D. ella..

Bertha, anteriormente vendía abarrotes y mercería, viendo que no generaba muchos ingresos decidió implementar su propio taller D. costura, trabajo que en la actualidad sigue ejerciendo.
Lleva años dedicándose a la confección D. vestidos y poco a poco fue generando sus propios ingresos y ahorrando su dinero. Como tenia la habilidad  para la costura, no dudo en hacerlo y con el apoyo del Movimiento Manuela Ramos decidió implementar su propio Taller D. Costura, ubicado en su misma casa. Nos cuenta que le va muy en sus costuras, trabaja con pedidos que con anticipación sus clientes le solicitan. A quienes les atienD.  con la amabilidad y el carisma  que le caracteriza. 

 Uno D. sus sueños y meta por lograr, es implementar su propio taller D. confección, con nuevas maquinas, cambiando lo antiguo por lo nuevo.

Con el préstamo D. S/. 3,000.00, comprará telas en metros, D. diferentes especies y colores, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, hilos en carretes granD. y D. variados colores, agujas D. coser y D. maquina, alfileres, botones. 

Hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas D. alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.

loans.use: Comprará telas en metros, de diferentes especies y colores.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La señora Lucia es socia del Banco Comunal “Jesús de Nazareth”, ubicado en el en Centro poblado de López del distrito de Ilave, provincia de el Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y madre de 3 hijos, ella estudio educación primaria completa, vive   el  Centro poblado de Villa López.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace mas de 5 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para ganado menor.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, con este monto ella va adquirir ganado menor ovinos, además la Sra. Lucia también se dedica a la artesanías elaborando títeres de dedo.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Sra. Lucia is a member of the Communal Bank “Jesús de Nazareth”, which is located in the central town of López in the District of Ilave, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 45 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children. She has an elementary school education and lives in the town of Villa López. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for more than 5 years. Her first loan in the amount of 300 soles was used as capital to purchase small livestock. Today, she is requesting another loan of 1000 soles to buy sheep. In addition, Sra. Lucia makes handcrafted finger puppets. Her greatest desire is to continue working. She enjoys her savings and the timeliness of her loans.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheep

loans.name: Denny

texts.es:
La señora Denny, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 48 años y es madre de 04 hijos, los 03 que aun dependen de ella.

Ante la necesidad de aportar al ingreso económico de su hogar, motivada por su esposo, emprendieron su negocio de venta de ladrillos, iniciándose con un capital de 5,000.00, de las cuales poco a poco fue obteniendo muy buenos resultados desde un inicio por la calidad de sus ladrillos y la buena atención al cliente.
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y lleva 20 años dedicándose a la venta de ladrillos, ubicada en un fundo que tienen lejos de la ciudad y sus principales clientes son los vecinos, instituciones y clientes fijos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará  latas, para hornear sus ladrillos, parte del dinero también lo invertirá en el pago mensual de su personal. 

Hoy se siente muy feliz del trabajo que brinda y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por apoyar a personas como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Sra. Denny belongs to the Communal Bank “Honestidad y Trabajo” (Honesty and Work), which is located in the District of Juanjui, Mariscal Cáceres Province, Department of San Martín. She is 48 years old, married, and the mother of 4 children, of whom 3 are still dependent on her.

Since she needed a way to contribute to the household income, Sra. Denny was encouraged by her husband to start a business selling bricks. With startup capital of 5000 soles, she gradually started seeing good results from the beginning because of the quality of the bricks and her excellent customer service. Sra. Denny has been in business now for 20 years. She sells the bricks from her farm located far from the city. Her main clients are neighbors, institutions, and her repeat customers.

With her loan of 3000 soles, Sra. Denny will buy tin molds for baking bricks. Part of the money will also be used to pay her staff’s monthly salary.

She is very happy with the work of Manuela Ramos. She thanks the Institution for supporting people like her who want to work and get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase molds for baking bricks & pay for labor

loans.name: Dory

texts.es:
La señora Dory, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 46 años y 02 hijos que ya son independientes.

Dory, es una mujer trabajadora y Luchadora, se siente capaz de seguir a delante y trabajar con muchas ganas, esta muy contenta con el trabajo que realiza, ya que se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, vende en el Mercado Central de su Distrito y sus ventas le salen muy bien ya que es muy conocida por sus clientes.

 Nos cuenta que se inicio vendiendo verduras y poco a poco fue ahorrando, de esta manera es que decidió implementar su propio negocio.
Actualmente continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con lo que hace, también cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos. En su puesto, sus clientes  encuentran lo necesario para preparar sus ensaladas y jugos  es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con una sonrisa.

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,000.00, comprará sacos de naranjas, mandarinas, limones cidras, yucas y frutas en diferentes variedades propias de la región, plátanos en racimos para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes y encuentren lo que necesiten. 

Dory, expresa haber cumplido algunas de sus metas que tiene trazada en su vida. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a implementar su negocio y a desarrollarse como Mujer y Empresaria.

loans.use: Comprará sacos de naranjas, mandarinas, limones cidras, yucas y frutas en diferentes variedades

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es:
La socia Maria, pertenece al banco comunal “Señor D. la Agonía D. Taray”, situado en el distrito D. Taray, a 1 hora D. la misma ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene  56 años D. edad, tiene 5 hijos (40,38, 33, 30, 15) y alterna sus actividades del hogar y  la docencia, ella es profesora en san salvador y tiene a su ves una tienda D. abarrotes en Taray. La socia requiere el préstamo en razón D. invertir en la compra D. productos para implementar su tienda D. abarrotes.

La socia se muestra muy agradecida y ratifica su compromiso D. cumplir con sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the community hank "Señor D. la Agonía D. Taray," which is in the Taray district, one hour from the city of Cusco. Maria is 56 years old, had five children ages 40,38, 33, 30 and 15, and alternates between her responsibilities of taking care of her home and of teaching. She is a professor is San Salvador and has a grocery store in Taray. Maria requests the loan to invest it in the purchase of products to put in her grocery store. She is very appreciative and has ratified her promise to complete her repayment in the time specified.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest into the grocery store

loans.name: Elena De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Elena D. Jesús, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, Distrito D. Juanjui, Provincia D. Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Viuda, tiene 74 años y 07 hijos ya independientes.

Elena D. Jesús, lleva varios años dedicándose a la costura, poco a poco fue generando sus propios ingresos y ahorrando su dinero, se dedica a arreglar pantalones, blusas y vestidos y nos cuenta que le va muy bien, se encuentra establecida en su misma casa, donD. atienD. a sus clientes.
Nos cuenta que le va muy en sus ventas, trabaja con pedidos D. sus clientes anticipadamente.
En la actualidad continua con su negocio y tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acuD. a su casa para realizar sus trabajos, es ella quien personalmente les atienD.  con la amabilidad que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo D. S/. 800.00, comprará telas en metros, D. diferentes especies, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, agujas D. coser y D. maquina, alfileres, botones. 

Elena D. Jesús, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas D. alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Sra. Elena D. Jesús is a member of the Communal Bank "Honestidad y Trabajo" (Honesty and Work), which is located in the District of Juanjui, Mariscal Cáceres Province, Department of San Martín. She is 74 years old, widowed, and has 7 adult children.

Elena D. Jesús has worked several years as a seamstress, gradually earning her own income and setting asiD. some savings. She makes trousers, blouses, and dresses. She says business is doing well. Her workshop is set up in her house, where she attends to her customers who place their orders in advance.

She continues with her business as usual. Her customers have demonstrated their loyalty by frequently returning to her home to place more orders. In return, she greets them personally with the warmth and kindness that she is known to display.

With her loan of 800 soles, she will buy meters of different fabrics, as well as tools and supplies such as scissors, hand sewing needles, sewing machine needles, pins, and buttons.

Today Elena D. Jesús is a very accomplished woman. She has more desire to achieve and realize her other dreams. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping her and other women start and grow their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics & sewing supplies

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juanita P. C. es una señora grande de edad y no por ello le impide ser una mujer  emprendedora y llena de ganas de trabajar y salir adelante. Desde hace tres años coloco un negocio en un cuarto de su casa con el deseo de hacerlo mas grande, la señora comenta que empezó con poco capital y con el tiempo las ganancias le permitirán surtir mas su tienda de abarrotes. Ahora ella muy preocupada por que su negocio prospere al igual que ella y su familia quiere invertirle para que así puedan ver más ganancias y seguir con su proyecto.
Su esposo es un agricultor de alfalfa  que la vende a otras partes de la ciudad y rancherías de por aquí cerca, su hija siempre esta al pendiente de ellos y con sus ingresos ayuda a los gastos que se tienen en la vivienda.

loans.use: Surtir su negocio de Abarrotes

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Isabel, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, Distrito D. Juanjui, Provincia D. Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, y tiene 03 hijos, los 01 que aun esta estudiando.

Isabel, con la edad que tiene es una mujer luchadora y eficiente, es Técnica en Farmacia y trabaja en el Hospital D. su Distrito. Con el anhelo D. tener un ingreso propio y teniendo los conocimientos en farmacia decidió implementar su propio negocio D. venta D. medicinas básicas, también se dedica a medir la presión y aplicar inyecciones. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y nos cuenta que le va muy bien, ya que es la única farmacia en la cuadra.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 3,000.00, comprará medicinas como: Aspirinas, tetuman, doloflan, dolocordialan, antigripales como: nastisol, vick vaporub, dristan calientes, mentoles y otras medicinas básicas.

Isabel, se siente una mujer tranquila y contenta con lo logrado. Desea asegurarse una vejez tranquila por lo que agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a cumplir sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Sra. Isabel belongs to the Communal Bank “Honestidad y Trabajo” (Honesty and Work), which is located in the District of Juanjui, Mariscal Cáceres Province, Department of San Martín. She is married and has three children, of whom one is currently a student.

Isabel is at the age where she has to be strong-willed and efficient. She works as a pharmacy technician at the district hospital. Wanting to earn her own income and utilize her pharmaceutical knowledge, she decided to start her own business selling basic medicines. She also performs blood pressure checks and administers injections. Isabel informs us that her business continues to operate and is doing quite well since it is the only pharmacy on the block.

With her loan of 3000 soles, she will buy medicines such as aspirin, tetanus vaccine, Doloflam (a regional brand of pain reliever), Dolocordralan (another brand of pain reliever), flu remedies (such as Nastizol, Vicks vapor rub, Dristan Hot, menthol, etc.), and other basic medicines.

Isabel is content and satisfied with what she has achieved. She hopes to earn enough so that she can live to a peaceful old age. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping her achieve her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase medicines

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La socia Martha, pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de la Agonía de Taray”, situado en el distrito de Taray, a 1 hora de la misma ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 41 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos (19,16.13.4) años de edad, ella es casada y alterna sus actividades del hogar con la artesanía, la socia se instaló en el mirador de Taray, ella hay vende sus artesanías a los turistas que bajan a tomar fotos desde el mirador aprovechando que tienen una hermosa vista del valle sagrado y los nevados, ella solicita el préstamo en razón de invertir en los insumos para la elaboración de sus artesanía.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Martha is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor de la Agonía de Taray” (Lord of Agony of Taray), which is located in the district of Taray, an hour away from the city of Cusco. She is 41 years old, married, and has 4 children (ages 19, 16, 13, and 4).

Martha divides her time between performing household chores and making handicrafts. Her vending post is situated near the “Mirador de Taray” (a view overlooking the Sacred Valley of the Incas), where she sells her handicrafts to tourists who come to take photographs of the landscape. From the Mirador, one can see the beautiful view of the Sacred Valley and the snow-capped mountains.

Martha is requesting a loan so that she can buy supplies used in making her handicrafts. She acknowledges and appreciates the help provided through her loan and agrees to complete her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for making handicrafts

loans.name: Jovita Elena

texts.es:
La señora Jovita Elena, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 36 años y es madre de 02 hijos, los 02 que aun dependen de ella.

Ante la necesidad de aportar al ingreso económico de su hogar, motivada por su esposo y la misma familia, emprendieron su negocio de venta de ladrillos, llamado “Ladrillera Gasparin” iniciándose con un capital de 2,000.00, de las cuales poco a poco fue obteniendo muy buenos resultados desde un inicio por la calidad de sus ladrillos, sus precios cómodos y la buena atención al cliente.
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio ubicada en su propia casa, donde sus principales clientes son los vecinos, instituciones y clientes fijos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará  latas, para hornear sus ladrillos, parte del dinero también lo invertirá en el pago mensual de su personal. 

Hoy se siente muy feliz de la labor y servicio que brinda y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por apoyar a personas como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante, espera que sigan así por mucho tiempo y ayuden a muchas familias y mujeres emprendedoras.
texts.en:
Sra. Jovita Elena belongs to the Communal Bank “Honestidad y Trabajo” (Honesty and Work), which is located in the District of Juanjui, Mariscal Cáceres Province, Department of San Martín. She is 36 years old, married, and the mother of 2 dependent children.

Since she needed a way to contribute to the household income, Sra. Jovita Elena was encouraged by her husband and family to start a business selling bricks called "Ladrillera Gasparin". With startup capital of 2000 soles, she gradually started seeing good results because of the quality of the bricks, affordable prices, and excellent customer service. She continues to operate her business out of her home. Her main clients are neighbors, institutions, and her repeat customers.

Sra. Jovita Elena is now requesting a loan of 3000 to buy tin molds for baking the bricks. Part of the money will also be used to pay her staff’s monthly salary.

Today, she is very happy with the service she has received. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping people like her who want to work and get ahead. Sra. Jovita Elena hopes the Institution will be around for a long time so that it can help many other families and women entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase molds for baking bricks & pay for labor

loans.name: Loisith

texts.es:
La señora Loisith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 42 años y 06 hijos, 05 que aun dependen de ella.

Con el fin de contribuir con los ingresos económicos de su hogar le nace la idea de aperturar un pequeño negocio de venta de comidas preparadas y poco a poco fue ganando experiencia en este tipo de actividad, y haciéndose muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes, sus ventas los realiza a partir de las 6:00 pm. cerca de un colegio y paradero de camionetas interprovinciales, donde hay mucho movimiento.
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio atendiendo a sus clientes que a diario acuden a su negocio y es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con su rica sazón y la amabilidad que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 3,000.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, verduras diversas,  huevos y pollos en javas. También comprará algunos utensilios de cocina, para reemplazar a los que tiene actualmente y así brindar un mejor servicio y atención a sus clientes. 

Loisith, se siente muy segura y con ganas de seguir adelante y asegurarse una  vida tranquila y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Sra. Loisith belongs to the Communal Bank “Honestidad y Trabajo” (Honesty and Work), which is located in the District of Juanjui, Mariscal Cáceres Province, Department of San Martín. She is 42 years old, married, and has 6 children, 5 of whom are still financially dependent on her.

In order to help with the household income, she came up with the idea of opening a small business selling prepared foods. She gradually gained experience in running her business and soon became known and well-liked by her customers. Her establishment opens at 6am and is located near a school. That particular area experiences a lot of traffic from the interprovincial cargo trucks that pass through the region.

Sra. Loisith continues to serve her customers who frequent her business on a daily basis. She greets them personally with the warmth and kindness that she is known to display.

With her loan of 3000 soles she will buy rice, sacks of sugar, a variety of vegetables, eggs, and cases of chicken. She will also purchase kitchen utensils to replace her current set so that she can provide better service and attention to her customers.

Sra. Loisith feels more secure, is eager to succeed, and has peace of mind thanks to the contribution of Manuela Ramos in helping her fulfill her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for preparing meals

loans.name: Lola

texts.es:
La señora Lola, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 32 años, 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Deseando ver profesional a sus hijos y tener sus propios ingresos para poder lograrlo, decidió emprender su propio negocio. Se dedica a la Venta de Comidas, hace 07 años atrás y los realiza viajando por los pueblos aledaños, junto con su esposo.
Aprovecha vender, en épocas festivas como: (fiestas patronales, fiestas patrias, san juan). Nos cuenta que sus ventas le salen muy bien y esta presente en cada evento festivo que se presente en su ciudad.
En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y le va muy bien, tiene sus clientes fijos y ya es conocida por sus clientes y por la buena sazón que le pone a sus comidas.

Con este préstamo de S/ 3,000.00, comprará insumos para sus preparados como: sacos de arroz y azúcar, pollos y huevos en javas, plátanos en racimos, fideos y aceites en docenas, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad.  

Se siente con muchas fuerzas para seguir con sus ventas de comidas, posteriormente desea implementar mas su negocio con un Restaurant bien acondicionado para brindar a sus clientes un mejor servicio y atención. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Señora Lola belongs to the "Uprightness and Work" Communal Bank in the District of Juanjui, Marshal Cáceres province, Department of San Martin. She lives in a shared home, is 32 years old and has 2 children that still depend on her. She would like her children to become professionals and have their own incomes. In order to help them achieve this, she decided to start her own business. She has been dedicated to the sale of foods for 7 years. She carries out her sales by travelling to the adjoining towns along with her husband. She takes advantage of festival periods,such as local holidays, independence days, & San Juan. She tells us that her sales turn out well and she is present at every festive event that is presented in their city. Currently, she continues with the same business and it goes very well. She has loyal clients and already is known by her clients and for the delicious seasonings that she puts in her foods. With this loan of 3,000 Soles she will buy supplies for her prepared foods, such as bags of rice and sugar, chickens and eggs in cartons, bananas in bunches, noodles and oil in dozens and also kitchen utensils in order to offer a better quality of service. She feels compelled to continue with her food sales. In the future she would like to augment her business with a well-furnished restaurant to offer her clients better service and attention. She thanks the Manuela Ramos group for contributing to the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies to prepare her foods for sale.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
La señora Lucy, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 49 años y es madre de 04 hijos, todos ellos ya independientes.

Con la seguridad de tener una buena sazón para la preparación de diferentes tipos de comidas, por iniciativa propia con  su primer crédito de S/. 300.00 emprendió su negocio de venta de comida, ubicado en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, en su misma casa.

Actualmente, lleva 05 años dedicándose a la venta de comidas y pese al tiempo transcurrido continúa con las fuerzas y ganas de seguir adelante, contando con una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acuden a su negocio de venta, donde ella los atiende con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como sacos de arroz, azúcar; aceites en paquetes, pollos en javas y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Se siente aun con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando y seguir adelante y asegurarse una  vejez tranquila. Lucy, agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Lucy is a member of the “Honestidad y Trabajo” (Integrity and Work) Village Bank in Juanjui District, Mariscal Cáceres Province, Department of San Martín. She is 49, has a common law husband, and is the mother of 4 children, all of whom are independent. On her own initiative, knowing that she had a touch for cooking different types of food, Lucy used her first loan for 300 soles to undertake her own food business, in a very well-equipped space in her home. She’s been selling food for 5 years and even after all this time she keeps going strong, and has the desire to move ahead. She has a loyal clientele that patronize her daily, and whom she serves with her characteristic charisma. Lucy plans to use this loan for 3,000 soles to buy ingredients for the daily preparation of her meals, including sacks of rice and sugar, cartons of oils, live chickens and items to run her business and provide better service to her customers. She feels like she has the spirit to keep on working and getting ahead in order to assure herself a peaceful old age. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for contributing to the fulfillment of her goals and dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to prepare her food.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La socia Sabina, pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de la Agonía de Taray”, situado en el distrito de Taray, a 1 hora de la misma ciudad del Cusco.

La socia  tienen 41 años de edad, ella tiene 4 hijos (22, 19, 15, 8 meses), la socia es casada y alterna sus labores del hogar con la artesanía, ella lleva hasta el mirador cada mañana sus productos para venderlos a los turistas, la socia aprovecha que este es un sitio obligado de paso para todos los visitantes que van en dirección a Calca, Pisac, Urubamba, Ollantaytambo y de hay continuarán a Machupicchu, la socia requiere el préstamo en razón de invertir en la compra de mayor número de artesanía para la venta.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el dinero prestado y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos mensuales en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
The member Sabina belongs to the community bank “Señor de la Agonía de Taray" located in the district of Taray, about an hour from the city of Cusco. The associate is 41 years old, has 4 children (22,19,15,and 8 months old). She is married and splits her time between house work and craft making. She takes her products to the vantage point every morning to sell to the tourists, she benefits from the fact that this is a place that every visitor needs to go by on the way to Calca, Pisac, Urubanda, Ollantaytambo and from there to Machupicchu. She is requesting the loan to invest in more crafts for resale. Our member is very thankful and appreciates the money that is lent to her and promises to comply with the monthly payments in the established time.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for the purchase of supplies for the making of crafts.

loans.name: Maria Eloisa

texts.es:
La señora María Eloisa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 41 años, es madre de 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

María Eloisa, lleva 05 años dedicándose a la confección de vestidos, anteriormente trabajaba en Educación y quedándose sin trabajo, decidió por ella misma implementar su propio taller de costura y teniendo la habilidad  para la costura no dudo en hacerlo. Poco a poco fue generando sus propios ingresos y ahorrando su dinero, se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado.
Nos cuenta que le va muy bien en sus confecciones, trabaja con pedidos que con anticipación sus clientes le solicitan. A quienes les  atiende  con la amabilidad y el carisma  que le caracteriza.  

 Uno de sus sueños y meta por lograr, es implementar su propio taller de confección, con nuevas maquinas, cambiando lo antiguo por lo nuevo y construir su propia casa, de esta manera brindar seguridad y comodidad a sus hijos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,800.00, comprará telas en metros, de diferentes especies y colores, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, hilos en carretes grande y de variados colores, agujas de coser y de maquina, alfileres, botones. 

Hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Señora María Eloisa belongs to the communal bank "Honestidad y Trabajo" ("Honesty and Work"), in the Juanjui district, Mariscal Cáceres provence, department of San Martín. She is single, 41 years old, and the mother of 2 children, who still depend on her. María Eloisa has dedicated the past 5 years to making and tailoring dresses. Before that, she worked in education. After losing her job, she made her mind up to start her own dressmaking workshop, and, since she already had the skills to make nice dresses, she did not hesitate to begin working on this goal. Bit by bit she has earned money and saved her income, working from within her own home, which is a pleasant working environment for her. She tells us that her dressmaking is going very well, and that she now receives orders ahead of time from customers who want her to make dresses for them. She treats all of her customers with her characteristic friendliness and charisma. Her dream, a goal which she continues striving to achieve, is to open her own proper dressmaking workshop, complete with new machines, switching out the old ones for new ones. She also hopes to complete building her own home, and by doing so provide security and comfort to her children. With this loan of 2,800 Soles, she will purchase meters of fabric of different types and colors, as well as instruments she uses in her dressmaking, such as scissors, large spools of thread in a variety of colors, sewing needles for hand and machine use, pins, and buttons. Today, she is a very satisfied woman, and she continues working hard to make a reality of the dreams she has not yet achieved. She gives her thanks to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her to get her business started, and also to the many women who wish to grow and succeed as business owners.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprará telas en metros, agujas, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Capital para comprar insumos  para la elaboración de artesanía.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys tiene 47 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa, vive en su propia casa junto a su querido hijo Roy de 16 años, quien es el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Su negocio es la venta de ropa, su puesto está ubicado en el mercado Tupac Amaru (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), ella vende lencería y es una de las vendedoras más solicitadas de dicho mercado, ya que los novedosos modelos que tiene en stock y los precios  accesibles que brinda a sus clientes, la han hecho muy conocida. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar sus clientes sobre los modelos que mejor les quedaran, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es tener que permanecer en su puesto de venta todo el día. Para el futuro espera que su negocio crezca y pueda tener una tienda de ropa donde pueda a tender a sus clientes con mayor comodidad. Este es el cuarto préstamo de Gladys con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y espera serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras socias, ya que es muy alegre. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más lencería para implementar mejor el stock de su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
Gladys is 47 years old and is a very loving mother. She lives in her own house with her beloved son, Roy, of 16 years, who is the reason for all her efforts. Her business is the sale of clothes. Her stall is located in the Tupac Amaru market (an important market of the city of Juliaca). She sells sports clothing and is one of the most requested saleswomen of said market, because of the unique styles that she has in stock and the reasonable prices that she offers her clients. She has become very well known. What she likes most about her work is advising her clients on the styles that best suit them. She has been doing this for 8 years and thinks that the most difficult part of her work is to have to remain in her stall all day. In the future she hopes that her business will grow and that she can have a clothing store where she would be able to tend her clients with greater comfort. This is Gladys's fourth loan with MFP. She has always been very punctual in her payments and we expect that she will be punctual now also. In her communal bank she is very well liked by the her companion associates, since she is a very positive person. With the thousand Soles requested she will buy more sports clothing to increase the stock for sale in her stall.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more sports clothing to sell in her stall.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria tiene 52 años, es una mujer muy tranquila y trabajadora, vive sola en su propia casa, ya que sus hijos dejaron el hogar hace algunos meses y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila. Su negocio es la venta de lencería, tiene su puesto en el mercado Tupac Amaru (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), el cual es muy concurrido por sus clientes, debido a los modelos novedosos que vende, el gran carisma que posee para vender y lo convincente de sus precios han hecho que su negocio vaya muy bien. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas de venta y comentar sobre las cosas que suceden en el mercado, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es traer la lencería desde la ciudad de Tacna, ya que es un viaje muy largo y cansado. Para un futuro anhela tener una tienda más grande donde pueda vender su mercadería con más comodidad. Este es el quinto préstamo de Victoria con MFP, se siente muy feliz de la oportunidad de crédito y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo. Ella es nueva en su banco comunal y ha sido bien recibida por el resto de las socias, por lo que se siente muy contenta. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más lencería para implementar mejor el stock de su tienda.
texts.en:
Victoria is 52 years old, and is a very tranquil and hard-working woman. She lives alone in her own house. Her children left home several months ago, and what she most wants now is to age in peace. Her business sells linen goods from a stall in the important Tupac Amaru Market in Juliaca, Peru. Her shop is much frequented by her customers for having the latest models, for her selling charisma, and for the convincing prices which have made her business do so well.

What she likes most about her work is chatting with her merchant neighbors and commenting about things that happen in the market. She has been selling linens for 20 years. The most difficult task, in her view, is bringing the linen goods from Tacna, a very long and tiring journey. Her future dream is to have a larger store where she can sell her merchandise with greater convenience.

This is Victoria's fifth loan with MFP. She is very happy for the credit opportunity and promises to make all payments on time. She is a new member of the community bank and has been well received by the rest of the members, for which she is very pleased. With the requested loan of $350 she will buy more linen-goods to better expand her store's stock.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: EXPANDING HER MERCHANDISE

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita B., from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin, is 43 years old and the married mother of four school-aged children. To make a living, Mercedita owns and operates a business in the manufacturing sector, its main source of income coming from making house furniture for sale in the local community. Mercedita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In May 2009, Mercedita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI, she is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to purchase materials for furniture making. This loan will be her second from HSPFI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials for furniture making

loans.name: Enecita

texts.en:
Enecita L. is from the village of Lilo-an, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old and married with 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Enecita makes household furniture to sell.  She has been doing so for over 5 years, earning about 2400 PHP monthly.

Enecita joined GDMPC in 2007 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Enecita has successfully repaid a 5000 PHP loan from GDMPC and is now requesting her third GDMPC loan of the same amount to purchase materials for making furniture. She will use the resulting income to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishmongers, and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase materials for making furniture.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina B. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin. She is a 43-year-old widow with 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Gina runs a food stall selling specialty food products. She has been in her business for over one year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

Gina joined HSPFI earlier this year in hopes of getting financial support to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina successfully repaid a 4,000 PHP loan from HSPFI and is now requesting a second loan, in the amount of 7,000 PHP, to purchase ingredients for her food business.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Vian John

texts.en:
Vian John Q. is from the village of Kinangay Sur, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 36 years old and married with 4 adult children. To make a living, Vian John provides motorcab services in the local community. Vian John has been in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

Vian John joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase equipment and he plans to improve and expand his business. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase equipment.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria C. is from the village of Magting, Mambajao Camiguin. She is 39 years old and married with 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Gloria makes and sells specialty food products. Gloria has in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

Gloria joined HSPFI earlier this year to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a 5,000 PHP loan and is now requesting a second loan for 7,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients needed to make her food products. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients for making food products.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva A. is from the village of Poblacion, Sagay Camiguin. She is 48 years old and married with 12 children. To make a living, Eva owns a sari-sari (variety) shop.  Eva has run the shop for over 4 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

Eva joined HSPFI earlier this year to gain access to financial services that would help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a 4000 PHP loan and is now requesting a second loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell so she can improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase additional products for her sari-sari shop.

loans.name: Ramón

texts.es:
El señor Ramón B. nació en la Colonia Genaro Romero en el año 1955, vive en el barrio de Isla Bogado de Luque desde hace mas de diez años.
 Es dueño de una pequeña farmacia, trabaja con los créditos de la Fundación Paraguaya desde el año 2003 y gracias al crédito pudo aumentar su inventario de medicamentos lo que le genero un mejor ingreso familiar a través de la comercialización de dichos productos en el vecindario.
 Tiene como meta poder ampliar su negocio para así poder abarcar una mayor cantidad de clientes, ya que cada vez hay más personas que gustan de ir a su farmacia por la buena atención y buenos precios.
texts.en:
Ramón B. was born in the Colonia Genaro Romero in 1955. He has lived in the Isla Bogado de Luque neighborhood for over ten years. He owns a small pharmacy. He has worked with loans from the Fundación Paraguaya since 2003. Thanks to loans he was able to increase his inventory of medicines. This generated better family income by selling these products in the neighborhood. His goal is to be able to expand his business by getting more customers. More and more people like to go to his pharmacy because of the good attention and good prices.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy medication and various products

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic M. is from Barangay Banquerohan, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental. She is forty-six years old and married with five school-age children. She and her husband dry fish and deliver them to regular clients. They also sell fresh fish in their community.  From this business they earn about $600 a month, which is not enough to meet the needs of their family. That is why the couple decided to join Project Dungganon, or NWTF, a field partner of Kiva.  The couple dreams of giving their children a better future.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy R. is from the village of Balbagon, Mambajao Camiguin. She is forty years old and married with four school-age children. To make a living, Joy owns and operates a "sari-sari", a retail shop that sells a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately $160 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Joy joined HSPFI, a Kiva field partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Joy is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene S. is from the village of Poblacion, Mambajao Camiguin. She is thirty years old and married with two school-age children. To make a living, Irene owns and operates a "sari-sari" (variety) retail shop. She sells a variety of different products to the local community. Irene has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $250 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Irene joined HSPFI, a Kiva field partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Irene is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Khut

texts.en:
Khut K. is married and has four children. He lives in Takeo Province. To make a living, he and his wife (pictured) are engaged in a business of selling hand-made brooms to his new and repeat customers in their provincial town as well as in other nearby villages, typically earning collectively $6 a day. The family is also assisted by one of his children who is currently employed in a local garment factory with a daily income of $2.

The world's financial crisis has affected businesses in Cambodia this past year. This factor has created a difficult economic year for much of the country, Khut included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, Khut is wanting to increase his income and improve his business. He is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike, a purchase that he sees as a great opportunity for generating a higher income and improving his family's standard of living. With a motorbike, he will be able to transport his products more easily to sell in neighboring villages.

loans.use: motorbike purchase

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
El Sra. Angélica E. S. S. tiene 39 años de edad, es soltera, no tiene hijos.
Desde hace 11 años atrás empezó con el negocio de venta de Artículos de Bazar y Ferretería, entre las cosas que comercializa en su bazar citamos: ropas para perros, casas de madera para perros, cintos y collares, cuadros, artículos varios para el hogar, además de artesanías hechas de cuero.
En principio comenzó con la madre, pero la misma tuvo que hacer un viaje en el extranjero por motivo de salud, por lo tanto la Sra. Angélica quedo a cargo del negocio, la cual tuvo mucho éxito y fue aumentando mes a mes su venta.
Con el crédito desea alquilar una Góndola en una de las mayores expo-ferias del país, que se realiza cada año. En esta expo-feria vienen personas de distintas partes del país e inclusive extranjeros. Es una excelente oportunidad para ella poder vender sus productos, especialmente los de cuero, que son bastante apreciados por los turistas.

loans.use: Para alquilar un puesto en una Expoferia.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.en:
Tomas M. is from the village of Mambajao Camiguin. He is twenty-nine years old and single with two school-age children. To make a living, Tomas owns and operates a service-based business, providing "motorela", (common public transportation in the Philippines via tricycle), to local community members. Tomas has been engaged in his business for over six years and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

In July of 2009, Tomas joined HSPFI, a Kiva field partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation by engaging in business activities. Tomas is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services he provides. This will be his first loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Phav

texts.en:
Phav B. is twenty-four years old and married with a young child. She lives with her husband in Takeo Province. To make a living, she and her husband are engaged in a business of selling hand-made brooms to her new and repeat customers in their provincial town and in the other nearby markets, typically earning $6 a day.
 
Cambodian hand-made brooms require hard work and a long time to manufacture the best quality for a competitive price at the markets. Moreover, the current economic situation in Cambodia is not favorable for her business. In spite of the country's economic difficulties, Phav wants to increase her income and expand her business. She is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase a new motorbike, which will give her the ability to transport her products more easily to sell in neighboring villages.  She hopes to generate more income and raise her family's standard of living.

loans.use: motorbike purchase

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en:
Arceli and her family live in the isolated village of Cabisera 25, Ilagan, Isabela. She is forty-four years old and married to Abelardo, also forty years old and a simple farmer. He also works as a driver.  They are blessed with three children, two of whom are in college, and the youngest is in elementary school.  Arceli wants to give the children a good education, so she keeps looking for business opportunities.  

Arceli manages a hog-raising business and wants to borrow PHP10,000 for additional business capital. She will use the loan to buy a supply of feed and vaccines for her hogs, especially for newborn piglets.  She usually sells them after five months, but when they are in need of money, they also sell them after four months.  Arceli is hoping to maintain her business, and the loan will allow her to purchase more piglets as replacements for the sold hogs.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy M. is from the village of Poblacion, Mambajao, Camiguin. She is forty-five years old and married with two school-age children. To make a living, Nancy owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, running a sari-sari (variety) shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Nancy has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately $62 a month from these activities.

In July of 2009, Nancy joined HSPFI, a Kiva field partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Nancy is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. Nancy plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: El

texts.en:
El Y. is forty-nine years old and a widow with four children. She lives with her children in Takeo Province. To make a living, she manufactures pillows, jars, and tubes made from cement which are used for construction building, typically earning $13 a day. The family is also assisted by one of her children who currently has his own business as a driver of his own car to provide transportation services for workers in the garment factory.

In order to meet growing market demand, El plans to expand her business and increase her income. She is asking for a loan of $600 to purchase tools to manufacture more products for her customers. She hopes she will be able to raise her family's standard of living and that she can encourage her children to seek further education at the university.

loans.use: tools for manufacturing cement tubes and jars

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hermelinda's Group

texts.es:
El comité “Oñondivepa” se formó con la unión varias vecinas de la ciudad de Villa Elisa. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, como son las ventas. Las integrantes constituyen un grupo muy solido y organizado.
Todas las integrantes del comité son madres que se dedican a varias actividades con el fin de fortalecer la economía de la casa y desarrollar sus emprendimientos de manera sustentable y con vistas a un crecimiento constante, con la ayuda de una asistencia financiera permanente.
Las integrantes solicitan el crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de mercaderías para las siguientes actividades comerciales:


Hermelinda Espínola	Venta de Ropas 
María Vicenta G.	Venta de frutas
Mara Yolanda Báez	Venta de frutas
Justa Pastora Báez	Despensa
Adelaida Báez Machado	Venta de cosméticos
Felicia M. Vera	Venta de Ropas
Andresa Báez	Venta de Ropas
Gloria Isabel L.	Venta de cartones de loteria
Feliciana O.	Venta de comidas
Elda Báez Báez	Venta de carbón
Rafaela R.	Costurera
María Lourdes N..	Despensa
Alcida A. 	Venta de ropas
Cristina A. Insfrán	Venta de Cosméticos
Sadi Raquel B.	Copetín
texts.en:
The Oñondivepa group is formed by the union of various neighbors in the city of Villa Elisa. All of the group members work at independent activities like sales. The members form a very unified and organized group. All of the group members are mothers who work at various activities in order to strengthen their homes' economy. They also work to develop their enterprises in a sustainable manner while looking to constantly grow. They do this with the help of continuing financial assistance. The members are asking for a loan to buy merchandise for the following activities: Hermelinda Espínola Sells Clothes María Vicenta G. Sells Fruit Mara Yolanda Báez Sells Fruit Justa Pastora Báez Small Market Adelaida Báez Machado Sells Cosmetics Felicia M. Vera Sells Clothes Andresa Báez Sells Clothes Gloria Isabel L. Sells Lottery Cards Feliciana O. Sells Food Elda Báez Báez Sells Charcoal Rafaela R. Seamstress María Lourdes N.. Small Market Alcida A. Sells Clothes Cristina A. Insfrán Sells Cosmetics Sadi Raquel B. Snack Bar

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes, cosmetics, fruit, various food items like rice, sugar, oil, and vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Marvic

texts.en:
Marvic M. is from the village of Artadi, Mambajao Camiguin. He is thirty years old and separated from his spouse. They have three school-age children. To make a living, Marvic owns and operates a business venture in the arts sector, running a handicraft business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling wood handicrafts to tourists and local community members. Marvic has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately $75 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Marvic joined HSPFI, a Kiva field partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation by engaging in business activities. Marvic is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts. This will be his first loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for the education of his children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Sem C., age 28, is married and has three school-aged children. She lives with her husband in Takeo Province. To make a living, she has to travel far to a market in the outskirts of Phnom Penh City to sell vegetables, typically earning a gross income of US $42 per day. Her husband also plays a major role in the family to generate a better source of income for his family. He is engaged in a business as a motor-taxi driver, providing his services to people in the city.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, C. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, C. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of US $500 to purchase a motorbike, a purchase that she sees as a great opportunity to transport her vegetables to sell and generate a better income to raise the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: For motorbike purchase

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is engaged in rice retailing and snack vending business in the village of Lorenzo Ilagan, Isabela. She sells her snacks in the public school and some of it includes: soups, noodles and banana cue.  She wanted her business to prosper and for it to happen, she is now asking for a business capital from Kiva lenders a loan amount of PHP5,000.00.  She will use it for the maintenance and improvement of  her small businesses for the welfare of her family.  

Adela is 24 years old and already married. She and her family are living in the simple and mountainous place of San Lorenzo. Their child is already studying in the elementary level and she and her husband are doing their best to have a better way of living.

loans.use: Business Improvement

loans.name: Maritchel

texts.en:
Maritchel A. is from the village of Poblacion, Mambajao Camiguin. She is 31 years old. Maritchel is separated from her spouse and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Maritchel owns & operates a business making & selling food.  The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Maritchel has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Maritchel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maritchel is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Maritchel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz R. is from the village of Lakas, Mambajao Camiguin. She is 58 years old. Luz is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Luz owns & operates a business venture in the service sector. The main source of income for the business comes from providing "vidoeke" or sing along rental in the local community. Luz has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Luz joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luz is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional materials needed to improved the services offered. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Luz from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials needed to improved the services offered

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula es una madre de familia de 43 años de edad que vive junto a sus dos hijos de 10 y 6 años de edad y con sus padres en el distrito de Santa Rosa, una zona netamente pesquera, ubicada a 25 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella se dedica al procesamiento y venta de pescado desde hace 25 años, compra pescado fresco en el terminal pesquero de la zona y lo procesa para que luego su esposo lo distribuya como pescado seco - salado en negocios de la sierra norte del Perú, en donde no se dispone de este producto de manera permanente.

Depende de este negocio para sustentar a su familia, sus hijos están estudiando en un colegio de la zona y sus padres, debido a su edad avanzada, también dependen de ella.

Paula está solicitando a nuestra institución un crédito de 2500 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de más pescado para seguir procesándolo y ampliar su negocio. Ella desea seguir educando a sus hijos y asegurarles un futuro mejor, así como brindarles a sus padres una mejor calidad de vida.

Ella ya ha trabajado con nosotros en cuatro oportunidades demostrando responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus pagos por lo que es considerada como una excelente cliente.
texts.en:
Paula is the mother of a family. She is 43 years old and lives with her two children that are 10 and 6 years old and with her parents. She lives in the Santa Rosa district, in the “Netamente Pesquera” (Clearly Fishery) zone that is located 25 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Paula has worked processing and selling fish for the last 25 years. She buys fresh fish in the fish market in her zone and she processes it so that later her husband can distribute her dried and salted fish. He sells the fish to businesses in the northern mountains of Peru where they don’t have this product on a regular basis. She depends on this business to sustain her family. Her children study in the school in this zone and her parents are of an advanced age and depend on her. Paula is asking for a loan from our institution for 2500 new soles that she wishes to use to buy more fish to process and thereby grow her business. She hopes to continue educating her children and secure a better future for them. She also would like to provide her parents with a better quality of life. She has worked with us four times and has demonstrated responsibility and punctuality with her payments. We consider her an excellent customer.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fresh fish to process and sell as dried fish.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
La señora Maribel, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 41 años, 02 hijos que aun depende de ella.

Maribel, lleva ya varios años dedicando al trabajo de tejidos, nos cuenta que desde muy pequeña, siempre le aficiono los tejidos y le encanta hacer estas manualidades. Para iniciarse mas a fondo en este negocio, decidió sacar un prestamo la cual Manuela Ramos la apoyo con su primer crédito de S/. 300.00, implemento su negocio y poco a poco fue haciéndose conocida.

En la Actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y ahora ya tiene una clientela fija que mes a mes realizan sus pedidos, ya que ella trabaja así y como también va ofreciendo a sus amigos, familiares y vecinos, le va muy bien y mensualmente genera sus propios ingresos y con el carisma que tiene sus ventas le salen a pedir de boca.

Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00, comprará materiales para realizar sus manualidades como: hilos tren, para tejer en docenas y diferentes colores y algunas telas para adornar sus acabados.

Maribel, se siente muy contenta por lo logrado, feliz por que en su negocio le va muy bien. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla en iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Sra. Maribel belongs to the Communal Bank “Honestidad y Trabajo” (Honesty and Work), which is located in the District of Juanjui, Mariscal Cáceres Province, Department of San Martín. She is 41 years old, married, and the mother of 2 dependent children.

Maribel has been making crocheted item for many years. She told us that when she was little, she had a fondness for knitting and enjoyed making things by hand. In order to start her business, she decided to seek assistance from Manuela Ramos and request her first loan of 300 soles. She used it to launch her business and gradually over time more people knew about her products.

Maribel’s business continues to run smoothly and she now has a steady clientele who place orders every month. Since she does good work, she has started getting referrals from friends, relatives, and neighbors. She has done so well that she is able to generate her own monthly income. Due to her charismatic personality, she is able to generate sales strictly through word of mouth.

With her loan of 500 soles, she will buy materials for making her handicrafts, such as skeins of different colored yarn and various fabrics to adorn the edges.

Maribel is very pleased with her accomplishments and happy that her business is doing very well. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her and other women start and grow their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making her handicrafts

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Rosario, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Está Casada, tiene 40 años, 05 hijos, los 05 que aun están bajo su poder y estudian.

Su fuerza  y anhelo de sacar adelante a sus hijos, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes, que se encuentra ubicado en su misma casa, un ambiente muy bien acondicionado para atender a sus clientes. 

Las ganancias que genera a diario le ayuda a mejorar el ingreso económico de su familia. Desde su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes y hoy en la actualidad tiene clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su negocio a comprar porque ella  tiene todo los productos  que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con la amabilidad y carisma que le caracteriza. Muy aparte Rosario, también cuenta con un consultorio, ya que ella de profesión es Odontóloga, cuenta con su propio consultorio.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,500.00, comprará sacos de arroz y azúcar, fideos, sal y aceite en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Rosario, se siente muy bien, para continuar trabajando y se prepara día a día para asumir los retos  que la vida le presenta y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosario belongs to the Communal Bank “Honestidad y Trabajo” (Honesty and Work), which is located in the District of Juanjui, Mariscal Cáceres Province, Department of San Martín. She is 40 years old, married, and the mother of 5 dependent children who are students.

Her strength and desire to see her children succeed motivated her to start her own business. She sells groceries out of her home, which is well equipped for accommodating her customers.

Her daily revenues help improve her family’s income. Since starting her business, she has been gaining customers and now has a regular clientele who come by her store every day to shop. Sra. Rosario carries all the products that housewives need and she personally attends to each customer with her kindness and charisma. She also has her own dental practice because she is an orthodontist by profession.

With her loan of 1500 soles, she will buy bags of rice and sugar, noodles, salt and oil in packets, boxes of canned fish of various brands, crates of eggs, and toiletries so that she can continue providing good service to her customers.

Sra. Rosario looks forward to working and preparing every day to meet the challenges life presents. She thanks Manuela Ramos for giving women like her opportunities to develop in the communities where they operate.
