Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase groceries to increase her inventory

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda G. is from the village of Mambajao Camiguin. She is 55 years old. Leonarda is separated from her spouse and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Leonarda owns & operates a business running a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of viands in the local community. Leonarda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In July 2009, Leonarda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonarda is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Leonarda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and supplement the income of the family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Jose Cipriano

texts.es:
José tiene 50 años de edad, es casado y vive con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos en el distrito de San José, una zona exclusivamente dedicada a la pesca, ubicado a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se ha dedicado durante casi toda su vida a la pesca artesanal, lo que logra pescar lo vende en el terminal pesquero de la ciudad de Santa Rosa y allí compra un tipo de pez cartilaginoso llamado raya para luego procesarla y venderla salada en los pueblos aledaños.

Su familia depende de este negocio para sustentarse y debido a que lo que perciben no es suficiente para cubrir sus necesidades, está solicitando un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de mas pescado para ampliar su negocio.

Su mas grande anhelo es poder brindarle a sus hijos un mejor futuro y seguir creciendo como comerciante hasta poder establecerse permanentemente en algún mercado cercano y desde allí vender su producto a sus clientes.

José es muy conocido por los vecinos de la zona que lo consideran un padre trabajador y que siempre quiere saca a su familia adelante, en la foto el está remendando su red para hacerse de nuevo a la mar y seguir ganándose el sustento diario.
texts.en:
José is 50 years old, married, and lives with his wife and four children in the district of San José, an area dedicated exclusively to fishing, which is located 20 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

José has spent most of his life fishing. He sells his catch from the fishing terminal in the city of Santa Rosa, where people by a type of shark called “stripe” that is salted and processed for resale in the surrounding towns. His family depends on his business to sustain themselves, but they don’t believe it is enough to meet their needs. Therefore, José is requesting a loan of 2000 soles to buy more fish so that he can grow his business.

He hopes to provide a better future for his children and continue to grow as an entrepreneur. He would like to have a permanent establishment in the nearby market where he can sell his products to his customers. José is well known by his neighbors in the area. They consider him to be a hardworking father who wants his family to succeed. In the photo, he is seen repairing a fishing net so that he can return to sea and continue his livelihood.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fish for processing & resale

loans.name: Enhtuya

texts.en:
Enhtuya C. is a 44-year-old, single mother of a 20-year-old son. She currently lives alone in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her son is a freshman in Chunnam University of South Korea.

Enhtuya has a small business in clothing retail. She rents a small stall in Narnii Titem, a large shopping center in the city, and sells various women's and men's clothes. As of today, she has rented two small stalls and sells clothes that she brings from Ereen, China, a border town, where many cheap Chinese products are imported from. She usually travels to Ereen once or twice a month to buy a new inventory of clothes for her business.

Since her start-up in 1993, she has been in the clothing retail business and has been quite successful. She says that she values education the most and therefore, she makes sure that her son receives the best possible education. She requests a loan to purchase more clothes for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
La señora Betty, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 38 años, 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Su fuerza  y anhelo de sacar adelante a sus hijos, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes, se encuentra ubicada en un local muy bien acondicionado, en su misma casa, para atender a sus clientes.
Las ganancias que genera ayuda al ingreso económico de su familia, desde su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes y hoy en la actualidad tiene clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su puesto a comprar porque ella  tiene todo los productos  que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo de S/ 2.500.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Betty, se siente con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando y prepararse día a día a lo que la vida se le presenta y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Sra. Betty is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Eucaliptos”, which is located in the District of Tarapoto, San Martín Province, Department of San Martín. She is 38 years old, married, and has 2 dependent children.

Her strength and desire to see her children succeed motivated her to start her own business selling groceries. Sra. Betty operates her store out of her home, which is well equipped for accommodating her customers.

Her daily revenues help improve her family’s income. Since starting her business, she has been gaining customers and now has a regular clientele who come by her store every day to shop. Sra. Betty carries all the products that housewives need and she welcomes each customer with her charismatic personality.

With her loan of 2500 soles, she will buy bags of rice and sugar, packaged noodles, different brands of canned fish, cartons of milk, crates of eggs, and toiletries so that she can continue providing good service to her customers.

Sra. Betty looks forward to working and preparing every day to meet the challenges life presents. She thanks Manuela Ramos for giving women like her opportunities to develop in the communities where they operate.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase groceries to increase her inventory

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a very religious person who considers God as the center of her life. She always tends to help anyone in her very simple way. She is now 50 years old and is residing in the big community of Calamagui 1st Ilagan, Isabela. She is married to Hermogeno who is also very busy driving their passenger tricycle.

Gloria has nine children; five of them are currently studying. She wishes to give them enough school allowances for them to be interested in finishing their studies and continue till college. With the help of the business she manages, she is also aspiring to improve their house because it is not yet completely done.

Having the amount of PHP 10,000 as additional business capital from KIVA lenders will enable Gloria to improve her business which is a general store. Her income from the business daily will be of great help in their house renovation and in sending her children to school. She is anticipating that through this loan, her business will expand and will become more profitable for the welfare of her family.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
La señora Irene, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 48 años y es madre de 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.

Tiene años dedicándose a este tipo de actividad, brindando servicios de movilidad urbana en su motokar. Para trabajarlo, su esposo se encarga de trasladarse por diferentes lugares de la Ciudad. Se inicio con el primer prestamo de Manuela Ramos, poco a poco fue ahorrando y con ese dinero fue comprando repuestos, para mejorar el servicio a los moradores de la comunidad.

 Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00,  comprará repuestos y aceites como: lubricantes, bocamasas, bujías; para así brindar un mejor servicio y atender mucho mejor al cliente.
Hoy en día es una mujer independiente, y es ella y su esposo quienes toman las decisiones y administran su negocio.

Irene nos cuenta: Que el pertenecer a un grupo de mujeres le ha ayudado a conocer mejor sus derechos y juntas  hacer que estas sean respetadas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Irene belongs to "Banco Comunal "Los Eucaliptos", District of Tarapoto, Province San Martin, Department of San Martin. She lives with her partner, she is 48 years old and the mother of 2 school-going children who still depend on her.

She has been offering urban transportation for years with her motorcycle. Her husband is in charge of driving it around different areas of the city. She started with the first loan from Manuela Ramos, little by little she saved money to buy spare parts in order to improve service to the inhabitants of the community.

With this loan of S/.1,000.00 she will buy spare parts and oils such as lubricants, "bocamasas", and spark plugs in order to offer better service to her customers. Today she is an independent lady and together with her husband they make the decisions and administer their business.

Irene tells us that belonging to a group of women has helped her to know her rights better and together they have made them be respected.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts and oils such as lubricants, "bocamasas" and spark plugs.

loans.name: Luzvin

texts.en:
At first, starting up a small business was impossible for Luzvin because she had no access to capital. Her husband's income as a laborer is sporadic and insufficient for the family's daily expenses; therefore, she thought she was stuck doing the household chores because there was no way she thought she could have money to finance a business until she learned about Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI) from women in their village.

Luzvin and her husband then agreed to take out a loan from ASHI to start up a business. Seven months ago, 23-year-old Luzvin discovered how an entrepreneur feels, running her own business. Using her loan from ASHI, she put up a small variety store right in their village. Her store offers people from the village convenience in buying their most basic commodities including retailing rice.

Presently, Luzvin's business has acquired a lot of customers and it requires a bigger amount of capital to finance the needs of her clientele. Because of this, Luzvin wants to get a larger loan since she has already repaid her previous loan on time and with a well-performing business. Her two children aged two and four are also excited about their mother's business. Luzvin is so excited to see her business grow with ASHI supporting her for the capital because she wants to send all her children to school up to college.

loans.use: Financing her rice retailing and variety store business

loans.name: Maria Isidora

texts.es:
María tiene 28 años, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos en el distrito de San José, una zona cuya principal actividad económica es la pesca, y que está ubicada a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace un año se dedica a la comercialización de pescado, el cual compra en el terminal pesquero de Santa Rosa, para procesarlo y luego venderlo como pescado salado en los pueblos cercanos.

Su familia depende de esta actividad para sostenerse, ya que su esposo, como la mayoría de hombres del lugar, se dedica a la pesca artesanal de manera eventual y durante las temporadas de veda la apoya en su pequeño negocio.

Ella desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más pescado, ya que usualmente sólo comercializan rayas, un pez cartilaginoso; esta vez ella desea alternar su mercancía con otras variedades de pescado, por este motivo se encuentra solicitando a nuestra institución un crédito de 1300 nuevos soles.

Su mas grande anhelo es poder brindarle a sus hijos un mejor futuro y también terminar de construir su hogar ya que está cerca a la playa y el frío puede afectar la salud de su familia.
texts.en:
María is 28 years old, married and lives with her husband and their three children in the district of San José, an area where fishing is the main economic activity. It is located 20 minutes from the town of Chiclayo.

For a year she has been selling fish which she buys at the fish terminal of Santa Rosa, she processes it and then sells it salted in the neighboring villages.

This activity represents the main family income as her husband is a local self-employed fisherman, as the majority of the local men, who fishes temporarily, and during the closed season supports her in her small business.

She wishes to increase business by purchasing more fish as she usually only commercializes ray which is a cartilaginous fish. She wants to alternate her merchandise with other varieties of fish and therefore she is requesting a loan of 1300 nuevos soles from our institution.

Her greatest desire is to be able to give her children a better future and also finish building her home as it is close to the beach and the cold may affect the health of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fresh fish to be processed and sold salted.

loans.name: Soronzonbold

texts.en:
Soronzonbold Banzrach is 43-year-old man and lives with his wife and 18-year-old daughter. He currently lives with his family in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His daughter is a high school student in a local high school and his wife is a teacher in a local kindergarten.

Soronzonbold has been in the trucking business since 1998. He owns an old Russian truck that he uses for carrying freight between his city and Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His family is very supportive of his business and helps whenever he needs some help.

Soronzonbold says that he works hard to make sure that his daughter receives good education without any financial strain. Further, he dreams of changing his old truck into a new, powerful one. He requests a loan to repair his old truck in order to carry on his business.

loans.use: to repair his old truck in order to carry on his business

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita J. is from the village of Calabayan, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old. Esterlita is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Esterlita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Esterlita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Esterlita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esterlita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds to raise. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Esterlita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income and for her children's school allowances.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds to raise

loans.name: Mrs. Thol Uong Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan group comprises eleven people from Prey Mul village in Takeo province. The loans are for various purposes.

Mrs. Thol U. is the forty-nine-year-old village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a one-hectare field of land for cultivating rice. Her husband, Mr. Yaem Sarun, is a fisherman. Mrs. Thol U. is requesting a loan to buy a boat and some fishnets to add her husband’s fishing business. She hopes to increase income and improve her family living conditions with this loan. She has four children, one of whom is a soldier while another owns a small business and yet another is a weaver.

Six members in this group have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly repayment loans. The end-of-term loans do not require any principal to be paid on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. They allow borrowers to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: Boat purchase

loans.name: Marcelita

texts.en:
Marcelita L. is from the village of Timogsay, Mambajao Camiguin. She is 41 years old. Marcelita is married and has 8 school-aged children. To make a living, Marcelita owns and operates a 'sari-sari' (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Marcelita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In July 2009, Marcelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marcelita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Marcelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Expedita

texts.en:
Expedita B. is from the village of Mambajao Camiguin. She is 49 years old. Expedita is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Expedita is starting up a business venture in the service sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing videoke rental in the local community. Expedita has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Expedita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Expedita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Expedita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to enhance the services offered. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Expedita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to enhance services offered

loans.name: Rubelyn

texts.en:
Rubelyn sacrifices a lot for the welfare of her child. She is 31 years old and intent on raising her child. She has two children but their elder is living with her parents since she could not support all their needs.

Rubelyn is engaged in the vending business. She sells different products like snacks and vegetables and other commodities that she can sell in order to earn a living. Her difficulties in life gave her the idea to take out a loan from Kiva lenders in the amount of PHP 5,000 that she can use as additional capital. This will give her the opportunity to improve her business.

Rubelyn is also planning to start a small poultry business in order to have another source of income aside from vending. She is not losing hope because she believes that thanks to the lenders, she can achieve her goals and provide the daily needs of her family.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Tserendugjir

texts.en: Tserendugjir S. is 51 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Kharkhorin, the capital city of the ancient Mongolian empire. Her husband works as a driver for the local electricity department, her son attends a local secondary school, and her daughter is a university student. Tserendugjir operates a small felt producing shop in the town along with 4 other people. Together they  produce a variety of felt products including slippers, bags, hats,  jackets and other handicrafts. The group uses only locally available materials  such as sheep and camel wool to make their products. Tserendugjir started her business in 2006 and has since found much success. She has taught all of her children how to make slippers and they help her during their school vacations. Tserendugjir is a very open-minded and responsible businesswoman and her dream is to one day have her own souvenir shop where she and other local handicraft makers can sell their products. She is requesting a 2 million tugrug (approx. $1,380 USD) loan to purchase wool processing equipment that will enable her to increase the productivity of her business and the quality of her products.

loans.use: to purchase wool processing equipment

loans.name: Lilia Nilia

texts.es:
La señora Lilia Nilia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 50 años y 02 hijos que aun dependen de ella.

Lilia Nilia, es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora, se siente capaz de seguir a delante y trabajar con muchas ganas y así hacer profesionales a sus hijos, esta muy contenta con el trabajo que realiza, ya que se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, vende en el Mercado Central de la Ciudad y sus ventas le salen muy bien ya que es muy conocida por sus clientes.

 Lleva 09 años dedicada y actualmente continúa con el mismo negocio, y esta muy contenta con lo que hace, también cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos. 

En su puesto, sus clientes encuentra lo necesario para preparar sus ensaladas y jugos  es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con una sonrisa.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,500.00, comprará sacos de naranjas, mandarinas, coconas, limones cidras, taperibas y frutas en diferentes variedades propias de la región y de otras partes del país para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes y así encuentren lo que necesiten. 

Lilia Nilia, expresa haber cumplido algunas de sus metas que tiene trazada en su vida. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a implementar su negocio y a desarrollarse en lo como Mujer y Empresaria.

loans.use: Comprará mas frutas de la region, para aumentar sus productos.

loans.name: Aida Soledad

texts.es:
Aida es una madre de familia de 54 años de edad que vive con su esposo y con sus tres hijos en el distrito de Eten, zona caracterizada por confeccionar artesanalmente sombreros de junco y que está ubicado a 25 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella lleva mas de tres años comercializando ropa, trabaja en base a pedidos y compra su mercancía en la ciudad de Lima o en la frontera con Ecuador, sus clientes son tanto personas naturales como negocios y establecimientos de su ciudad.

Aída trabaja arduamente y trata de salir adelante con su negocio porque desea crear una tienda en donde pueda vender sus productos sin tener que distribuirlos, por este motivo está solicitando a nuestra Institución un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Su mas grande anhelo es ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales y asegurarles un mejor futuro; es la segunda vez que trabaja con nosotros y ha demostrado ser una cliente responsable.
texts.en:
Aida is a 54-year-old mother who lives with her husband and their three children in the district of Eten, an area where the handmade production of reed hats is typical, located 5 minutes from the town of Chiclayo.

She has been selling clothes for more than three years, based on orders. She buys her merchandise in the city of Lima or at the border with Ecuador. Her customers are individuals as well as businesses and establishments of her town.´

Aida works hard and tries to get ahead with her business as she wishes to create a store where she can sell her products instead of distributing them and therefore she is requesting a loan of 2000 nuevos soles with our institution.

It is her greatest wish to see her children become professionals and assure them a better future. It is the second time she works with us and she has proven to be a responsible client.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothes for ladies, gentlemen, and children.

loans.name: Dumaa

texts.en:
Dumaa B. is 56 years old and lives with her husband and three sons in Kharkorin, the capital city of the ancient Mongolian empire. Her sons are all well educated, with the youngest currently attending university and the older two having already graduated. Her older sons currently work in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital city, as engineers.

Dumaa has been operating a felt production business in Kharkhorin since 2002. She produces a variety of felt products, such as slippers, bags, jackets, etc. She has improved her skills and gained much experience since starting, and her business has grown as 2-3 other producers have joined her.

Dumaa used profits from her business to build her family a warm and cozy winter home. Her future business goals are to introduce her handicraft products to as many customers as possible throughout her community and also target the many foreign people that visit during the tourist season. She is requesting an 840,000 tugrug (approx. $580 USD) loan to purchase wool-processing equipment, which is essential for her to improve her product's quality and make her production process more efficient.

loans.use: to purchase wool-processing equipment

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Maria Mercedes, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 37 años y es madre de 01 hijo,  que aun depende de ella y están estudiando.

María Mercedes, decidió vender sus comidas preparadas, en un local  muy bien acondicionado, ubicada afuera de su casa, ella nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas ventas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados, es conocida y tiene muy buena acogida, lleva 04 años dedicándose al negocio.

En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día, vende en las mañanas de 10:00 am a 2:00 pm. Es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo de S/ 3,000.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como arroz en kilos, azúcar; aceites en galones, sacos de papa, pollos en javas, verduras y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Se siente llena de vida y con ganas de seguir adelante aun, tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida, como implementar su propia tienda de abarrotes, bien  acondicionado y al mismo tiempo también agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Mercedes belongs to "Banco Comunal "Los Eucaliptos", District of Tarapoto, Province San Martin, Department of San Martin. She is 37 years old, lives with her partner and is the mother of 1 son who still depends on her and is a student.

Maria Mercedes decided to sell home-made food in well conditioned premises located outside her house. She tells us that daily sales are very good as the flavor of her food is excellent, she is well-known and very popular. She has had her business for 4 years.

Presently she continues with this business and she is very happy with her daily work, she sells in the mornings from 10 a.m to 2 p.m. She, personally, attends the customers with her charisma.

With this loan of S/3,000.00 she will buy supplies to prepare her daily dishes such as rice by the kilo, sugar, cooking oil by the gallon, sacks of potatoes, "javas" of chicken, vegetables as well as kitchenware to improve business and offer better service to her customers.

She feels full of life and eager to get ahead. She has many dreams and goals in her life such as starting her own grocery store, well adapted, and at the same time she is grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for supporting her with the set-up of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies to prepare food.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes A. is from the village of Letican, Mahinog Camiguin. She is 53 years old. Lourdes is married and has children. To make a living, Lourdes owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from baking cakes and other snacks to sell in the local community. Lourdes has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lourdes joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Lourdes from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Batchuluun

texts.en:
Batchuluun K. is 43 years old and lives with his wife, three children, and daughter-in-law in Chingeltei, a district of Mongolia's capital city, Ulaanbaatar. His eldest daughter currently attends nursing school and his youngest son is in the second grade.

Batchuluun operates a boot-selling business out of a stall at Narantuul, Ulaanbaatar's largest outdoor market. He has much experience as a skin and leather worker and his entire family knows how to sew boots. Working together, they are capable of producing five pairs per day. Batchuluun started his business in 1996 and has been very successful. His busy season is in the winter months as people buy warm shoes for the cold weather. He is able to produce and sells on average 100 to 110 pairs of boots per month.

Batchuluun is a very hardworking person and says, "I would like to improve and expand my family business so that I can buy a new ger (Mongolian nomadic tent) for my eldest son and his wife to live. I also want to improve the quality of life for my family". He is requesting a loan of 600,000 MNT to purchase raw materials such as leather and sole-rubber.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials such as leather and sole-rubber

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda P. is from the village of Pan-ay, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old, and married with three adult children. To make a living, Imelda owns and operates a bakery. The main source of income for the business comes from baking and selling bread in the local community. Imelda has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2004, Imelda joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imelda has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional baking ingredients. This loan will be her eighth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional baking ingredients

loans.name: Fenia

texts.en:
Fenia T. lives with her family in the rural village of Salvacion, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She and her husband have three children and they want to give them the best education they can afford. According to Fe, as she is commonly called, "Perseverance is one factor we need, to become successful in achieving our goals in life."

Fe is a vendor of cooked foods in their village. Her daily income in the business is carefully budgeted for their daily needs including the school allowance of her children. She wants to make her business profitable, and with this she in mind, is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 from Kiva lenders. She is also hoping to have a small eatery someday.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Mauri

texts.es:
La señora Mauri, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos”, Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia San Martin, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 56 años, es madre D. 02 hijos, los 02 ya independientes.

Mauri, lleva años dedicándose a la confección D. vestidos, poco a poco fue generando sus propios ingresos y ahorrando su dinero, queriendo así implementar su taller D. confección D. vestidos y como tenia la habilidad  para la costura, no dudo en hacerlo y con el apoyo del Movimiento Manuela Ramos decidió implementar su propio negocio ubicado en su misma casa.
Nos cuenta que le va muy en sus costuras, trabaja con pedidos que con anticipación sus clientes le solicitan. A quienes les  atienD.  con la amabilidad y el carisma  que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo D. S/. 800.00, comprará telas en metros, D. diferentes especies y colores, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, hilos en carretes granD. y D. variados colores, agujas D. coser y D. maquina, alfileres, botones. 

Hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas D. alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mauri belongs to "Banco Comunal "Los Eucaliptos", District of Tarapoto, Province of San Martin, Department of San Martin. She is married, 56 years old and a mother of 2 children both independent.

Mrs. Mauri has been a seamstress for years. Little by little she earned her own income and saved her money as she wanted to set up her own dress-making workshop. As she has the skills she did not hesitate in doing so and with the support of Movimiento Manuela Ramos she decided to start her own business located at her house.

She tells us that she is doing well as a seamstress, she works by orders from her customers whom she serves with kindness and charisma.

With this loan of S/.800.00 she will buy fabric of different kinds and colors, tools she uses such as scissors, thread on big reels and of varied colors, needles, pins, and bottons.

Today she feels like a fulfilled lady, who wants to reach and make all her dreams come true. She is grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her set up her business as well as to many women who want to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase material of different colors, thread and needles.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia’s priority in life is her family. She always wanted to give them a good future and this is the reason why she works diligently as a snack vendor. Aside from being a vegetable and snack vendor, Lilia is also a direct seller of Avon products, retails cell phone loads, and sells barbecue sticks in front of their house at night. She is really a jack of all trades.

Engaging in those businesses really needs a lot of effort but she does not get tired in providing the needs of her family, especially her children. To further improve her businesses, especially her vending where she earns higher income, Lilia is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 from Kiva lenders. She is hoping that through the loan, she can have a more stable business and have it grow.

Lilia is already 47 years old. She is married and her husband is one of the councilors in their village. They have four children: Jovito – 24 years old, already a college graduate and working as a mechanic in Manila; Joel – 21 years old, a college graduate and working as a cell phone technician; Junel – 18 years old, and Jeffrey - 15 years old are both studying. Lilia hopes that someday, all her children will have a good future.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Monica Maribel

texts.es:
La señora Mónica Maribel, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 36 años y 01 hija, que esta en el jardín y su gran orgullo por lo que trabaja muy duro.

Mónica Maribel, mujer que ha podido superar muchas dificultades en su camino de vida, las ganas de salir adelante le dieron buenos resultados y hoy en día con el negocio que maneja se siente muy contenta por lo logrado, se inicio vendiendo cosméticos de diferentes líneas como Unique, Esika, Leonisa y Avon, negocio con el que en la actualidad continua, lleva 03 años dedicada a sus productos de catálogos.

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,000.00, comprará productos de belleza para su stock como, perfumes para damas y caballeros, cremas, polvos compactos, lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas,  asimismo otra vitrina para exhibir  sus productos.

Mónica Maribel, con su madurez es un ejemplo a seguir de muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio y a otras mujeres a crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Señora Mónica Maribel belongs to the “Los Eucaliptos” Community Bank in the district of Tarapoto, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is 36 years old and lives with her partner. Her daughter is in kindergarten and is her pride and joy. She is the reason that Mónica Maribel works very hard. Mónica Maribel is a woman who has overcome many difficulties over the course of her life, but her desire to get ahead has allowed her to achieve much, and today she feels very pleased with what she has accomplished through her business. She started out selling different lines of cosmetics such as Unique, Esika, Leonisa, and Avon, and has been selling from catalogues for three years now. With this S/.2,000 loan, she will buy beauty products such as perfumes for men and women, creams, face powder, lipsticks, nail polish, as well as another display counter for the products. Because of her maturity, Mónica Maribel is an example for many women to follow as they start a business. She shows that with perseverance they can succeed in achieving their dreams. Mónica Maribel is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos organisation for helping her and other women start their own businesses and learn new business skills.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more products and increase her stock

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Forty-four year old Emily was just a business partner with her mother before she joined Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI) seven months ago. She used the first loan for the business with her mother. Her farmer husband supports some of their family's financial needs, while profits from the business were reinvested in the business and also used for the educational expenses of her only child.

After paying back the previous loan on time, Emily now would like a loan for a larger amount to enhance her variety store by buying additional items that are most needed by people in their village. Someday, she hopes that her business will increase through having sufficient capital. She also wishes to employ people to work with her in her business in the future, and that her child finishes his studies.

loans.use: To buy more products for her variety store business.

loans.name: Fidela

texts.en:
Fidela M. is from the village of Poblacion, Mahinog Camiguin. She is 56 years old. Fidela is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Fidela owns & operates a business venture in the service sector and does repairs. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing battery charging, repairs and other services for the local community members. Fidela has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Fidela joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fidela is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed for her repair service business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Fidela from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed for her repair service business.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 32 years old and she manages a general store business in their village in Calamgui 1st, Ilagan, Isabela. The village is accessible to the market so that Imelda can easily purchase groceries for her store in just a ride on a tricycle. Her income from the business is of great help in sending her three children to school. She knows that their needs are continuously growing and with that she will have to work hard and be patient in the business.  

For the continuous development of her store, Imelda is asking for financial assistance from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP6,000.00 as additional business capital.

Imelda hopes to have their own house because they are still living with her in-laws. Her husband also works hard for them to achieve their dreams. She is happy that her family is very cooperative in uplifting their life from poor living conditions.

loans.use: Additional capital.

loans.name: Enkhbat

texts.en:
Enkhbat S. is 50 years old and lives with his wife and two kids in Chingeltei, a district of Mongolia's capital city, Ulaanbaatar. His oldest daughter currently attends the State Education University and his youngest son is a 5th grade student. His wife, Enkhtuya, has worked as a surgery nurse at a maternity hospital for 20 years. Enkhbat operates a small food store business at a shop in his khashaa (yard) beside his home.

He named the store "Enkh-Uud" and explained that this is because both he and his wife's name include "enkh" in them. Enkhbat started his food store business in 2007 and it has been very successful. Today, his business capital exceeds 2.0 million Tugrugs. In the future, Enkhbat and his wife hope to grow their business to a level of sustainable activity. "Don’t worry about the loan repayment. I am good at record keeping", he said with a smile. He is requesting a 3.000.000 Tugrug  loan to buy food products and stationery goods to sell as the new school year quickly approaches..

loans.use: To buy food products and stationery goods.

loans.name: Mrs. Vith Daet Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The Mrs. Vith D. Village Bank Loan group consists of nine people and is located in Prey Mul village in Takeo province.

Mrs. Vith D. has been selected by the members as the village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a small plot of land on which she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Soth Soeun, is a fisherman. He wants to expand his fishing business to earn more income for his family. In order to help him increase his business, Mrs. Vith D. has decided to ask for a loan to buy more fishnets. The couple have four children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school, and two others who are too young to work or study.

Three members in this loan group have end-of-term loans and are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more fishnets

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
La señora Nelly, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia Tarapoto, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 41 años y es madre de 02 hijos, los 02 que  es estudiante y depende de ella.

Anteriormente Nelly, se dedicaba a trabajar, en un taller de costura. Pero su espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de Venta de Cosméticos de la línea Esika, CyZone, Avon y Unique, sin tener que tener un jefe y horario. Poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes, hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo de actividad. 

En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio  ubicado en su misma casa donde vende todo el día también sale  a ofrecer casa por casa los productos que vende  a sus amistades. Se siente muy contenta y tranquila con lo que hace.
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 2,200.00, comprará productos de catálogos como: perfumes y colonias refrescantes, cremas corporales y de rostro, labiales y polvos compactos, así de esta manera mantener a sus clientes satisfechos y contentos. 
  
Nellyta, como le dicen de cariño, se siente muy tranquila y contenta con lo que hace  y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.

loans.use: Comprará mas cosmeticos, para aumentar su stock

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle S. is from the village of Naasag, Mambajao Camiguin. She is 33 years old. Annabelle is separated from her spouse and has 3 school aged children. To make a living, Annabelle owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Annabelle has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

Annabelle joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Annabelle is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Annabelle from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Hotamdjon

texts.en:
D. Hotamdjon is 41 years old. He is married and has three children. Hotamdjon is a noble worker dedicated to raising animals, primarily cattle, which he buys and sells in the commercial city markets. This work is very agreeable to him, because raising animals is what he enjoys most. Hotamdjon requires a certain amount of money to increase the number of his cattle. His goal is to increase his livestock and thereby increase his household income, in addition to being solvent in order to continue working on buying and selling animals.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International"

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New Western culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase young cattle.

loans.name: Mrs. Yoeung Mok Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Thirteen people living I. Serei Duoch village I. Takeo province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purpose. Mrs. Yoeung M. is a 47- year-old village bank president. She is a vet I. the local village. Her husband, Mr. Sum Khorn, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. I. this plantation, he faces an obstacle because his field is infertile which it is a bad to affect to his crop. I. order to solve this problem, Mrs. Yoeung M. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field to make her crop more productive. She has three children, one of whom is a teacher I. the local school while another is employed I. a tailor and the remaining helps the parents work. 

Eleven members I. this group loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s maI. product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Erdenebileg

texts.en: Erdenebileg is 53 years old and lives with his wife in Mongolia's capital city, Ulaanbaatar. He has two children; his youngest daughter currently attends the Mongolian University of Agriculture. Erdenebileg graduated from an industrial training college in Russia, as a technician, mechanic, and master teacher in 1979. He has also worked as a translator for a tractor exporting company and as a teacher at a technical college. Erdenebileg currently operates an auto-repair business that specializes in diesel engined cars. He purchases car parts for his business from sellers in South Korea. Erdenebileg started his business in 1996 and has found much success. Today, his current business capital exceeds 4 million tugrugs and his average monthly income is 1.6 million tugrugs. With the success of his business, Erdenebilig was recently able to purchase a home for his  family. This enabled them to move out of their previous rented home. He, also currently pays tuition for his youngest. For the future, Erdenebileg says” I plan to expand business and increase my income so that I can renovate my new house”. Erdenebileg is requesting a 1.500.00 tugrug (approx. $1036 USD) loan  to purchase spare parts for diesel-engined cars.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for diesel-engined cars.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
For already ten years involvement in hog raising business, Marites continuously aspires to become a successful business woman someday. For now, she runs a livestock business where she raises hogs for sale. She is hoping to have capital in maintaining the said business because most of their income goes to the studies of their two children. She is grateful that their eldest had already graduated in nursing course. She just hopes to provide all of them the education they deserve to obtain a better future someday. In this regard, she is requesting from KIVA lenders the amount of PHP7, 000 as additional capital for her hog raising business. 


Marites is already 38 years old. She is married to Noel A. who operates a passenger tricycle in their community. They have three children namely: Richard - 21 years old; Sharon - 17 years old; and Chanda - 15 years old. Marites always prays for their good health because she believes that it is a very important factor one must possess while trying to attain each one’s dreams.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Nerfa

texts.es:
La señora Nerfa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 47 años, 03 hijos que aun depende de ella.

Nerfa, lleva 12 años dedicándose a la venta de ropa y zapatos, poco a poco fue generando sus propios ingresos y ahorrando su dinero, queriendo implementar su taller de confección de vestidos y teniendo habilidad  para la costura, no dudo en hacerlo y con el apoyo Manuela Ramos decidió implementar su propio negocio ubicado en su misma casa.
Nos cuenta que le va muy en sus ventas, trabaja con pedidos de sus clientes anticipadamente.

En la actualidad continua con sus confecciones de vestidos y tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acude a su casa para realizar sus trabajos y pedidos, es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con la amabilidad que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,500.00, comprará telas en metros, de diferentes especies, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, agujas de coser y de maquina, alfileres, botones. 

Nerfa, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.

loans.use: Comprará telas en metros, agujas, tijeras.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn L. hails from the island village in the town of Binangonan, Rizal province in the Philippines. She is 42 years old, and married to Alfredo, who is a 41 year old carpenter. She is a mother to four girls. All of her kids are still in elementary grades. She wants to bring her children out of poverty, and hopes for a better life for them.

In 2003, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, with a bagful of dreams to alleviate her family's poverty. She used her previous loans for various businesses, but now realizes that she needs to focus on a single business in order to excel. With her talent and two year background in sewing, she decided to focus on sewing, and she finds it very productive. She even receives and accepts orders from students for their school uniforms.

The sewing business brings her enough income for her family's needs. Now on her 8th loan, she is proposing to borrow a loan of 25,000 Pesos as additional capital for her sewing business. Specifically, the loan will be used to pay for one sewing machine that costs 9,000 pesos, 30 kilos of assorted cloths, sewing machine oil, needles, and labor.
She hopes that her business will grow and she is planning to expand it and hire manpower for easier and faster production. She also aspires of providing her children with a decent life. She also wants to renovate or repair her house so that it is a more spacious and durable one.

loans.use: To buy one sewing machine, 30 kilos of assorted cloths, sewing machine oil, needles, and labor.

loans.name: Rosa Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Victoria, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos”,  Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 40 años, 03 hijos; que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.

Su espíritu  luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes en muy pequeña cantidad y poco a poco fue ganando experiencia en este tipo de actividad y haciéndose muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes.  

En la actualidad tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acude a su tienda a comprar donde cuenta con todo lo necesario que el ama de casa necesita y es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, utensilios de aseo para el hogar y de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Rosa Victoria, se siente con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando y seguir adelante y asegurar un buen futuro para sus hijos, y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa Victoria belongs to the “Los Eucaliptos” Community Bank in the district of Tarapoto, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is single, 40 years old, and has three children whom she still supports. They are students. Rosa Victoria is characterized by a determined spirit. Her desire to get ahead through her own efforts has helped her start her own business selling groceries in small quantities. She gradually got experienced in this kind of work becoming well-known and well-liked by her customers. She now has a regular clientele who visit her store daily to buy whatever a housewife needs. Rosa Victoria serves them herself with her characteristic charisma. With this S/. 1,000 loan, she will buy rice, bags of sugar, packets of noodles, different brands of milk and canned fish, cleaning utensils for the home, and personal hygiene products so that she can continue to provide good service to her customers. Rosa Victoria feels strong and wants to continue working and making progress in her life. She wants to provide her children with a good future, and is grateful to the Manuela Ramos organisation for helping her realise her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy groceries for her store

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda I. is from the village of La Victoria, Aurora, Zamboanga del sur. She is 59 years old. Yolanda is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Yolanda owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Yolanda is just starting this business.

In 2007, Yolanda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yolanda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Yolanda is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Yolanda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

location.town: La Victoria, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Otgontuya

texts.fr: Otgontuya Buyannemkh is 40 years old and lives with her 2 children in Chingeltei district in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital city. Her youngest son, Munkhorgil, is 4 years old, and her oldest daughter, Enkhorgil, currently attends the Science and Technical University. Otgontuya's husband, Sengee, is currently living and working in Korea and sends the family money every month. Otgontuya currently operates underwear sales business at a rented stall at busy trade plaza in the city.  She started the business in 2006 and has been successful. Her business capital currently exceeds 2,000,000 tugrugs. She attributes the success of her business to her accurate record keeping and her attention to detail in her work. In the future, she hopes to use the profits from her business to save for her children's education and purchase an apartment for her family once her husband returns home.  Otgontuya is requesting a  900,000 tugrug ( approx. $622 USD) loan to purchase more underclothes for her business.

loans.use: To purchase fubrics

loans.name: Mr. Khom Tuon Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan which consists of seventeen people is located in Serei Duoch village in Takeo province. Mr. Khom T. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. He is a cow middleman. His wife, Mrs. Uoch Sung, is a farmer who owns 2-hectar field of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, she does not have enough money to expend on the rice field. Thus, Mr. Khom T. decided to ask for a loan to expend for plowing and to buy fertilizer to support the field. He is 37 years old and the father of four children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school while the others are too young to work or study. 

Four members in this group loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to expend for plowing and to buy fertilizer to support the field.

loans.name: Uranbold

texts.en:
Uranbold N. is 41 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Chingletei district in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His son and daughter both currently attend high school.

Along with his wife, Lkhagvaa, Uranbold operates a tea house. His business is very popular – it has many regular customers in the area and is a favorite among the local microbus drivers. Uranbold started his tea house in 2005 with capital of 230,000 MNT. He currently employs one cook and his wife helps out by keeping all the records of the business.

The tea house has been operating successfully for four years. Uranbold attributes his success as a businessman to his experience, soft temperament, and his helpful, hardworking nature. He hopes to use the continued success of the tea house to expand into a cafe, and he also wants to save for his children's education. Uranbold is requesting a 4,000,000 MNT loan to renovate his tea house into a cafe.

loans.use: To renovate his tea house into a cafe

loans.name: Violeta

texts.es:
La señora Violeta, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 28 años y 02 hijos que aun dependen de ella.

Anteriormente Violeta, se dedicaba a la venta de salchipapa, posteriormente cambio de negocio y se dedico a la venta de jugos donde estuvo trabajando 02 años consecutivos. Su fuerza  y anhelo de sacar adelante a sus 02 hijos y seguir generando sus propios ingresos le motivaron a emprender su negocio de venta de abarrotes, muy bien establecido que se encuentra ubicado en su misma casa en un ambiente acondicionado para atender a sus clientes. 
Las ganancias que genera a diario, la ayuda al ingreso económico  en su familia. 

Desde su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes y hoy en la actualidad tiene clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su casa a comprar y es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Violeta, se siente con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando, y prepararse para hacer frente a las adversidades de la vida  y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Señora Violeta belongs to the “Los Eucaliptos” Community Bank in the district of Tarapoto, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is married, 28 years old, and has two children who are still dependent on her. Violeta used to sell salchipapa (a dish made of hotdogs and French fries), and then later she sold juice drinks for two years. Her strength, her wish to help her two children get ahead and bring in an income of her own motivated her to take on a stable business selling groceries. It is located in her own house in nice surroundings where she can look after her customers. The income she earns on a daily basis helps the family financially. From the beginning she has increased her client base, and today she has regular customers who visit her home daily to buy what they need. Violeta serves them herself with her characteristic charisma. With the S/. 1200 loan, she plans to buy rice, bags of sugar, packets of noodles, different brands of milk and canned fish, eggs, and personal hygiene products so that she can continue to provide good service to her customers. Violeta feels strong and wants to continue working so that she is prepared to confront life’s adversities. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos organisation for giving women such as herself development opportunities in their communities.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more grocery products for her store

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky A. is from the village of Pigsag-an, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 36 years old, and is married with six school-aged children. To make a living, Vicky owns and operates a clothing business. The main source of income for the business comes from peddling new clothes to local community members. Vicky has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Vicky joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vicky has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be her third from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children's education.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Mrs. Channa Phen Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fourteen people living in Serei Duoch village in Takeo province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Channa P. is the 40-year-old village bank president. She owns a small business selling juice. Her husband, Mr. Mang Polo, is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he cultivates rice. In this plantation, he needs the money to buy fertilizer and gasoline to pump water to support the field. Thus, Mrs. Channa P. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. She has four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while another is attending the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study. (Mrs. Sorn MA. did not come to take the loan but her husband did, so he is in the picture instead her.) 

All the members in this group loan have end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan's term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and gasoline to pump water

loans.name: Boldbaatar

texts.en: Boldbaatar G. is 42 years old and lives with his wife and 2 children in Mongolia's capital city, Ulaanbaatar. Both his daughter and son currently attend secondary school.  He and his wife currently operate a clothing business out of a stall at Narantuul, Ulaanbaatar's largest outdoor market. Boldbaatar started the business in 2000 after moving his family to Ulaanbaatar. He is a very business-minded and hard-working entrepreneur, and has gained much selling and business experience since he started.  With his profits he has been able to expand his business and has found much success. Today, his business capital exceeds 2 million tugrugs and he operates with a profit margin of 30-40%.  In the future, Boldbaatar hopes to use the continued success of his business to build a house for his family and move them out of the ger (traditional nomadic tent) in which they currently live. He also must save for his children's future in the hope that they will one day attend university. Boldbaatar is requesting 2,500,000 tugrugs (approx. $1726 USD) to purchase clothing supplies.

loans.use: to purchase clothing supplies

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma M. is a 63-year-old business woman. She joined Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI) in 2005 wanting to start up her own business since her husband's livelihood was then unstable. Using her first loan from ASHI, she put up a small variety store that she has been able to sustain until now.

Three years ago, she used her loan for starting up a hog-fattening business (hog-raising business). Hog fattening is raising piglets for three to four months. After those months, the pigs have grown and they will be sold. Profit from this kind of business is double the amount of its capital. Piglets bought for Php 1,500 to Php 2,000 can be sold to Php 4,000 to Php 6,000 after four months. Norma started by raising two piglets. After that, the loans she accessed from ASHI were used for growing her later business. Profits she made from the hog fattening were re-invested in her variety store business.

Someday, Norma hopes to have bigger pig pen to raise many pigs for a bigger profit. Her ambition of growing her business and having more profits is because of her desire to have savings for her unemployed husband and herself in case of emergency, for she doesn't like her children to be financially bothered about them. She and her husband have been living alone together for many years since their children have had their own families.

loans.use: Financing her hog fattening (pig raising) and variety store businesses
